original: 'jig rten pa gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas mi rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa des ni dngos por brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos can nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa kho na phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas mi rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa des ni dngos por brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos can nyid du ma rtogs pa'i phyir thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa kho na phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: and the mundane person who does not understand the non-conceptual state by superimposing intrinsic identity, does not understand that things are false and deceptive, so it is reasonable to say that the Tathagata alone sees everything without error.

original: 'dir kha cig dag na re gang zhig 'bras bu'i don du skyes pa de ni rtag pa ma yin pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig dag na re gang zhig 'bras bu'i don du skyes pa de ni rtag pa ma yin pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: Here, some say: It is true that what is born for the sake of an effect is not permanent.

original: dngos po gang dag yan lag gnyi ga ma tshang ba 'di lta ste nam mkha' la sogs pa yid kyi mur thug pa dag dang / gang dag yan lag gcig ma tshang ba sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po gang dag yan lag gnyi ga ma tshang ba 'di lta ste nam mkha' la sogs pa yid kyi mur thug pa dag dang / gang dag yan lag gcig ma tshang ba sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: But those things that lack both parts, such as space and so on, which are the limit of the mental, and those that lack one part, such as the subtle particles of earth and so on, are permanent.

original: de dag gi yod pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid thugs su ma chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa @147b phyin ci ma log pa gzigs pa yang ma yin no zhes 'jor te //
analyzed: de dag gi yod pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid thugs su ma chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa @147b phyin ci ma log pa gzigs pa yang ma yin no zhes 'jor te //
translated: and that since they do not understand the existence and permanence of those, the TathƒÅgata is not one who sees without error.

original: de dag gi lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis /üîΩma brten par ni yod nyid med //
analyzed: de dag gi lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis / ma brten par ni yod nyid med //
translated: In order to show that their system is illogical, the master says:

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Without a basis, existence is not possible.üîΩThis shows that since pleasure, etc. are observed to exist in dependence on their causes and conditions, how could they be understood to exist without a basis?

original: 'dis bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta bu la rag las pa rnams yod pa nyid du dmigs nas don gyis go bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du ji ltar mi rtogs
analyzed: 'dis bde ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta bu la rag las pa rnams yod pa nyid du dmigs nas don gyis go bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa dag yod pa ma yin pa nyid du ji ltar mi rtogs
translated: How could they be understood to exist without a basis?

original: te / 'di ni ches gsal bar 'di dag nam mkha' autpala la sogs pa rnams ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid du rtogs par 'os pa nyid do //
analyzed: te / 'di ni ches gsal bar 'di dag nam mkha' autpala la sogs pa rnams ltar yod pa ma yin pa nyid du rtogs par 'os pa nyid do //
translated: This is very clear: they should be understood to be nonexistent, like a sky-lotus, etc.

original: gal te mi rtogs na ni ra ba rib can ltar nges par 'di la sgro btags pas byas pa'i lta ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba mngon bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi rtogs na ni ra ba rib can ltar nges par 'di la sgro btags pas byas pa'i lta ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba mngon bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not cognized, then like a fence covered in vines, the appearance of the view that is created by superimposition will be manifest.

original: de'i phyir ma brten par ni yod nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma brten par ni yod nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, existence is not independent.

original: tshul 'di yang yul dang dus dang dngos po tha dad pas tha dad pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi 'khrul lo zhes bshad ba ni /
analyzed: tshul 'di yang yul dang dus dang dngos po tha dad pas tha dad pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi 'khrul lo zhes bshad ba ni /
translated: This method is also not mistaken with respect to all things that are different due to being different places, times, and entities.

original: gang zhig gang na nam gyi tshe'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang na nam gyi tshe'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the line ‚ÄúAt any place, at any time.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is the case,

original: des na nam yang gang zhig tu'ang /
analyzed: des na nam yang gang zhig tu'ang /
translated: at any place, at any time,

original: rtag pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin te //
analyzed: rtag pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin te //
translated: there is no permanent thing at all.

original: phyed gong mas grub pa nyid phyed phyi mas mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: phyed gong mas grub pa nyid phyed phyi mas mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The first half establishes this, and the second half concludes.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i dngos po rten cing 'brel par ma byung ba dag la yod pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa nyid du grub bo
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i dngos po rten cing 'brel par ma byung ba dag la yod pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa nyid du grub bo
translated: When things imagined by others, which are not dependently arisen, do not exist as existent and do not exist as permanent, then the TathƒÅgata is established as seeing things without distortion.

original: // 'di ltar des na yod pa yod par mkhyen te gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: // 'di ltar des na yod pa yod par mkhyen te gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, he knows existence as existence, which is dependent origination.

original: yod pa ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin par te gzhan gyis kun brtags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin par te gzhan gyis kun brtags pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: He knows nonexistence as nonexistence, which is not dependent origination, the other imagined.

original: gang dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gnyis mngon bar 'byung ba dang / mi mngon par gyur pa tsam yin pas chen po la sogs pa la ma phyung ba las byung ba bsal nas mngon bar bsal ba tsam zhe la gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gnyis mngon bar 'byung ba dang / mi mngon par gyur pa tsam yin pas chen po la sogs pa la ma phyung ba las byung ba bsal nas mngon bar bsal ba tsam zhe la gzhag ste /
translated: Since origination and destruction are merely the manifestation and disappearance of things, they posit the great elements and so on as merely the manifestation of what was not previously manifest.

original: rtag pa nyid du rtogs shing 'ga' yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'dod pa de dag kyang bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du rtogs shing 'ga' yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi 'dod pa de dag kyang bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: Those who think that it is permanent and that nothing is dependently arisen do not escape the refutations already explained.

original: ci ste zhig bde ba la sogs pa rten cing 'brel @148a * //üîΩpar 'byung ba rnams ni yod la /
analyzed: ci ste zhig bde ba la sogs pa rten cing 'brel @148a * // par 'byung ba rnams ni yod la /
translated: If you say that pleasure and so on are dependently arisen,

original: bdag ni de rnams kyi 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni de rnams kyi 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: but the self is the cause that is the basis of their aggregation,

original: med pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical that the cause of that which does not exist is an aggregation.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig bdag yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig bdag yod do //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is observed, the self exists.

original: de yang rtag pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa zhig ste /
translated: Moreover, it is permanent.

original: yod la rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: yod la rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it does not possess a cause.

original: gang zhig yod cing de'i rgyu ma dmigs pa de ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yod cing de'i rgyu ma dmigs pa de ni rtag pa'o //
translated: That which exists and is not observed to have a cause is permanent.üîΩIf the self exists, then things that are of its type also exist.

original: bdag yod na ni de'i rigs can gyi dngos po rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro snyam na 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag yod na ni de'i rigs can gyi dngos po rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro snyam na 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: But this should be explained.

original: gal te bdag nyid yod par 'gyur na ni de ltar 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid yod par 'gyur na ni de ltar 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: If the self itself existed, then that would be so.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: Thus:

original: 'di ltar / rgyu med par ni dngos po med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyu med par ni dngos po med //

original: dngos po dang rang bzhin dang bdag dang rtag pa dang brtan pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: dngos po dang rang bzhin dang bdag dang rtag pa dang brtan pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs dag go //
translated: A thing, an intrinsic nature, a self, permanence, and stability are synonyms.

original: de ni rgyu med pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu med pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not possible without a cause.

original: 'di ltar pha rol po nyid kyis 'di rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid du khas len par byed na rgyu med pa can nyid du khas blangs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol po nyid kyis 'di rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid du khas len par byed na rgyu med pa can nyid du khas blangs la /
translated: If the opponent himself accepts that it is devoid of a cause, then he accepts that it is without a cause.

original: gang zhig rgyu med pa de ni bong bu'i rva la sogs pa ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu med pa de ni bong bu'i rva la sogs pa ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: And that which is without a cause does not exist, like the horns of an ass and so on.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is not established because of the non-determination by space and so on.

original: ma yin te de rnams kyi yod pa nyid kyang de kho na ltar 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de rnams kyi yod pa nyid kyang de kho na ltar 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the existence of those will be refuted in the same way.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas rgyu dang ldan pa nyid khas len par byed na de lta na yang 'di'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas rgyu dang ldan pa nyid khas len par byed na de lta na yang 'di'i rtag pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that it has a cause in order to avoid this fault, then its permanence is undermined.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For,

original: rgyu ldan rtag pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu ldan rtag pa yod ma yin //
translated: That which has a cause is not permanent.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because it has a cause, it is impermanent, like pleasure and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is so,üîΩThe Omniscient One has said that that which is established

original: des na rgyu med las grub ni //üîΩde nyid mkhyen pas grub min gsungs //
analyzed: des na rgyu med las grub ni // de nyid mkhyen pas grub min gsungs //
translated: Without a cause is not established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said:

original: mkhas pa bstan 'byung chos la lhag mos shing //
analyzed: mkhas pa bstan 'byung chos la lhag mos shing //
translated: The wise who are born from the teachings and who are devoted to the Dharma

original: mthar lta ba la rten par byed pa'ang min //
analyzed: mthar lta ba la rten par byed pa'ang min //
translated: Do not rely on the view of the extreme.

original: rgyu bcas rkyen bcas chos ni shes 'gyur te //
analyzed: rgyu bcas rkyen bcas chos ni shes 'gyur te //
translated: They know the Dharma that has causes and conditions,

original: rgyu med rkyen med chos nyid yod ma yin //üîΩzhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med rkyen med chos nyid yod ma yin // zhes pa gsungs so //
translated: But the nature of phenomena does not have causes and conditions.

original: bstan pa 'di la /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la /
translated: This is taught in the following:üîΩIn this teaching,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa dang rjes su 'brel pas de bzhin gshegs pa kho na don phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o @148b zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa dang rjes su 'brel pas de bzhin gshegs pa kho na don phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'o @148b zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since it is related to the previously explained logic, it is established that only the TathƒÅgata knows the meaning without error.

original: ci ste bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa byas pa'i don la mi rtag pa nyid dmigs nas /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa byas pa'i don la mi rtag pa nyid dmigs nas /
translated: If one observes impermanence in a produced object such as a pot or pleasure,

original: don gyis go bas bdag la sogs pa ma byas pa rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: don gyis go bas bdag la sogs pa ma byas pa rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then by implication, the self and so on would be permanent and unproduced.

original: 'di yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs te /

original: gang gi phyir bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa byas pa la yod pa nyid dmigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa byas pa la yod pa nyid dmigs te /
translated: Because the existence of a produced object such as a pot or pleasure is observed,

original: de bzlog pa'i sgo nas don gyis go bas bdag la sogs pa ma byas pa yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i sgo nas don gyis go bas bdag la sogs pa ma byas pa yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: by implication, the self and so on would also be nonexistent, since they are the opposite of that.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, Candrakƒ´rti explains:

original: mi rtag byas par mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: mi rtag byas par mthong gyur nas //
translated: Having seen impermanence in the produced,

original: ma byas gal te rtag na ni //
analyzed: ma byas gal te rtag na ni //
translated: if the unproduced is permanent,

original: byas la yod pa nyid mthong nas //
analyzed: byas la yod pa nyid mthong nas //
translated: having seen existence in the produced,

original: rtag pa yod nyid min par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag pa yod nyid min par 'gyur //
translated: the permanent would not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa ni rtag pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin pas dngos po rtag pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa ni rtag pa nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin pas dngos po rtag pa yod pa nyid ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: And it is also illogical that what does not exist is permanent. Therefore permanent things do not exist.

analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no // ci ste chos mngon ba'i bstan bcos las 'dom pa nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa byas par ma gyur pa rnams rtag pa nyid dang yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ma byas pa yod
translated: They are like a sky flower.

original: pa ma yin pa nyid du ston pa la khas blangs pas gnod par 'gyur ro snyam na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa nyid du ston pa la khas blangs pas gnod par 'gyur ro snyam na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that because the Abhidharma treatise accepts that space, nonanalytical cessation, and analytical cessation are permanent and existent, the response that they are not existent because they are not produced is undermined by your own assertion, that is not the case.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: BecauseüîΩordinary beings conceive

original: nam mkha' la sogs rtag go zhes //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs rtag go zhes //
translated: space and so on to be permanent,

original: so so'i skye bo dag gis rtog / mkhas pa rnams kyis de dag la //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag gis rtog / mkhas pa rnams kyis de dag la //
translated: the wise do not assert

original: 'jig rten pas kyang don ma mthong //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas kyang don ma mthong //
translated: that they are even mundane entities.

analyzed: gzugs med pa tsam nyid la nam mkhar tha snyad btags kyi nam mkha' zhes bya ba dngos po'i ngo bo ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Space is merely the absence of form, and the term ‚Äúspace‚Äù is applied to it. But there is not the slightest existent entity that is called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

analyzed: gzugs gzhan med pas gzugs can rnams 'byung ba la gegs med pa'i phyir gzugs gzhan med pa nyid de la /
translated: Since there is no other form, there is no obstruction to the arising of form.

original: dngos po rnams la 'di'i nang du ches snang bas na nam mkha'o zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la 'di'i nang du ches snang bas na nam mkha'o zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Since it appears as the inner space of all entities, it is called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dngos por ma gyur zhing ci yang ma yin pa de la ming tsam nye bar bstan pas rnam par rmongs pa rnams kyis dngos po yod pa nyid du sgro btags pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos por ma gyur zhing ci yang ma yin pa de la ming tsam nye bar bstan pas rnam par rmongs pa rnams kyis dngos po yod pa nyid du sgro btags pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni nam mkha'i ming sbyor ba na ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag la sra ba la sogs pa ltar @149a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin la mkhas pa rnams kyis ni nam mkha'i ming sbyor ba na ji ltar sa la sogs pa'i brjod pa dag la sra ba la sogs pa ltar @149a * //
translated: Thus, when the wise apply the term ‚Äúspace,‚Äù they do not do so in the way that they apply the terms ‚Äúhardness,‚Äù etc., to earth, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pas kyang rang gi ngo bos brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pas kyang rang gi ngo bos brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: If the world‚Äôs cognition does not perceive even the slightest thing that is expressed by intrinsic reality,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin mkhyen pa la gnas shing phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos por dmigs pa mi mnga' ba rnams kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin mkhyen pa la gnas shing phyi nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos por dmigs pa mi mnga' ba rnams kyis de'i rang gi ngo bo dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci smos /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa gzhan gnyis la yang brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni de rnams ci yang ma yin pa nyid kyis gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa tsam gsal bar byed pa yin gyi /

original: bsgrub pa gtso bor gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub pa gtso bor gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the establishment of anything.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la rtag pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la rtag pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, space and so on are not permanent.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa kho na ste /
translated: Space is definitely permanent.

original: khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang mi rtag pa de ni khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang mi rtag pa de ni khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is all-pervading.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: That which is impermanent is not all-pervading, like a pot, for example.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained.

original: ma skyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas don gyis de'i rten can brten pas thams cad mi srid pa de yang bstan pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pas don gyis de'i rten can brten pas thams cad mi srid pa de yang bstan pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Since it has been shown that this nonarisen thing does not exist, it is implied that the basis of that, the dependent, is also impossible.

original: de lta na yang pha rol po'i lugs la grags pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas de'i lugs mi rigs pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pas nam mkha'i khyab pa nyid bkag pas rtag pa nyid bsal bar 'dod nas bshad pa /üîΩphyogs zhes bya ba phyogs can ni //
analyzed: de lta na yang pha rol po'i lugs la grags pa'i dngos po rang gi ngo bo khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas de'i lugs mi rigs pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pas nam mkha'i khyab pa nyid bkag pas rtag pa nyid bsal bar 'dod nas bshad pa / phyogs zhes bya ba phyogs can ni //
translated: However, because he wishes to state that the system of the opponent is illogical from the perspective of the specific nature of things that are renowned in the system of the opponent, he wishes to refute the permanence of space by refuting its pervasion.üîΩHe says,üîΩThe direction is not

original: kun la gnas pa ma yin te //
analyzed: kun la gnas pa ma yin te //
translated: present in all the directional parts.

original: de phyir phyogs can la phyogs ni //
analyzed: de phyir phyogs can la phyogs ni //
translated: Therefore the direction

original: gzhan la shin tu gsal bar yod //
analyzed: gzhan la shin tu gsal bar yod //
translated: is clearly present in another.

original: nam mkha' ni nam mkha'i cha shas gang dag yin pa de dag gi cha shas can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni nam mkha'i cha shas gang dag yin pa de dag gi cha shas can du 'gyur la /
translated: Space would be the possessor of parts that are parts of space.

original: der bum pa la sbyor ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la sbyor ba'i phyogs la mi gnas so //
analyzed: der bum pa la sbyor ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la sbyor ba'i phyogs la mi gnas so //
translated: Whatever position is applied to the pot does not apply to other things.

original: gal te gnas na ni de'i tshe de dang yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir bum pa yang thams cad na yod pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gnas na ni de'i tshe de dang yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir bum pa yang thams cad na yod pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If it did apply, then at that time, because the place would not be different from the object, the pot would exist everywhere.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: But that does not exist, therefore this is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang gal te phyogs kyang thams cad du gnas na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te phyogs kyang thams cad du gnas na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the place exists everywhere,

original: de yang khyab pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs can bzhin du phyogs kyi ming la brten par mi 'gyur la phyogs med pa'i phyir @149b phyogs can yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang khyab pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs can bzhin du phyogs kyi ming la brten par mi 'gyur la phyogs med pa'i phyir @149b phyogs can yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it is all-pervading, like the possessor of the place, it would not depend on the name of the place, and because there would be no place, the possessor of the place would not exist.

original: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas phyogs zhes bya ba phyogs can thams cad la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod na ni de'i tshe gdon mi za bar phyogs can la phyogs gzhan yang shin tu gsal bar yod ces bya bar khas blang
analyzed: ci ste nyes pa 'di spang bar 'dod nas phyogs zhes bya ba phyogs can thams cad la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dod na ni de'i tshe gdon mi za bar phyogs can la phyogs gzhan yang shin tu gsal bar yod ces bya bar khas blang
translated: But if you maintain that the direction is not located in the directional things, in order to avoid the error mentioned above, then you must accept that the directional things are very clearly located in another direction.

original: bar bya'o // de'i phyir thams cad na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyogs dang ldan pa'i phyogs can nam mkha' la ni bum pa ltar khyab pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Therefore, the pervasion of space, which is the possessor of directions that do not exist in all places, is contradictory, like a pot.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyogs tsam las tha dad par phyogs can zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig dmigs pa yang ma yin pas yod pa ma grub pa can 'di rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te de'i phyir nam mkha' rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyogs tsam las tha dad par phyogs can zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig dmigs pa yang ma yin pas yod pa ma grub pa can 'di rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur te de'i phyir nam mkha' rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since a directional thing is not observed to be different from the mere different directions, how could this, which does not exist, be permanent? Therefore space is not permanent.

original: ci ste yang cha shas med pa'i phyir 'di phyogs can nyid du khas mi len na de lta yin na ni des bum pa la sogs pa rnams la sbyor bar yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste yang cha shas med pa'i phyir 'di phyogs can nyid du khas mi len na de lta yin na ni des bum pa la sogs pa rnams la sbyor bar yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /

analyzed: de rnams la nye bar sbyor ba de ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur ram phyogs gcig gis yin grang na /

original: de la re zhig bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not applied in its entirety,

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang re re zhing thams cad na yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang re re zhing thams cad na yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that each and every pot would be present in all places.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams phyogs dang sbyor bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa rnams phyogs dang sbyor bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya la /

analyzed: de ltar khas mi len pa la yang gdon mi za bar ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if you do not accept that, then you cannot escape the faults explained above.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore space is not permanent.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go ;
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srungs rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go ;
translated: ‚ÄúEternal‚Äù is one extreme.

original: / mi rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: / mi rtag ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-eternal‚Äù is the second extreme.

original: gang mtha' 'di gnyis kyi bar de ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gang mtha' 'di gnyis kyi bar de ni gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: The middle between these two extremes is not visible,

original: mi gnas pa /
analyzed: mi gnas pa /
translated: not a basis,

original: snang ba med pa /
analyzed: snang ba med pa /
translated: not manifest,

original: rnam par rig pa ma yin pa gnas med pa ste /üîΩ'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du 'phags pa gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las zhi ba'i blo gros 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ma yin pa gnas med pa ste / 'od srungs 'di ni dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba dang ; de bzhin du 'phags pa gsang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan pa'i mdo las zhi ba'i blo gros 'di lta ste /
translated: not an object of cognition, and not a location.üîΩKƒÅ≈õyapa, this is the middle way, the correct discernment of phenomena.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni sus kyang rtag pa'am mi rtag par brjod par bya ba ma yin te /üîΩzhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yang sus kyang @150a * //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni sus kyang rtag pa'am mi rtag par brjod par bya ba ma yin te / zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yang sus kyang @150a * //
translated: And similarly, the noble S≈´tra Teaching the Inconceivable Secret says, ‚Äú≈öƒÅntimati, for example, space is not described as permanent or impermanent by anyone.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ≈öƒÅntimati, similarly, the body of the TathƒÅgata is not described as permanent or impermanent by anyone.‚Äù

original: dus smra ba ni /
analyzed: dus smra ba ni /
translated: The proponents of time say:

original: 'gro ba 'jug pa dang sdud pa dus kyis byas pa nyid dmigs nas dus srid par rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'jug pa dang sdud pa dus kyis byas pa nyid dmigs nas dus srid par rjes su dpag ste /
translated: Time is inferred to exist because the engagement and withdrawal of beings is observed to occur at certain times.

original: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs rkyen rnams yod kyang thams cad kyi tshe myu gu la sogs pa skye ba ma dmigs la ci ste 'ga' zhig gi tshe dmigs shing de gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i dus nye na yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon la sogs rkyen rnams yod kyang thams cad kyi tshe myu gu la sogs pa skye ba ma dmigs la ci ste 'ga' zhig gi tshe dmigs shing de gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i dus nye na yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, even when the conditions such as seeds exist, sprouts are not observed to arise at all times. But if they are observed at some times, and if the time for their persistence and withdrawal is near, they will cease.

original: de'i phyir de ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang zhig yod na dngos po la //
analyzed: gang zhig yod na dngos po la //
translated: when something exists,

original: 'jug dang ldog pa'ang dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug dang ldog pa'ang dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: the engagement and withdrawal of things is observed.

original: dus zhes bya ba dang de ltar rjes su dpag pa de ni yod la /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba dang de ltar rjes su dpag pa de ni yod la /
translated: Time is called that, and it is inferred in that way.

original: de ni yod kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de ni yod kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
translated: Even though it exists, it is permanent because its cause is not observed.

original: de lta yin na ni myu gu la sogs pa skye ba de la rag las pa rnams rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni myu gu la sogs pa skye ba de la rag las pa rnams rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then those things that depend on the arising of sprouts, etc. would always arise.

original: ci ste de yod kyang res 'ga' bya ba byed pa dag la bya ba log pa nyid du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste de yod kyang res 'ga' bya ba byed pa dag la bya ba log pa nyid du rtog na /
translated: But if, even though it exists, it is conceived that activity is sometimes performed and sometimes not,

original: de lta na yang de nyid kyis de med pa nyid du dpog par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid kyis de med pa nyid du dpog par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, it would be inferred that it does not exist.

original: ci ste yod kyang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'jug pa la rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par la mngon du ma phyogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'jug pa la rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par la mngon du ma phyogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it exists, then like a seed, etc., it is not always an effect because it is not manifest in the special nature that is suitable for producing an effect.

original: de lta na yang sa bon la sogs pa rnams ltar de'i rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par de res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: de lta na yang sa bon la sogs pa rnams ltar de'i rung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par de res 'ga' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba la /
translated: But in that case, like a seed, etc., that special nature that is suitable for producing an effect would be impermanent because it would be intermittent.

original: de yang ci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe mi 'dod /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that it exists at all times?

original: ci ste rkyen gzhan la rag las pa de ni mi nyen thams cad kyi tshe yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste rkyen gzhan la rag las pa de ni mi nyen thams cad kyi tshe yod pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that it does not exist at all times because it depends on other conditions,

original: de lta na yang rkyen yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir dang / byung nas kyang slar med pa'i phyir nges par /
analyzed: de lta na yang rkyen yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / med na med pa'i phyir dang / byung nas kyang slar med pa'i phyir nges par /
translated: then it would definitely be impermanent because it exists when conditions exist, it does not exist when they do not exist, and it arises and then ceases.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur te /
translated: It would be dependent on another.

original: de'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa gang la rag las pa de la rag las pa'i phyir de gzhan la rag la sa par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa gang la rag las pa de la rag las pa'i phyir de gzhan la rag la sa par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because its engagement and disengagement would depend on that, it would be dependent on another.

original: de'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, like a sprout and so on, it would not escape being a result.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: des na 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des na 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it would also be a result.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa ni myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa ni myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is a result, like a sprout and so on, would be impermanent alone.

original: de'i phyir dus de la rtag pa nyid bsal ba'i sgo @150b nas dngos por yod pa sel ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus de la rtag pa nyid bsal ba'i sgo @150b nas dngos por yod pa sel ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, at that time, the existence of a thing is refuted by way of refuting its permanence.

original: rnam pa thams cad du dus med par ston pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dus med par ston pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not taught that time does not exist in any way.

original: de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is asserted to be the very cause of that.

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
translated: The karma of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: does not perish even in one hundred eons.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the time

original: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du smin par 'gyur //
translated: have arrived, it ripens into its own result.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is stated in verse.

original: dus la brten nas brtags pa'i don mngon par ma shes pa nyid kyis ming tsam la rnam par rmongs shing /üîΩdus kyis 'byung ba smin par byed //
analyzed: dus la brten nas brtags pa'i don mngon par ma shes pa nyid kyis ming tsam la rnam par rmongs shing / dus kyis 'byung ba smin par byed //
translated: Some, not understanding the meaning of the designation of time, are confused by mere words andüîΩTime ripens the elements.

original: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
analyzed: dus kyis skye dgu sdud par byed //
translated: Time brings beings to maturity.

original: dus kyis gnyid logs dpar byed ;
analyzed: dus kyis gnyid logs dpar byed ;
translated: Time causes sleep and awakening.

original: / dus las 'da' bar shin tu dka' //
analyzed: / dus las 'da' bar shin tu dka' //
translated: It is very difficult to transgress time.

original: zhes smra ba kha cig dag gis dus rtag par rtogs pa de dag 'dir 'gog par byed de /
analyzed: zhes smra ba kha cig dag gis dus rtag par rtogs pa de dag 'dir 'gog par byed de /
translated: Some say this.

original: dngos po rnams la brten nas dus su brtags na khyim ltar brtags par yod pa las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la brten nas dus su brtags na khyim ltar brtags par yod pa las mi 'da'o //
translated: But if time is imagined in dependence on things, it is not beyond being imagined as a mere designation, like a house.

original: gzhan yang dus rgyur smra bas 'gro ba 'jug pa la dus rgyu'i dngos por rtog pa ni don gyis 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dus rgyur smra bas 'gro ba 'jug pa la dus rgyu'i dngos por rtog pa ni don gyis 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, those who maintain that time is the cause of the evolution of the world imagine that time is the cause of things, but in fact they are accepting that time is the effect.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: gang gi phyir //üîΩ'bras bu med par rgyu la ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir // 'bras bu med par rgyu la ni //
translated: BecauseüîΩWithout an effect,

original: rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin te //
translated: a cause does not exist.

original: de yi phyir na rgyu'o cog /'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi phyir na rgyu'o cog /'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it follows that every cause would be an effect.

original: ci yang mi byed pa la rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'dir rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis ci yang yod pa ma yin pas don 'bras bur 'byung ba'i rgyu can gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba na ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu nyid du
analyzed: ci yang mi byed pa la rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'dir rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po rang bzhin gyis ci yang yod pa ma yin pas don 'bras bur 'byung ba'i rgyu can gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba na ji ltar rang gi 'bras bu nyid du
translated: Because it is impossible for something to be a cause if it does not perform any function, here, the entity called ‚Äúcause‚Äù does not exist inherently. Therefore, when the object is the effect that arises from the cause, how could it not be the cause?

original: mi 'gyur / 'bras bu nyid yin na yang myu gu la sogs pa ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mi 'gyur / 'bras bu nyid yin na yang myu gu la sogs pa ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: And if it is an effect, how could it be permanent, like a sprout?

original: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po rnam par gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the relation of cause and effect is not a real entity, neither has inherent existence.

original: ci ste 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu byung nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu byung nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: But if you say that the so-called effect arises after the cause has arisen,

original: 'di ltar sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung gi myu gu yod na sa bon ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung gi myu gu yod na sa bon ni ma yin te /
translated: then since the sprout arises when the seed exists, the seed does not exist when the sprout exists.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu nyid yod pa ma yin snyam na 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu nyid yod pa ma yin snyam na 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, if you think that the effect does not exist in the cause, this also does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon gyi ming can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de myu gu skye ba'i snga rol du yongs su rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa gzhan gsum pa med pa'i phyir rgyur @151a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon gyi ming can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de myu gu skye ba'i snga rol du yongs su rtog pa na rnam par rtog pa gzhan gsum pa med pa'i phyir rgyur @151a * //
translated: Because when one imagines that the thing called ‚Äúseed‚Äù exists prior to the arising of the sprout, then, since there is no third alternative besides being a cause or not being a cause,

original: gyur pa'am rgyu ma yin par gyur ba zhig rtog grang /
analyzed: gyur pa'am rgyu ma yin par gyur ba zhig rtog grang /
translated: is it imagined to be a cause or not to be a cause?

original: de la re zhig me la sogs pa ltar rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba las ni 'di skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la re zhig me la sogs pa ltar rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ba las ni 'di skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is not tenable that this arises from that which is not a cause, like fire and so on.

original: rgyu nyid kyang 'bras bu skyes pas mtshon pa zhig ste /
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyang 'bras bu skyes pas mtshon pa zhig ste /
translated: Moreover, a cause is indicated by the arising of an effect.

original: des na 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol du mi srid do //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu skye ba'i snga rol du mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible prior to the arising of the effect.

original: ci ste 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med par yang cung zad zhig 'bras bu nyid du rtogs na ni de'i tshe thams cad thams cad kyi 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na ni 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med par yang cung zad zhig 'bras bu nyid du rtogs na ni de'i tshe thams cad thams cad kyi 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na ni 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that something is an effect even without being related to the action of arising, then in that case everything would be an effect of everything. But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba la ma ltos par rang las grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu skye ba la ma ltos par rang las grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it follows that there would be no cause, a cause does not exist prior to the effect.

original: de yi phyir na rgyu'o cog /'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi phyir na rgyu'o cog /'bras bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all causes are effects.

original: zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba med do //üîΩgal te dus smra ba rnams kyi ltar na dus 'di 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur na ni de'i tshe des /
analyzed: zhes bya ba kha na ma tho ba med do // gal te dus smra ba rnams kyi ltar na dus 'di 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur na ni de'i tshe des /
translated: This is not a fault.

original: nges par sngar gyi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba 'bras bu skye ba la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: nges par sngar gyi gnas skabs las tha dad pa'i ngo bo can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba 'bras bu skye ba la phan 'dogs pa nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos te /
translated: If, as the proponents of time maintain, time is the cause of the variety of migrating beings, then it must be that time assists the arising of an effect that has a different nature from its previous state.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na /
translated: This is because in the world

original: rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na //
translated: When the cause transforms,

original: gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste //
translated: it becomes the cause of another.üîΩThe cause is that which produces the effect.

original: gang gis byed pa de ni rgyu'o zhes bya bas mthar don gang gi rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba sa bon gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i skyed par byed pa kho na 'dir rgyur brjod par 'dod la /
analyzed: gang gis byed pa de ni rgyu'o zhes bya bas mthar don gang gi rjes su byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba sa bon gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i skyed par byed pa kho na 'dir rgyur brjod par 'dod la /
translated: Thus, the producer that becomes the nature of the seed is asserted to be the cause here, and the effect arises in accordance with the meaning of the cause.

original: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu nyid gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rang gi 'bras bu skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs sgrub pa la yan lag gi ngo bor nye bar 'gro ba las yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu nyid gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i rgyu'i rang gi 'bras bu skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs sgrub pa la yan lag gi ngo bor nye bar 'gro ba las yin no //
translated: The cause of earth and so on is that which becomes the nature of a part in establishing the state that is suitable for the arising of its own primary effect.

original: sa bon zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni rang nyid rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa na myu gu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba rtsa ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni rang nyid rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa na myu gu'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The seed, which is the primary cause, becomes the cause of the sprout when it itself transforms.

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs ma btang bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs ma btang bar ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not do so without relinquishing its previous state.

original: de ltar gal te 'gro ba sna tshogs pa dus kyis byas par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dus kyang nges par 'bras bu bskyed pa la thag ring bar gnas pa'i gnas skabs snga ma spong zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs 'bras bu 'byung ba dang mthun par
analyzed: de ltar gal te 'gro ba sna tshogs pa dus kyis byas par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dus kyang nges par 'bras bu bskyed pa la thag ring bar gnas pa'i gnas skabs snga ma spong zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs 'bras bu 'byung ba dang mthun par
translated: As such, if the various transmigrators were created by time, then at that time time would definitely abandon the previous state of abiding far from generating an effect and transform into a state compatible with the arising of the effect.üîΩTherefore, like a seed, it would be impermanent.

original: 'gyur bar bya dgos pa de'i phyir sa bon ltar mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'gyur bar bya dgos pa de'i phyir sa bon ltar mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following lines:

original: gang la rnam @151b par 'gyur yod pa //
analyzed: gang la rnam @151b par 'gyur yod pa //
translated: That which transforms

original: de ni rtag ces byar yod min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rtag ces byar yod min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: cannot be called permanent.

original: ci ste mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i rgyu'i dngos por yongs su rtog pa don med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di'i rgyu'i dngos por yongs su rtog pa don med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: If it does not transform, then not only would it be pointless to conceive of it as the cause of that,

original: de'i rgyu can du 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu med pa can du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can du 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu med pa can du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: but also the effect that is asserted to be caused by it would arise without a cause.üîΩThis is explained in the following lines:

original: rtag pa gang gi rgyu yin pa'i //
analyzed: rtag pa gang gi rgyu yin pa'i //
translated: That entity which is the cause of the permanent

original: dngos de ma byung ba las skye //
analyzed: dngos de ma byung ba las skye //
translated: would arise from what is not arisen.

original: sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba las skyes pa'i myu gu ni sa bon las gzhan nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan nyid skyes so snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon rnam par 'gyur ba las skyes pa'i myu gu ni sa bon las gzhan nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan nyid skyes so snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: The sprout that arises from the transformation of the seed cannot be thought to arise from something else, because it is impossible for it to be different from the seed, because it follows the seed, and because it does not coexist with the seed.

original: mi 'dra ba lhan cig gnas pa rnams la rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba lhan cig gnas pa rnams la rgyu nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible for something different to be the cause of something different that coexists with it.

original: 'di ni 'gro ba sna tshogs mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dus rtag pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gro ba sna tshogs mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dus rtag pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu las gzhan nyid yod do //
translated: The cause is different from the effect because the world is impermanent and time is permanent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dra ba dang lhan cig gnas pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi 'dra ba dang lhan cig gnas pa yang yod de /
translated: Therefore, there is a coexistence of the different.

original: 'bras bu skyes kyang dus rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes kyang dus rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect arises, but time does not change.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu gang zhig dus las skyes pa de ni ma byung ba las byung ba zhig ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu gang zhig dus las skyes pa de ni ma byung ba las byung ba zhig ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever effect arises from time arises from what is non-existent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa med par 'gyur zhing rang nyid 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la ltos pa med par 'gyur zhing rang nyid 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would be independent of causes and conditions, and it would arise by itself.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that an effect that arises in dependence on causes and conditions arises from what has not yet arisen.

original: de la bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma byung ba las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid thams cad kyis ma byung ba las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which has not arisen does not arise from itself.

original: gang la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa mi srid pa de ni bong bu'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa mi srid pa de ni bong bu'i rva la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen dag gis bskyed par mi nus so //
translated: That which is impossible in terms of itself cannot be generated by causes and conditions, like the horns of an ass and so on.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i chos las 'das pa'i rtag pa dngos po gang gi rgyur 'dod pa'i dngos po de ma byung ba las skyes pa 'di ni rgyu med pa can kho nar skye ste rang nyid kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i chos las 'das pa'i rtag pa dngos po gang gi rgyur 'dod pa'i dngos po de ma byung ba las skyes pa 'di ni rgyu med pa can kho nar skye ste rang nyid kho na 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, that which is permanent, which is beyond the phenomena of causes, and which is asserted to be the cause of an existent thing, that existent thing arises from what has not yet arisen, and it arises only without a cause. The meaning of this is that it arises by itself.

original: da ltar yin dang / yang 'di la rgyu yongs su rtog pa don med pas ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa /üîΩrang nyid 'byung bar gyur de la //
analyzed: da ltar yin dang / yang 'di la rgyu yongs su rtog pa don med pas ci zhig bya zhes bshad pa / rang nyid 'byung bar gyur de la //
translated: Now, what is the point of investigating the cause of that?

original: rgyu ni log par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: rgyu ni log par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The cause would be reversedüîΩfor that which has arisen.

original: rang nyid grub pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di la rgyu dus zhes bya ba dgos pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang nyid grub pa'i phyir 'gro ba 'di la rgyu dus zhes bya ba dgos pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: For that which has arisen, the so-called ‚Äútime of the cause‚Äù is purposeless.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i rgyu nyid mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the cause is untenable.

original: 'di las kyang mi rung ste /üîΩ'di ltar / dngos po rtag pa las skyes pa //
analyzed: 'di las kyang mi rung ste / 'di ltar / dngos po rtag pa las skyes pa //
translated: This also is untenable.üîΩHow could something impermanent

original: ji lta bur na mi rtag 'gyur //üîΩ'jig @152a * //
analyzed: ji lta bur na mi rtag 'gyur // 'jig @152a * //
translated: arise from a permanent thing?üîΩIn the world, it is well known that an impermanent seed

original: rten na ni sa bon mi rtag pa kho na la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mi rtag pa 'byung bar grags kyi /
analyzed: rten na ni sa bon mi rtag pa kho na la 'bras bu myu gu zhes bya ba mi rtag pa 'byung bar grags kyi /
translated: gives rise to an impermanent sprout.

original: rtag pa 'ga' zhig las mi rtag pa cung zad cig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar ni ma yin na /
analyzed: rtag pa 'ga' zhig las mi rtag pa cung zad cig 'byung ngo zhes bya bar ni ma yin na /
translated: But it is not the case that something impermanent arises from something permanent.

original: dus ni rtag la de'i 'bras bu ni mi rtag pas ji ltar de grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: dus ni rtag la de'i 'bras bu ni mi rtag pas ji ltar de grub par 'gyur /
translated: Since time is permanent and its effect is impermanent, how could it be established?

original: 'di ltar kyang mi rung ste 'jig rten du /
analyzed: 'di ltar kyang mi rung ste 'jig rten du /
translated: This also is untenable. In the world,

original: nam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis //
analyzed: nam yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis //
translated: Never are cause and effect seen to be different in characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun mthong ma yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun mthong ma yin //
translated: Never are cause and effect seen to be different in characteristics.

original: rgyu ni rtag la 'bras bu ni mi rtag go zhes de ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'jig rten na nam yang ma mthong bas dus la rgyu nyid med do //
analyzed: rgyu ni rtag la 'bras bu ni mi rtag go zhes de ltar mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba ni 'jig rten na nam yang ma mthong bas dus la rgyu nyid med do //
translated: A permanent cause and an impermanent effect are never seen in the world. Therefore, time does not exist as a cause.

original: gal te yang ba lang gi spu dang lug gi ba la gnyis las rtsa d'ur ba dang rva las 'dam bu dang 'dam las padma skye ba la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang ba lang gi spu dang lug gi ba la gnyis las rtsa d'ur ba dang rva las 'dam bu dang 'dam las padma skye ba la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt such things as flax, wool, mud, and clay seen to be the causes of cloth, felt, pots, and so on?

original: de yang mi rtag pa rnams kho nar rang nyid rnam par 'gyur ba nye bar 'gro bas rgyu nyid du khams blangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med de ;üîΩder rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gnyi gar yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa rnams kho nar rang nyid rnam par 'gyur ba nye bar 'gro bas rgyu nyid du khams blangs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med de ; der rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gnyi gar yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even in these cases, there is no difference in characteristics, because the cause is taken to be the transformation of impermanent things.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In these cases, neither cause nor effect exists as time, because they are impermanent.

original: gdon mi za bar thams cad la mtha' de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu mngon bar grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar thams cad la mtha' de dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu mngon bar grub pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible that all effects are definitely established in the same way as the cause,

original: 'bras bu yang las sna tshogs kyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang las sna tshogs kyi rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the effect also conforms to the variety of karma.

original: nor bu chu shel dang me shel dag las kyang sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par du 'phags pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes par gyur na rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir chu dang me 'byung ba las 'gal ba med do
analyzed: nor bu chu shel dang me shel dag las kyang sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par du 'phags pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par skyes par gyur na rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba srid pa'i phyir chu dang me 'byung ba las 'gal ba med do
translated: But it is possible that water and fire arise from a water crystal and a fire crystal, because it is possible that a special transformation of that type arises from those crystals, which are of a special nature superior to their previous condition.

original: // de'i phyir de ltar dus smra ba bkag pa yin dang / rdul phra rab smra ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rtag cing ma mthong bas bskul ba yon tan dang ldan pa'i grogs can rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa rnams kyis 'gro ba sna
analyzed: // de'i phyir de ltar dus smra ba bkag pa yin dang / rdul phra rab smra ba ni sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rtag cing ma mthong bas bskul ba yon tan dang ldan pa'i grogs can rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa rnams kyis 'gro ba sna
translated: Therefore, in this way, the proponents of time are refuted, and the proponents of subtle particles say that the subtle particles of earth and so on are permanent and that unseen subtle particles that possess the qualities of being activated and having companions, such as a second subtle particle, gradually form the substances of wholes.

original: tshogs skyed par byed do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: tshogs skyed par byed do snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks that the collection generates.

original: de'i lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩgang gi phyogs 'ga' rgyu yin zhing //
analyzed: de'i lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa / gang gi phyogs 'ga' rgyu yin zhing //
translated: But in order to show that his system is illogical, it is said:üîΩIf one part of it is a cause

original: phyogs 'ga' rgyu ma yin des na //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' rgyu ma yin des na //
translated: and one part is not a cause,

original: de ni sna tshogs 'gyur na go //
analyzed: de ni sna tshogs 'gyur na go //
translated: then it would be a plurality,

original: sna tshogs rtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs rtag par mi rigs so //
translated: but it is illogical for a permanent thing to be a plurality.

original: yan lag can thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du thal ba spang bar 'dod pas @152b rgyu la yod pa'i zlum po nyid kyang yin pa de 'bras bu la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag can thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du thal ba spang bar 'dod pas @152b rgyu la yod pa'i zlum po nyid kyang yin pa de 'bras bu la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since he wishes to avoid the absurd consequence that all wholes would be reduced to mere atoms, he must certainly accept that the roundness that exists in the cause does not exist in the effect.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa des na rdul phra rab rnams la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa des na rdul phra rab rnams la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Since this is the case, it is not tenable that atoms combine with all of themselves.

original: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i cha gang gis rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor ba'i cha de rgyu yin zhing /üîΩgang gis mi sbyor ba de rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab rnams la bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de'i cha gang gis rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor ba'i cha de rgyu yin zhing / gang gis mi sbyor ba de rgyu ma yin no //
translated: When the subtle particles do not connect with each other in any way, then what part of them would connect with another subtle particle? That part would be the cause, and that which does not connect would not be the cause.

original: de ltar na ni gang gi phyogs 'ga' rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na ni gang gi phyogs 'ga' rgyu yin zhing /
translated: In that case, what part of the subtle particle would be the cause and what part would not be the cause?

original: phyogs 'ga' rgyu ma yin pa de ni du ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa zhig go //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' rgyu ma yin pa de ni du ma'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa zhig go //
translated: Since it would have a multiple nature, it would be a variety.

original: de'i phyir ri mo bzhin rtag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni sna tshogs rtag par mi rigs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ri mo bzhin rtag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni sna tshogs rtag par mi rigs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent like a painting.

original: ci ste rdul phra rab rnams la cha shas med pa'i phyir phyogs dang mi sbyor ba kho na yin gyi thams cad bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rdul phra rab rnams la cha shas med pa'i phyir phyogs dang mi sbyor ba kho na yin gyi thams cad bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar ni 'gyur te /
translated: But if the subtle particles do not connect with any part because they are partless, then they would connect with their entire nature.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa'i mtshan nyid can ldan pa yod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa'i mtshan nyid can ldan pa yod la /
translated: Therefore, possession, which has the characteristic of contact, would exist.

original: phyogs dang ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: phyogs dang ldan pa nyid kyang ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But it is not endowed with parts.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: The following is said in response to that:

original: rgyu yi zlum po gang yin pa //
analyzed: rgyu yi zlum po gang yin pa //
translated: The roundness that is the cause

original: de ni 'bras bu la yod min //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu la yod min //
translated: does not exist in the effect.

original: des na bdag nyid kun sbyor ba //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid kun sbyor ba //
translated: Therefore, the conjunction of the whole

original: rdul phran rnams la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams la mi 'thad do //
translated: is not tenable in the atoms.

original: rgyu dang zlum po nyid dang phyogs med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang zlum po nyid dang phyogs med pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The terms ‚Äúcause,‚Äù ‚Äúroundness,‚Äù and ‚Äúpartless‚Äù are the characteristics of the substance of the atom.

original: gal te rdul phra rab bdag nyid thams cad kyis rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor zhing phyogs kyis ma yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ste rdul phra rab la yod pa'i zlum po gang yin pa de 'bras bu rdul phran gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang thalüîΩbar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab bdag nyid thams cad kyis rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor zhing phyogs kyis ma yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu ste rdul phra rab la yod pa'i zlum po gang yin pa de 'bras bu rdul phran gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the atom were to connect with another atom through its whole self and not through a part, then the roundness that exists in the cause, the atom, would also follow in the effect, the dyad and so on.

original: de'i phyir yan lag can thams cad rdul phra rab tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can thams cad rdul phra rab tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, because all wholes would be just the size of atoms, they would be imperceptible.

original: de dag ni rdul phra rab tsam nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rdul phra rab tsam nyid ma yin no //
translated: They are not mere atoms.

original: des na rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab rnams bdag nyid thams cad kyis sbyor bar mi 'thad do //

original: yang gang gi tshe rdul phra rab gzhan dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis mi sbyor ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe rdul phra rab gzhan dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis mi sbyor ba de'i tshe /

original: rdul phran gcig gi gnas gang yin //
analyzed: rdul phran gcig gi gnas gang yin //
translated: then what is the location of one atom?

original: de ni gzhan gyi'ang mi 'dod //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi'ang mi 'dod //

original: de phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis //üîΩbong @153a * //
analyzed: de phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis // bong @153a * //
translated: Therefore, cause and effect

original: tshod mnyam par 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: tshod mnyam par 'dod ma yin //
translated: are not asserted to be equal in size.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab gzhan dang bdag nyid thams cad kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas rnams dbang po las 'das pa nyid du ma gyur mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab gzhan dang bdag nyid thams cad kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi rdzas rnams dbang po las 'das pa nyid du ma gyur mod /
translated: Thus, because atoms do not join with their entire bodies, it is not the case that composite things are imperceptible.

original: rdul phra rab phyogs dang ldan pa nyid ni g-yo ba med la ;
analyzed: rdul phra rab phyogs dang ldan pa nyid ni g-yo ba med la ;
translated: Atoms that possess spatial parts do not move.

original: phyogs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir yang 'di sna tshogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir yang 'di sna tshogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: And because they possess spatial parts, they are diverse.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent.

original: 'dir 'bras bu'i rdzas rtsom pa'i dus na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu'i rdzas rtsom pa'i dus na nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: Here, this fault is incurred when the substance of the effect is produced.

original: 'bras bu rtsom pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs su ni rdul phra rab rnams la cha shas med pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du thal ba med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs su ni rdul phra rab rnams la cha shas med pa'i phyir ji skad smras pa'i skyon du thal ba med do zhes smra'o //

original: gnas skabs der yang shar la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: gnas skabs der yang shar la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i dbye ba yod do //

original: de'i tshe nges par /
analyzed: de'i tshe nges par /
translated: At that time, it is certain that

original: gang la shar gyi phyogs yod pa //
analyzed: gang la shar gyi phyogs yod pa //
