original: de la shar gyi cha yang yod //
analyzed: de la shar gyi cha yang yod //
translated: also has an eastern part.

original: de'i phyir / 'di phyogs dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdul phra rab nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di phyogs dang ldan pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du rdul phra rab nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, because it has a direction, like a pot, it is not an atom.

original: gang gi rdul la phyogs yod pa //
analyzed: gang gi rdul la phyogs yod pa //
translated: That atom which has a direction

original: des rdul rdul phran min par bsnyad //
analyzed: des rdul rdul phran min par bsnyad //
translated: is said to be not an atom, but an atom-part.

original: gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med par gyur na ni de la 'gro ba med pas rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor ba med pa yin dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab cha shas med par gyur na ni de la 'gro ba med pas rdul phra rab gzhan dang sbyor ba med pa yin dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas rtsom par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the subtle particle were partless, it would not go, and it would not join with another subtle particle, and it would not serve as the basis for the composition of a whole.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i dus na lus dang ldan pa'i don gyis /üîΩmdun gyis len zhing rgyab kyis ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba'i dus na lus dang ldan pa'i don gyis / mdun gyis len zhing rgyab kyis ni //
translated: In this way, when it goes, it is said to be in the process of going because it is related to the body.üîΩThe front part takes hold of the place in front,

original: gtong bar 'gyur na de dag gnyis //üîΩgang la yod pa ma yin la //
analyzed: gtong bar 'gyur na de dag gnyis // gang la yod pa ma yin la //
translated: and the rear part abandons the place behind.üîΩBut that which has neither of these two

original: de la 'gro por yang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la 'gro por yang mi 'gyur //
translated: is not a goer.

original: lus dang ldan zhing 'gro ba mngon du phyogs pa'i don gyis mdun gyi phyogs kyis sngon phyogs gnon zhing /
analyzed: lus dang ldan zhing 'gro ba mngon du phyogs pa'i don gyis mdun gyi phyogs kyis sngon phyogs gnon zhing /
translated: The front part of the body takes hold of the place in front, and the rear part abandons the place behind.

original: rgyab kyi phyogs kyis rgyab phyogs gtong ba las 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba nyid nye bar rtogs pa zhig na cha med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gang la mdun dang rgyab kyi yan lag gang gis len pa dang gtong ba nyid med pa de ni 'gro ba por
analyzed: rgyab kyi phyogs kyis rgyab phyogs gtong ba las 'gro ba po'i 'gro ba nyid nye bar rtogs pa zhig na cha med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab gang la mdun dang rgyab kyi yan lag gang gis len pa dang gtong ba nyid med pa de ni 'gro ba por
translated: The back part of the goer is the one that is going in the direction of the back. But since the goer is partless, the subtle particle has no front or back parts. Therefore, it does not take up or give up anything.

original: yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: It is not a goer.

original: de med pas 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dngos po yod par smra bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de med pas 'bras bu rtsom par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab dngos po yod par smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is illogical to say that the subtle particle is a thing because it does not initiate an effect.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te rdul phra rab med na ni 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams @153b kyis dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab med na ni 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams @153b kyis dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the subtle particle does not exist, then it would not be observed by yogins.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha'i mthong bas dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis lha'i mthong bas dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: But it is observed by the divine eye of yogins.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rtag pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rtag pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the subtle particle is permanent.

original: bshad par bya ste /üîΩgang la dang po yod min zhing //
analyzed: bshad par bya ste / gang la dang po yod min zhing //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩWhat has no frontüîΩAnd no middle

original: gang zhig la dkyil yod min na //üîΩgang la tha ma yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig la dkyil yod min na //üîΩgang la tha ma yod ma yin //
translated: Has no end.

original: mngon med de ni gang gis mthong //
analyzed: mngon med de ni gang gis mthong //
translated: How can the imperceptible be seen?

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab la mdun dang bar dang rgyab kyi cha yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab la mdun dang bar dang rgyab kyi cha yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it has no parts, the subtle particle has no front, middle, or back.

original: de'i phyir mngon pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon pa med de /
translated: Therefore, it is imperceptible.

original: mngon pa ni gsal ba dang gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / blta bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i don te de med pa'i phyir mngon pa med do //
analyzed: mngon pa ni gsal ba dang gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / blta bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i don te de med pa'i phyir mngon pa med do //
translated: The imperceptible is that which is not manifest, not apprehended, not seen.

original: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa ni sus kyang blta bar bya bar nus pa yang ma yin pa 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dmigs par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba ma yin pa ni sus kyang blta bar bya bar nus pa yang ma yin pa 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dmigs par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not seen cannot be seen by anyone. It is not a proper object of observation for yogins.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the subtle particle does not exist as a permanent entity.

original: gang dag de ltar 'thad pas mthong bar mi 'thad pa bzhin du mthong ngo snyam du sems shing //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar 'thad pas mthong bar mi 'thad pa bzhin du mthong ngo snyam du sems shing //
translated: Those who think that it is seen as if it were tenable when it is not tenable,

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba yang dag pa ma yin pa las mthong ba khyad par du ma gyur pa de dag ni nges par log par nye bar bstan pas 'jig rten phyin ci log tu byed pa de dag gi lung tshad ma nyid du byed pa las
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba yang dag pa ma yin pa las mthong ba khyad par du ma gyur pa de dag ni nges par log par nye bar bstan pas 'jig rten phyin ci log tu byed pa de dag gi lung tshad ma nyid du byed pa las
translated: Therefore, the scriptures of those who are mistaken about the world are definitely taught incorrectly.

original: rdul phra rab yod pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab yod pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that subtle particles exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩrdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / rdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa kho na ste /
translated: Objection:

original: rags pa byung ba las sa bon gyi ngo bor nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa byung ba las sa bon gyi ngo bor nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The subtle particles are permanent because they become the seeds of the arising of the coarse.

original: gal te de rnams med na ni rags pa rnams sa bon med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de rnams med na ni rags pa rnams sa bon med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did not exist, the coarse would arise without seeds.

original: 'di ltar gang las bskal pa dang por rags pa rnams slar rags pa rnams 'byung bar gyur pa 'jig pa'i dus na yan lag can gyi rdzas thams cad 'thor zhing rdul phra rab tsam zhig lus pa na rags pa rnams srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang las bskal pa dang por rags pa rnams slar rags pa rnams 'byung bar gyur pa 'jig pa'i dus na yan lag can gyi rdzas thams cad 'thor zhing rdul phra rab tsam zhig lus pa na rags pa rnams srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, at the time of destruction, when the coarse arises again at the beginning of the eon, all the substances of the parts are scattered and only the subtle particles remain. The coarse do not exist.

original: yang gang dag gal te gnas skabs der rags pa rnams bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams kyang med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rags pa rnams rgyu med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gang dag gal te gnas skabs der rags pa rnams bzhin du rdul phra rab rnams kyang med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rags pa rnams rgyu med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the subtle particles were to cease to exist at that time, just as the gross objects do, then at that time the gross objects would arise without a cause.

original: de'i yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi rgyu rdul phra rab rnams yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de'i yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi rgyu rdul phra rab rnams yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: The cause of the substance that is the whole is the subtle particles that exist.

original: da rnams kyang rtag pa zhig ste /
analyzed: da rnams kyang rtag pa zhig ste /
translated: And those subtle particles are permanent.

original: yod la rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yod la rgyu dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist and are not endowed with a cause.

original: de yang mi rigs te /üîΩgang @154a * //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te / gang @154a * //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: / gi phyir ;
analyzed: / gi phyir ;
translated: Because

original: 'bras bu yis ni rgyu bshig pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu yis ni rgyu bshig pa //
translated: the effect destroys the cause.

original: des na rgyu ni rtag ma yin //
analyzed: des na rgyu ni rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore the cause is not permanent.

original: gal te rdul phra rab rnams nyid du gyur na ni sa bon gyis myu gu bzhin du de rnams rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab rnams nyid du gyur na ni sa bon gyis myu gu bzhin du de rnams rdul phra rab gnyis la sogs pa yan lag can gyi rdzas kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the subtle particles were to cease to exist, then just as a seed is destroyed by the sprout, they would be destroyed by the substance that is the whole, which is composed of two subtle particles and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir na rdul phra rab rnams sa bon ltar mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir na rdul phra rab rnams sa bon ltar mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the effect does not endure simultaneously with it, the subtle particles would be impermanent, like a seed.

original: ci ste gang las 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'bras bus rgyu 'jig pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang rgyu rang gi rang bzhin mi gtong zhing 'bras bu don gzhan du gyur pa skyed par byed do snyam du sems na de ltar yin na ni 'bras bu rgyu'i yul las tha dad pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa dag bzhin du yul bye ba'i rdul phra
analyzed: ci ste gang las 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba 'bras bus rgyu 'jig pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang rgyu rang gi rang bzhin mi gtong zhing 'bras bu don gzhan du gyur pa skyed par byed do snyam du sems na de ltar yin na ni 'bras bu rgyu'i yul las tha dad pa'i phyir rigs mi mthun pa dag bzhin du yul bye ba'i rdul phra
translated: But if you think that the cause is not destroyed by the effect, from which the effect would be impermanent,

original: rab rnams rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab rnams rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but rather, the cause does not relinquish its own intrinsic nature and generates the effect that is a different object, then if that were the case, because the effect is different from the object of the cause, like dissimilar types, the subtle particles with different objects would not be the cause.

original: de nyid kho na zol thabs gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kho na zol thabs gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the same point explained by another method.

original: yang na gang na rgyu yod pa //
analyzed: yang na gang na rgyu yod pa //
translated: Or, where the cause exists,

original: de na 'bras bu yod ma yin //
analyzed: de na 'bras bu yod ma yin //
translated: the effect does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says this.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar rgyu nyid mi srid pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar rgyu nyid mi srid pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the cause itself is impossible in that way,

original: rdul phra rab rtag par brtags pa don med pas ci zhig dgos te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rtag par brtags pa don med pas ci zhig dgos te /
translated: What is the point of postulating permanent subtle particles?

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa rnams med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa rnams med do //
translated: Therefore, permanent subtle particles do not exist.

original: 'di las kyang rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'di las kyang rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir /
translated: Also, subtle particles are not permanent becauseüîΩthey are impeded.

original: thogs ldan dngos po rtag pa ni //
analyzed: thogs ldan dngos po rtag pa ni //
translated: A permanent entity that is impeded

original: gang du snang ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gang du snang ba ma yin te //
translated: is not seen anywhere.

original: 'di ni rdul phra rab la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin la thogs pa'i bum pa nyid la sogs pa ltar rtag pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rdul phra rab la rdul phra rab gzhan gyis bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rdul phra rab thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin la thogs pa'i bum pa nyid la sogs pa ltar rtag pa nyid du yang mi rigs te /
translated: Because another subtle particle does not enter into the nature of a subtle particle, a subtle particle is impeded. It is not logical that a permanent subtle particle is impeded, like a permanent pot.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa nyi med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab rtag pa nyi med do //
translated: Therefore, permanent subtle particles do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: Because they are not permanent,

original: des na nam yang sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: des na nam yang sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: the buddhas never teach

original: rdul phran rtag pa nyid mi gsung //
analyzed: rdul phran rtag pa nyid mi gsung //
translated: that subtle particles are permanent.

original: gang zhig phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa des ni don gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de kho na ltar nges par bya ba zhig go //
analyzed: gang zhig phyin ci ma log par gzigs pa des ni don gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de kho na ltar nges par bya ba zhig go //
translated: But that which is seen without error must be ascertained just as it is.

original: rdzas brgyad kyi rdul phra rab mi rtag pa yod pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid yod la /
analyzed: rdzas brgyad kyi rdul phra rab mi rtag pa yod pa'i phyir de yod pa nyid yod la /
translated: Since there is an impermanent particle consisting of eight substances, it exists.

original: de yang brtags par yod pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de yang brtags par yod pa zhig ste /
translated: But it exists only as a conceptual entity.

original: rdzas brgyad la brten nas bum pa ltar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas brgyad la brten nas bum pa ltar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is imagined in dependence on the eight substances, like a pot.

original: de la rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad gang dag yin @154b pa de dag ni re re zhing rdul phra rab kyi sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab kyi rdzas brgyad gang dag yin @154b pa de dag ni re re zhing rdul phra rab kyi sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Now, those eight substances of the particle are not to be called particles individually,

original: de la so so so sor rdul phra rab nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la so so so sor rdul phra rab nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each one individually is not a particle.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ces bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams la rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ces bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, as in the case of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the TathƒÅgatas do not say that there are substantial particles.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nam yang rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid ston par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nam yang rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid ston par mi mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgatas never teach that the subtle particle is permanent.

original: rang nyid kyis de ltar ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis de ltar ma gzigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not see it that way themselves.

original: gang dag rigs pa bcug nas rdzas brgyad kyi rdul phra rab kyi yod pa nyid sel zhing rnam par shes pa rtsam nyid du rtogs pa de dag ni re zhig 'jig rten pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pa'i don la mkhas pas nye bar bstan pa sel ba na
analyzed: gang dag rigs pa bcug nas rdzas brgyad kyi rdul phra rab kyi yod pa nyid sel zhing rnam par shes pa rtsam nyid du rtogs pa de dag ni re zhig 'jig rten pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pa'i don la mkhas pas nye bar bstan pa sel ba na
translated: Those who, having applied reasoning, refute the existence of the subtle particle of eight substances and understand consciousness to be merely a collection, first refute the worldly things that are taught by those who are skilled in worldly matters.

original: 'jig rten dang lung gi gnod pa gnyis sel bar byed pa de dag gis rdul phra rab yod pa nyid bsal bar mi nus shing rdul phra rab ltar rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid 'thad pa dang 'gal ba yang gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang lung gi gnod pa gnyis sel bar byed pa de dag gis rdul phra rab yod pa nyid bsal bar mi nus shing rdul phra rab ltar rnam par shes pa'i yod pa nyid 'thad pa dang 'gal ba yang gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: But those who refute both worldly and scriptural harm cannot refute the existence of the subtle particle. And just as with the subtle particle, it is not possible to posit the existence of consciousness as contradicting reasoning.

original: 'di ltar de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa rnams rim gyis dang cig car med pa'i phyir mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa rnams rim gyis dang cig car med pa'i phyir mi 'jug la /
translated: Because its arising, enduring, and ceasing are not sequential and not simultaneous.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni yod pa nyid ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni yod pa nyid ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable that what is devoid of arising and so on exists.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa la yongs su mthong ba'i rnam par dpyad pa ma bcug par 'jig rten na ji ltar yin pa de ltar khas blang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa la yongs su mthong ba'i rnam par dpyad pa ma bcug par 'jig rten na ji ltar yin pa de ltar khas blang bar bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, worldly things should be accepted just as they are in the world, without subjecting them to scrutiny that analyzes whether they are transworldly.

translated: Where nirvana is,üîΩIt is not seen.

original: ma mthong de myang 'das gang zhig / rten med pa'i brten pa mi srid pa'i phyir der mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: ma mthong de myang 'das gang zhig / rten med pa'i brten pa mi srid pa'i phyir der mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Since it is impossible for a non-support to be supported, what nirvana would exist there?

original: yod pa ma yin pa la ni rtag pa nyid rigs pa ma yin pas dngos po rtag pa rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la ni rtag pa nyid rigs pa ma yin pas dngos po rtag pa rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since permanence is not tenable for that which does not exist, things that are permanent do not exist.

original: grangs can pa rnams ni yon tan dang skyes bu tha dad par shes pa las chan po la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa log pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rnam pa thams cad du zhi bas thar pa'i gnas skabs na skyes bu shes pa yod pa nyid
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams ni yon tan dang skyes bu tha dad par shes pa las chan po la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rim pa log pas rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rnam pa thams cad du zhi bas thar pa'i gnas skabs na skyes bu shes pa yod pa nyid
translated: The Samkhyas say that the soul is liberated by the complete pacification of the collection of transformations, because the soul is known to be different from the qualities and the process of engagement in such things as rice is reversed.

original: gnas pa'i phyir bdag grol ba yod pa ma yin dang / ji skad brjod pa'i nyes pa spangs pas thar par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir bdag grol ba yod pa ma yin dang / ji skad brjod pa'i nyes pa spangs pas thar par rtog par byed do //
translated: They think that liberation is the existence of the soul‚Äôs consciousness at the time of liberation, and they think that the soul is liberated because it is free from the faults mentioned above.

original: de dag gi de yang /üîΩsred dang bral la thar ba'i tshe //
analyzed: de dag gi de yang / sred dang bral la thar ba'i tshe //
translated: But that is not so, because:üîΩWhen liberated, what use is consciousness

original: shes yod yon tan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: shes yod yon tan ci zhig yod //
translated: To one free from craving?

original: grol bar gyur pa'i skyes bu la ni thar pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa yod pa nyid yod par brtag par mi rigs so //
analyzed: grol bar gyur pa'i skyes bu la ni thar pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa yod pa nyid yod par brtag par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical to imagine that the soul‚Äôs consciousness exists at the time of liberation for a liberated person.

original: de dag gi ltar na blos lhag par zhen pa'i don la skyes bus shes par byed cing /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na blos lhag par zhen pa'i don la skyes bus shes par byed cing /
translated: According to them, the soul causes consciousness of an object that is grasped by the intellect.

original: shes pa yod pa nyid kyang me'i tsha ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo'o zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa nyid kyang me'i tsha ba nyid ji lta ba bzhin du de'i rang gi ngo bo'o zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod la /
translated: The existence of consciousness is like the heat of fire, and it is accepted that it is the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: de yang yul ji ltar bstan pa yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul ji ltar bstan pa yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: And that is the nature of the ascertainment of the object as it is taught.

original: rang bzhin ni yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i 'dod pa rig cing skyes bu dang tha mi dad par rtogs nas rim gyis dbang po'i tshogs 'byung ba na skyes bu'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe yul nye bar @157a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i 'dod pa rig cing skyes bu dang tha mi dad par rtogs nas rim gyis dbang po'i tshogs 'byung ba na skyes bu'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyu yin no // gang gi tshe yul nye bar @157a * //
translated: The intrinsic nature is the cause of the person‚Äôs experience of the object, because it is known to be the desire for the experience of the object and it is understood to be not different from the person. When the collection of sense faculties gradually arises, it is the cause of the person‚Äôs experience of the object.

original: longs spyod pa'i skyes bu la 'dod pa log pa de'i tshe de la sred pa ldog go //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i skyes bu la 'dod pa log pa de'i tshe de la sred pa ldog go //
translated: When the person experiences the object, the desire for the object ceases.

original: sred pa ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: sred pa ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Desire is the desire for the object.

original: sred pa dang bral ba de la ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyis yon tan 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba de la ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyis yon tan 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: When the person is free from desire, then because of the existence of consciousness, it is not the case that he has some quality.

original: des ni de'i tshe don 'ga' yang yang dag par mi myong ste /
analyzed: des ni de'i tshe don 'ga' yang yang dag par mi myong ste /
translated: At that time, he does not experience any object at all.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can mtha' dag rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid can mtha' dag rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the entire collection of modifications, which is the nature of cause and effect, will be completely extinguished.

original: de'i phyir grol ba'i bdag la thar pa shes pa yod pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir grol ba'i bdag la thar pa shes pa yod pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the liberated self has the existence of knowledge.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe skyes bu shes pa yod pa ma yin par 'gyur la rag go zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe skyes bu shes pa yod pa ma yin par 'gyur la rag go zhe na /
translated: But at that time, it would follow that the person does not have the existence of knowledge.

original: de ltar na yang shes pa med pa'i yod pa yang //
analyzed: de ltar na yang shes pa med pa'i yod pa yang //
translated: Even so, the existence of the person without knowledge

original: gsal bar yod pa min dang mtshungs pa ma yin nam //üîΩshes pa yod pa las tha dad med pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi skyes bu la shes pa yod pa nyid med na shes pa med pa la gang zhig bden pa yod par brtags pa de ni ches gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi
analyzed: gsal bar yod pa min dang mtshungs pa ma yin nam // shes pa yod pa las tha dad med pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi skyes bu la shes pa yod pa nyid med na shes pa med pa la gang zhig bden pa yod par brtags pa de ni ches gsal bar yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi
translated: is not the same as the nonexistence of the manifest, is it?

original: bu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba zhig go //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba zhig go //
translated: If the person, whose nature is not different from the existence of knowledge, does not have the existence of knowledge, then the person without knowledge is even more clearly nonexistent, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: ci ste grol ba'i gnas skabs can shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa'i phyir bdag yod do snyam du sems na 'di yang snying po med pa zhig ste /
analyzed: ci ste grol ba'i gnas skabs can shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa'i phyir bdag yod do snyam du sems na 'di yang snying po med pa zhig ste /
translated: But if you think that since the existent consciousness that has the state of liberation has the potential, therefore the self exists, this is also pointless.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: thar pa bdag gcig yod na ni //
analyzed: thar pa bdag gcig yod na ni //
translated: If liberation were a single self,

original: shes yod sa bon srid pa yod //
analyzed: shes yod sa bon srid pa yod //
translated: The existence of consciousness and the seed of existence would be possible.

original: gal te grol ba'i gnas skabs su bdag brtag par nus na ni de'i tshe bdag yod dang de'i rten can shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te grol ba'i gnas skabs su bdag brtag par nus na ni de'i tshe bdag yod dang de'i rten can shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the self could be conceived in the state of liberation, then at that time the self would exist and the potential of the existent consciousness that has it as its basis would exist.

original: de'i shes ba yod pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo can yin pa nyid kyi phyir de med par yod pa ma yin pas rten med pa'i nus pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: de'i shes ba yod pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo can yin pa nyid kyi phyir de med par yod pa ma yin pas rten med pa'i nus pa yang mi srid do //
translated: But since the nature of consciousness is the existence of its own entity, it does not exist without it. Therefore it is also impossible for the potential to exist without a basis.

original: gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don da lta mi nye ba'i phyir 'ga' yang nus pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid du brtag pa mdzes par mi 'gyur la grol ba'i bdag la gang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa rang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni srid paüîΩyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don da lta mi nye ba'i phyir 'ga' yang nus pa'i khyad par yod pa nyid du brtag pa mdzes par mi 'gyur la grol ba'i bdag la gang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa rang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is impossible for the self of a liberated person to engage in knowing anything, since it would arise by itself.

original: 'di'i phyir yang sems pa can gyis don yod pa ma yin pas bdag med do //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang sems pa can gyis don yod pa ma yin pas bdag med do //
translated: Therefore, since the object of consciousness does not exist, the self does not exist.

original: gal te thar bar grol bar gyur pa 'ga' yang med pas thar ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thar bar grol bar gyur pa 'ga' yang med pas thar ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no liberation, then liberation would not exist at all,üîΩand therefore this existence would not cease.

original: de'i phyir srid pa 'di mi 'jig par 'gyur ro @157b zhes mi 'dod pa mang po zhig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa 'di mi 'jig par 'gyur ro @157b zhes mi 'dod pa mang po zhig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do you not accept that many undesirable consequences would follow?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: shes pa yod pa'i 'jug pa dang / de'i nus pa gnyis dngos po bden par yod na ni ji srid 'jug pa yod pa zhig gam 'on te med pa zhig snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: shes pa yod pa'i 'jug pa dang / de'i nus pa gnyis dngos po bden par yod na ni ji srid 'jug pa yod pa zhig gam 'on te med pa zhig snyam du the tshom za bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the engagement of consciousness and its potential were truly existent things, then one would doubt whether it exists as long as the engagement exists or whether it does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rten med pas de dag rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩde med na ni srid pa la //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rten med pas de dag rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe / de med na ni srid pa la //
translated: But when they do not exist in any way because they have no basis,üîΩthen without it,

original: bsam pa'am yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'am yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no thought of or existence in cyclic existence.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa'i rten sa bon tshig par gyur na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun mi 'jug pa bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi rgyun tsam zhig kyang mi 'jug pas thar par rigs so //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa'i rten sa bon tshig par gyur na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun mi 'jug pa bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du bdag gi rgyun tsam zhig kyang mi 'jug pas thar par rigs so //
translated: Just as when the seed that is the basis of the potential of the sprout, etc., is burned, the continuum of the sprout, etc., is not engaged, so also the continuum of the self is not engaged in any way. Therefore, it is logical that one is liberated.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩsdug bsngal las thar mi rnams la //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir / sdug bsngal las thar mi rnams la //
translated: Since this is so,üîΩit is certain that liberation

original: gzhan las yod pa min par nges //
analyzed: gzhan las yod pa min par nges //
translated: for humans does not exist elsewhere.üîΩTherefore, it is said that the complete exhaustion of the self

original: de'i phyir rnam pa kun tu'ang bdag / zad pa legs zhes bya bar brjod //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa kun tu'ang bdag / zad pa legs zhes bya bar brjod //
translated: is the best.

original: sdug bsngal las grol ba ni sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las grol ba ni sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Liberation from suffering is the non-arising of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can gyi 'du byed las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang skye ba dang 'gag pa'i chos can gyi 'du byed las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa rnams yin la /
translated: Suffering is the arising and cessation of formations generated by karma and afflictions.

original: de rnams la brten nas kyang gang zag tu 'dogs te /
analyzed: de rnams la brten nas kyang gang zag tu 'dogs te /
translated: The person is imputed in dependence on those.

original: de ni bdag yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag yin no //
translated: That is the self.üîΩWhen suffering ceases, the appropriator who is of the same continuum as the self and who is happy is completely extinguished in every respect. That extinction is the good.

original: sdug bsngal 'gags na ni de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i nye bar len pa po bdag rnam pa thams cad du phyis mi 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis zad pa gang yin pa de nyid legs pa'o zhes bya ba grol ba'i bdag yod pa ni ma
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gags na ni de dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i nye bar len pa po bdag rnam pa thams cad du phyis mi 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis zad pa gang yin pa de nyid legs pa'o zhes bya ba grol ba'i bdag yod pa ni ma
translated: The self that is liberated does not exist.

original: yin no // de ni re zhig rgyu med pa can nyid kyi phyir rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // de ni re zhig rgyu med pa can nyid kyi phyir rang nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That self does not exist by itself because it is causeless.

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: It is like the son of a barren woman.

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yod na yang de rtag pa nyid kyis rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyis la khyad par med pas snga ma bzhin du 'khor ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yod na yang de rtag pa nyid kyis rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyis la khyad par med pas snga ma bzhin du 'khor ba ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it has its own nature, then because it is permanent and does not change, there would be no difference between bondage and liberation, and, as before, there would be no cessation of cyclic existence.

original: khyad par khas len na yang rnam par 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: khyad par khas len na yang rnam par 'gyur ba yod pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: If you accept a difference, then because there would be change, it would not be permanent.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And therefore it would have a cause.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'dra pa nyid dang rang gi rtsod pa btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang 'dra pa nyid dang rang gi rtsod pa btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And therefore it would be similar to the cause of suffering.

original: de'i phyir 'dis bdag khas blangs par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis bdag khas blangs par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable to accept a self.

original: gang zhig gzhan la bstan par mi @158a * //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan la bstan par mi @158a * //
translated: It is not possible to teach it to others,

original: nus pa dang / bshad zin pa'i skyon gyis khas blangs nas kyang yongs su dor bar bya ba yin ba de ni khas blangs pa ci zhig dgos de'i phyir bdag tu smra ba dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: nus pa dang / bshad zin pa'i skyon gyis khas blangs nas kyang yongs su dor bar bya ba yin ba de ni khas blangs pa ci zhig dgos de'i phyir bdag tu smra ba dor bar bya'o //
translated: and having accepted it, it is to be abandoned because of the faults already explained. What need is there to accept it? Therefore you should abandon the doctrine of a self.

original: gal te de ltar grol ba'i gnas skabs na grol ba'i bdag kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar grol ba'i gnas skabs na grol ba'i bdag kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If, in the state of liberation, there is no self that is liberated,

original: don dam pa'i ming can mya ngan las 'das pa na yang 'du byed rnams slar mi 'byung bas gtan yongs su zad pa'i ngo bor smra na ni de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i dam pa'i don 'di don du gnyer bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ming can mya ngan las 'das pa na yang 'du byed rnams slar mi 'byung bas gtan yongs su zad pa'i ngo bor smra na ni de'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'i dam pa'i don 'di don du gnyer bas ci zhig bya /
translated: and if, in nirvana, which is called ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù compounded things do not arise again, and so are said to be totally extinguished, then what is the use of striving for such an ultimate?

original: de'i phyir bdag legs su 'dod pa la //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag legs su 'dod pa la //
translated: Therefore, if you want what is best for yourself,

original: 'jig rten pa 'di nyid bla yi //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'di nyid bla yi //
translated: you should rely on this very mundane world.

original: don dam rnam kun ma yin te //
analyzed: don dam rnam kun ma yin te //
translated: The ultimate does not exist in any way,

original: 'jig rten pa la cung zad yod //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la cung zad yod //
translated: but the mundane world does exist in some way.

original: dam pa'i don la yod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la yod ma yin //
translated: The ultimate does not exist,üîΩbut the mundane world does exist.

original: bdag legs su 'dod pa ni mig nad byung du dogs pas mig 'byin pa rjes su mi sgrub kyi /
analyzed: bdag legs su 'dod pa ni mig nad byung du dogs pas mig 'byin pa rjes su mi sgrub kyi /
translated: Those who want what is best for themselves do not follow the example of someone who gouges out his own eyes for fear of eye disease.

original: nad sel ba kho na byed pa de bzhin du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la yid byung bas kyang sdug bsngal tsam btang ba kho na mchog gi thams cad med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nad sel ba kho na byed pa de bzhin du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la yid byung bas kyang sdug bsngal tsam btang ba kho na mchog gi thams cad med pa ma yin no //
translated: They only try to cure the disease. In the same way, those who are disgusted with the suffering of cyclic existence only abandon suffering itself. It is not the case that everything is totally nonexistent.

original: thams cad med bar gyur na ni bde ba yang rnam pa thams cad du gcad pas 'dis bdag la phan cung zad kyang btags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad med bar gyur na ni bde ba yang rnam pa thams cad du gcad pas 'dis bdag la phan cung zad kyang btags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If everything were nonexistent, then even happiness would be completely eliminated. Thus, this [happiness] would not benefit me in the slightest.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa 'di nyid bla'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa 'di nyid bla'i /
translated: Therefore, this mundane [happiness] is better.

original: 'jig rten pa der ni khyod kyis cung zad cig khas len te gang mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa'am brten nas btags pa bum pa dang / snam bu dang / re lde dang / khyim dang / nags dang / dmag dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa der ni khyod kyis cung zad cig khas len te gang mig la sogs pa dang / myu gu la sogs pa'am brten nas btags pa bum pa dang / snam bu dang / re lde dang / khyim dang / nags dang / dmag dang /
translated: You accept some things in the world, such as eyes and so on, sprouts and so on, and the dependently designated vases, cloth, fences, forests, armies,

original: kun dga' ra ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gru la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba dang / bzhon pa dang / gru la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: pleasure groves, vehicles, boats, and so on.

original: cung zad cig ni khas mi len te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni khas mi len te /
translated: You do not accept some things,

original: gang mu stegs can rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa dang / dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang mu stegs can rnams kyis yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa dang / dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o //
translated: such as the superimpositions of non-Buddhists, and the intrinsic reality of things.

original: yang na gang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las 'das pa 'bras bu ma byung ba dang / bde ba'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: yang na gang dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las 'das pa 'bras bu ma byung ba dang / bde ba'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: Or, you accept some things, such as virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that have not yet produced results, and future results that are pleasant.

original: 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'du byed da ltar byung ba rnams te /
translated: and present formations.

original: de lta bu 'di ni khyod 'jig rten pa la yod la /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di ni khyod 'jig rten pa la yod la /
translated: This is what you have in the world,

original: de las lhag mar gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin pas gang du thams cad med pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa 'di bla'i don dam pa ni @158b mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: de las lhag mar gyur pa ni yod pa ma yin pas gang du thams cad med pa ma yin pa 'jig rten pa 'di bla'i don dam pa ni @158b mchog ma yin te /
translated: and there is nothing more than that. Therefore, the ultimate is not superior to the world, since everything exists in the world.

original: gtan du yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the self does not exist at all.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las dngos po rtag pa dgag pa bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrab tu byed pa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las dngos po rtag pa dgag pa bsgom pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa zhes bya ba ste / rab tu byed pa dgu pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: Aryadeva's discussion of the meditative absorption that is the cultivation of the refutation of the permanence of things in his Four Hundred Stanzas on the Yogic Deeds of Bodhisattvas is completed.

original: // / bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdag go snyam du log par rtog par byed do //
translated: One wrongly conceives of the self as the life force, the one who is born, the one who is powerful, the agent, and the one who feels.

original: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs la /
analyzed: ji ltar bud shing la brten nas ma yin pa de bzhin du phung po rnams la brten nas bdag tu 'dogs la /
translated: Just as fire is imputed in dependence on fuel, the self is imputed in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de yang phung po rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du rnam pa lngar nges par dpyad pa na rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pas brten nas yongs su brtags pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de yang phung po rnams las de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du rnam pa lngar nges par dpyad pa na rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin pas brten nas yongs su brtags pa zhig ste /
translated: Moreover, when it is ascertained through the five modes of investigation that it does not exist inherently, it is a mere imputation in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de ltar na @160b 'du byed ni mi rtag pa rnams la bdag tu rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na @160b 'du byed ni mi rtag pa rnams la bdag tu rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus it is established that one conceives of impermanent formations as the self.

original: 'dir bdag ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa kho na ste 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir bdag ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa kho na ste 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here someone might argue as follows: The self exists essentially because it is the cause of engaging in and turning away from objects.

original: gal te bdag med na ni su zhig dge ba'am mi dge pa'am mi g-yo ba'i las byas nas de'i 'bras bu myong bar byed /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na ni su zhig dge ba'am mi dge pa'am mi g-yo ba'i las byas nas de'i 'bras bu myong bar byed /
translated: unmoving actions and experience their effects?üîΩHaving performed virtuous, nonvirtuous, or unmoving actions, oneüîΩexperiences the effects of those actions in the three realms, which areüîΩdifferentiated by the categories of type, realm of rebirth, and mode of
