analyzed: des ni dge ba'am mi dge ba'am mi g-yo ba'i las byas nas rigs dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i khams gsum du las dang rjes su mthun pa'i skye ba'i rgyun rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas shing bde ba dang sdug bsngal
translated: rebirth, and which are infinitely subdivided.üîΩThis is the cause for the

original: ba'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa thob la /
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa thob la /
translated: experience of the effects of happiness and suffering.üîΩThis is the one who

original: de ni mngon bar 'du byed pa po dang / so sor myong bar byed pa po yang yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni mngon bar 'du byed pa po dang / so sor myong bar byed pa po yang yin zhing /
translated: performs the actions and experiences them individually.üîΩThis is the one

original: de ni gsod pa dang / gnod pa dang / reg pa dang / bcing ba dang / grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gsod pa dang / gnod pa dang / reg pa dang / bcing ba dang / grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: who kills, harms, touches, binds, and is liberated.üîΩTherefore, they say,

original: de'i phyir bdag rang gi ngo bos yod do zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag rang gi ngo bos yod do zhes 'dzer to //
translated: the self exists inherently.

original: yang ci bdag 'di tshe rabs gzhan du lus kyi khyad par gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed dam /
analyzed: yang ci bdag 'di tshe rabs gzhan du lus kyi khyad par gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed dam /
translated: Moreover, does this self follow the transformation of the body in other lives?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or does it not?

original: gal te rjes su mi byed na ni de'i tshe cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i bdag tu yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci dgos te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su mi byed na ni de'i tshe cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i bdag tu yongs su brtags pa 'dis ci dgos te /
translated: If it does not follow, then what is the use of imagining a self that does not do anything at all?

original: ci ste rjes su byed na ni de'i tshe nges par khyod la /
analyzed: ci ste rjes su byed na ni de'i tshe nges par khyod la /
translated: But if it does follow, then it is certain that

original: skyes dang skye ba skyes bu ni //
analyzed: skyes dang skye ba skyes bu ni //
translated: the person is born and is born again,

original: lus bzhin rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur //üîΩde'i phyir / khyod kyi de la lus las gzhan //
analyzed: lus bzhin rnam par 'gyur bar 'gyur // de'i phyir / khyod kyi de la lus las gzhan //
translated: just like the body.üîΩTherefore, it is not logical for you

original: nyid dang rtag nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: nyid dang rtag nyid mi rigs so //
translated: to say that it is different from the body and permanent.

original: 'di ni lus las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lus las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from the body,

original: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it follows the transformation of the body,

original: lus kyi phyogs gcig bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gcig bzhin no //
translated: just like a part of the body.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not permanent,

original: lus las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir lus kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: lus las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir lus kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is not different from the body, just like the body itself.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to reify it as a self.

original: des ni 'du byed skad cig re rer 'jig pa'i ngang can rnams la gnas pa med pas /
analyzed: des ni 'du byed skad cig re rer 'jig pa'i ngang can rnams la gnas pa med pas /
translated: Since compounded phenomena have the nature of momentariness, they do not endure.

original: las kyi 'bras bu myong bar bya ba'i phyir bdag rtag bar rtogs so //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu myong bar bya ba'i phyir bdag rtag bar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to experience the effects of karma, one should understand that the self is permanent.

original: gang gi tshe bdag rtag pa de mi rigs pa de'i tshe nges par 'dis 'du byed kyi rgyun skad cig re rer 'jig pa kho na la las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag rtag pa de mi rigs pa de'i tshe nges par 'dis 'du byed kyi rgyun skad cig re rer 'jig pa kho na la las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa thams cad khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: When it is not logical that the self is permanent, then one should definitely accept that all phenomena such as karma and its effects are in the continuum of compounded phenomena that disintegrate moment by moment.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgal te bdag rang gi ngo bos grub par mi 'gyur @161a * //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te bdag rang gi ngo bos grub par mi 'gyur @161a * //
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: na ni de'i tshe lus kyi g-yo ba bskum pa dang brkyang ba la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa po gang zhig 'gyur /
analyzed: na ni de'i tshe lus kyi g-yo ba bskum pa dang brkyang ba la sogs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa po gang zhig 'gyur /
translated: If the self does not exist inherently, then what is the instigator of the actions of the body, such as contracting and extending?

original: skul ba po med pa'i shing rta ni rgyu ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skul ba po med pa'i shing rta ni rgyu ba yang ma yin te /
translated: A chariot without an instigator does not move.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shing rta'i skul ba po lha sbyin ltar lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩ'di la yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar shing rta'i skul ba po lha sbyin ltar lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig khas blang bar bya'o // 'di la yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, one must accept that there is some inner agent, like Devadatta, who is the mover of the body.

original: reg dang mi ldan dngos po las //
analyzed: reg dang mi ldan dngos po las //
translated: To show that this also is not reasonable, the following is said:

original: bskul ba zhes bya mi skye ste //üîΩde phyir lus kyi bya ba la //
analyzed: bskul ba zhes bya mi skye ste // de phyir lus kyi bya ba la //
translated: The so-called mover does not ariseüîΩfrom a thing that is not in contact.üîΩTherefore, the life force is not the agent

original: srog ni byed pa por mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srog ni byed pa por mi 'gyur //
translated: of the activity of the body.

original: shing rta ni reg pa dang mi ldan pa'i don 'gas kyang bskul bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shing rta ni reg pa dang mi ldan pa'i don 'gas kyang bskul bar mi nus te /
translated: A chariot cannot be moved by a thing that is not in contact with it.

original: reg pa dang ldan pa de kho nas de bskul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang ldan pa de kho nas de bskul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is only that which is in contact with it that moves it.

original: khyed cag gis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag kyang reg pa dang mi ldan pa zhig ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag kyang reg pa dang mi ldan pa zhig ste /
translated: The self that you imagine is not in contact with anything,

original: dus ltar lus med pa'i phyir ci la yang mi reg cing don 'ga' zhig gis reg pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dus ltar lus med pa'i phyir ci la yang mi reg cing don 'ga' zhig gis reg pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because, like time, it has no body. It does not touch anything, nor is it touched by anything.

original: gang gi tshe 'di de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di de ltar yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When this is so,

original: gang la lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nyid kyis 'di yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba reg pa dang mi ldan pa'i dngos po 'di las bskul ba ste /
analyzed: gang la lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nyid kyis 'di yod pa nyid du rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba reg pa dang mi ldan pa'i dngos po 'di las bskul ba ste /
translated: How can there be an instigator of this non-sensible entity, which is inferred to exist by the cause of bodily movement?

original: sbod pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: sbod pa 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be an instigator of this non-sensible entity, which is inferred to exist by the cause of bodily movement?

original: gzhan yang bdag 'di ni phyogs med pa'i phyir reg pa mi ldan no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag 'di ni phyogs med pa'i phyir reg pa mi ldan no //
translated: Moreover, this self is not sensible because it has no spatial location.

original: gang zhig phyogs dang mi ldan pa de la ni sbyor ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig phyogs dang mi ldan pa de la ni sbyor ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: That which has no spatial location has no contact.

original: sbyor ba dang bral ba la ni bskul ba yod pa ma yin pas bya ba de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de yod pa nyid du khas blang bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bral ba la ni bskul ba yod pa ma yin pas bya ba de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de yod pa nyid du khas blang bar mi rigs so //
translated: And that which is devoid of contact has no instigation. Therefore, it is not reasonable to accept its existence on the basis of its possession of activity.

original: gal te de kho na ltar sems la yang lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir khyod la yang nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de kho na ltar sems la yang lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu nyid mi rigs pa'i phyir khyod la yang nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If this is so, then does this fault not also apply to you, since it is unreasonable for the mind to be the cause of bodily movement?

original: sems ma gtogs par 'gro sogs la //
analyzed: sems ma gtogs par 'gro sogs la //
translated: Apart from the mind, going, etc.üîΩAre not seen to exist,

original: gang phyir bsod nams la sogs pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bsod nams la sogs pa //
translated: And merit, etc.üîΩAre not seen to exist,

original: ma mthong de phyir las kun la //
analyzed: ma mthong de phyir las kun la //
translated: Therefore, in all actions,

original: yid ni don por brjod par bya //
analyzed: yid ni don por brjod par bya //
translated: The mind is the main thing to be discussed.

original: zhes gong du smras pa yang yin no //
analyzed: zhes gong du smras pa yang yin no //
translated: This is what was said above.

original: de'i phyir skyon mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sun 'byin pa 'di ni mi rigs so zhe na bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sun 'byin pa 'di ni mi rigs so zhe na bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since the same fault would apply, this refutation is not correct.

original: kho bos ni sems reg pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du khas ma blangs so //
analyzed: kho bos ni sems reg pa dang mi ldan pa nyid du khas ma blangs so //
translated: We respond: We do not accept that the mind is devoid of contact.

original: 'di ltar / yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun reg pa'i @161b mtshan nyid can sems las byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lus dang ldan pa kho na yin zhing lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun reg pa'i @161b mtshan nyid can sems las byung ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa lus dang ldan pa kho na yin zhing lus kyi g-yo ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Because the mental factor called contact has the characteristic of the mutual contact of the object, sense faculty, and consciousness, consciousness is only associated with the body and is the cause of bodily movement.

original: khyod kyis ni de ltar bdag reg pa dang ldan par khas ma blangs pas mi mtshungs so //
analyzed: khyod kyis ni de ltar bdag reg pa dang ldan par khas ma blangs pas mi mtshungs so //
translated: But you do not accept that the self is associated with contact, so it is not similar.

original: yang na kho bos sems dngos po mtha' dag skye pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir des kun nas bslang ba'i rlung gi khams reg pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na kho bos sems dngos po mtha' dag skye pa'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir des kun nas bslang ba'i rlung gi khams reg pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Or, since we accept that mind is the cause of the arising of all things, the wind element that is motivated by it is contact.

original: des bskul ba na lus de lta de ltar skyes pas g-yo ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: des bskul ba na lus de lta de ltar skyes pas g-yo ba yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: When it is impelled, the body arises in such and such a way and moves.üîΩHere it is also said:

original: 'dir / 'dun pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du byed las //
analyzed: 'dir / 'dun pa'i rtsol ba'i 'du byed las //
translated: From the formative force of the exertion of aspiration,

original: skyes pa'i rlung can yul gzhan du ;
analyzed: skyes pa'i rlung can yul gzhan du ;
translated: the wind element arises in one who is born in another place.

original: / rnam chad med par skye ba ni //üîΩ'gro ba po yi mar me bzhin //
analyzed: / rnam chad med par skye ba ni // 'gro ba po yi mar me bzhin //
translated: Arising without interruption,

original: zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: it is like the lamp of the one who goes.

original: cis te khyad par 'dis bdag la yang rtog na ni de'i tshe 'di skad cig ma nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: cis te khyad par 'dis bdag la yang rtog na ni de'i tshe 'di skad cig ma nyid du khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If you imagine the self to be like that, then you must accept that it is momentary,

original: rtag pa la rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis khyad par rnam pa de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rtag pa la rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis khyad par rnam pa de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because such a distinction is impossible without momentariness.

original: / de'i phyir sems kho na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur bas bdag rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir sems kho na bdag ces bya bar 'gyur bas bdag rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since mind alone is called the self, the self is not permanent.

original: yang gal te bdag 'di rtag par 'gyur na ni de yongs su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nyi bar ston par mi 'gyur te nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: yang gal te bdag 'di rtag par 'gyur na ni de yongs su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir mi 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos nyi bar ston par mi 'gyur te nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: If this self were permanent, then the teaching of the Dharma, which is for the purpose of protecting it, would be pointless, like the teaching of a doctrine for the protection of space.

original: mtshon rnon po dang me dang dug dang / thog babs pa rnams kyis ni de'i spu yang 'gul bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mtshon rnon po dang me dang dug dang / thog babs pa rnams kyis ni de'i spu yang 'gul bar mi nus so //
translated: No weapon, fire, poison, or falling could harm it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /üîΩmi 'tshe ba dang bdag rtag pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa / mi 'tshe ba dang bdag rtag pa //
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is the point of the doctrine of non-harming

original: 'di la rgyu ni ci yod snyam //üîΩrnam pa kun tu'ang shing srin las //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni ci yod snyam // rnam pa kun tu'ang shing srin las //
translated: and the permanence of the self?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIn no way is a diamond

original: rdo rje bsrung byar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje bsrung byar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: protected from the worm that feeds on wood.‚Äù

original: gnod par dogs pa med pa'i rdo rje ni shing gi srin bu las yongs su bsrung bar mi rtsam mo //
analyzed: gnod par dogs pa med pa'i rdo rje ni shing gi srin bu las yongs su bsrung bar mi rtsam mo //
translated: A diamond is not protected from the worm that feeds on wood, because there is no fear of harm.

original: de bzhin du bdag rtag par yod na ni 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos mi rigs na mi 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag rtag par yod na ni 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos mi rigs na mi 'tshe ba'i bdag nyid can gyi chos 'di ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, if the self existed permanently, the doctrine of non-harming would be pointless, because the doctrine of harming would be impossible. But the doctrine of non-harming does exist.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa'i bdag khas mi blang ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa'i bdag khas mi blang ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to assert a permanent self.

original: yang na rgyu gzhan zhig brjod par bya dgos na de yang ma brjod pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na rgyu gzhan zhig brjod par bya dgos na de yang ma brjod pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Or, you must state another cause, but since you do not, this is unreasonable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: bdag ni rtag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa kho na ste /
translated: The self is definitely permanent,

original: skye ba dran pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dran pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the memory of birth exists.

original: 'du byed skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngang can rnams la ni tshe rabs gzhan dran par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'du byed skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngang can rnams la ni tshe rabs gzhan dran par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that those compounded phenomena that are destroyed immediately after they arise remember their previous lives.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi 'du byed rnams ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig @162a * //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi 'du byed rnams ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du 'jig @162a * //
translated: The compounded phenomena of another birth are destroyed in the very place where they are born.

original: la ; 'di ni gzhan dag cig kho na skye ba yin no //
analyzed: la ; 'di ni gzhan dag cig kho na skye ba yin no //
translated: But these are born in another place.

original: de'i phyir / bdag 'das pa'i dus na skye ba 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to zhes skye ba dran par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag 'das pa'i dus na skye ba 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to zhes skye ba dran par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that the self remembers its birth, thinking, ‚ÄúI was like this or like that in the past.‚Äù

original: bdag rtag pa yod na ni de nyid tshe rabs gzhan du rgyu ba'i phyir rjes su dran par rigs so //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa yod na ni de nyid tshe rabs gzhan du rgyu ba'i phyir rjes su dran par rigs so //
translated: If the self is permanent, it is reasonable that it remembers its birth in another life because it moves to another life.

original: 'di yang ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di yang ma nges pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to show that this is also uncertain, it is said:

original: skye ba dran pa yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye ba dran pa yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is memory of birth,

original: gal te khyod kyi bdag rtag na //üîΩsngon byas pa yi rma mthong nas //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi bdag rtag na // sngon byas pa yi rma mthong nas //
translated: If your self is permanent,üîΩWhy is your body not permanent?

original: khyod kyi lus ko cis mi rtag /'di na tshe rabs gzhan dag tu mtshon la sogs pas bsnun pa las byung ba'i rma'i srol rnams de lta bus nye bar mtshon pa'i lus can la la dag rnam par mi 'jig cing /
analyzed: khyod kyi lus ko cis mi rtag /'di na tshe rabs gzhan dag tu mtshon la sogs pas bsnun pa las byung ba'i rma'i srol rnams de lta bus nye bar mtshon pa'i lus can la la dag rnam par mi 'jig cing /
translated: In this life, some people who have the marks of wounds that arose from being stabbed with weapons and so on in other lives are not destroyed.

original: de ltar mngon par mtshon pa'i lus dang ldan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par mtshon pa'i lus dang ldan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: They alone have bodies that are marked in that way.

original: skye ba dang rjes su dran pa na ji ltar nyams su myong ba ltar tshe rabs gzhan gyi byung mtha' ston pa lhur byed pa dmigs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang rjes su dran pa na ji ltar nyams su myong ba ltar tshe rabs gzhan gyi byung mtha' ston pa lhur byed pa dmigs so //
translated: When they remember their past lives, they are seen to be preoccupied with recounting the events of their other lives, just as they experienced them.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa yod pas byas pa'i bdag rtag pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa ltar de dag gis lus rtag pa nyid du yang brtag par bya dgos na 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa yod pas byas pa'i bdag rtag pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa ltar de dag gis lus rtag pa nyid du yang brtag par bya dgos na 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the self is imagined to be permanent because of the memory of births, so the body also should be imagined to be permanent. But since this is not the case, it does not exist.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa spangs shing /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa spangs shing /
translated: The idea that cause and effect are identical or different is rejected.

original: rgyu'i khyad par gyis gsal bar gyur pa 'du byed kyi rgyun ni mi rtag pa kho nar yod na ni de'i nye bar len pa can btags par yod pa'i bdag gi skye ba rjes su dran no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par gyis gsal bar gyur pa 'du byed kyi rgyun ni mi rtag pa kho nar yod na ni de'i nye bar len pa can btags par yod pa'i bdag gi skye ba rjes su dran no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: If the continuum of formations, which is manifested by the specific causes, exists only as impermanent, then it is reasonable to say that the self, which is imputed to possess that continuum, remembers its births.

original: dngos po rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa ste de rnams la rnam pa de lta bu'i rkyen nye bar lhags pa yod dang gzhan du gyur pa nyid mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa ste de rnams la rnam pa de lta bu'i rkyen nye bar lhags pa yod dang gzhan du gyur pa nyid mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Things are not established by intrinsic identity, and it is not unreasonable for them to have such a mode of conditionality and to undergo transformation.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa'i rgyu can bya ba'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ma grub pa'i rgyu can bya ba'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should consider the inconceivable variety of actions that are caused by things that do not exist by virtue of their own characteristic.

original: 'di ltar 'dam bzhin du zho'i snod khang pa'i nang na gnas pa dag la thog rtsva ches mang pos g-yogs pa'i steng na gnas pa'i phu ron skye bo'i rkang rjes dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dam bzhin du zho'i snod khang pa'i nang na gnas pa dag la thog rtsva ches mang pos g-yogs pa'i steng na gnas pa'i phu ron skye bo'i rkang rjes dmigs mod kyi /
translated: For example, in a house, a pot full of yogurt is covered with a thick layer of straw, and on top of that is a large pile of hay. Although the footprints of a mouse are observed on the hay,

original: de'i rkang pa zhugs pa ni ci nas kyang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa zhugs pa ni ci nas kyang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not possible for the mouse‚Äôs foot to have penetrated through to the yogurt.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas mi 'thad @162b pa'i 'dus byas rang bzhin med cing mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba 'di'i snying po dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis chog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas mi 'thad @162b pa'i 'dus byas rang bzhin med cing mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba 'di'i snying po dang mi ldan pa nyid kyis chog go //
translated: Therefore, since this compounded phenomenon, which is untenable by the reasoning explained and to be explained, is essenceless and like a magical illusion, it is sufficient that it is devoid of essence.

original: 'di la snying po dang mi ldan pa nyid khas blangs pa ltar dngos po yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la snying po dang mi ldan pa nyid khas blangs pa ltar dngos po yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is accepted that it is devoid of essence, it is not possible to accept that things exist.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar 'thad pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar 'thad pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is certainly dependent on what is tenable.

original: de ni ji lta'am de lta'ang rung ste khas blang bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ji lta'am de lta'ang rung ste khas blang bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible to accept that in any way,

original: gzhan dag gis de mi slu ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis de mi slu ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others accept that it is nondeceptive.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa ltar rma dang bcas pa'i lus gzhan gyi rgyu can gyi lus sngon byas pa'i rmas nye bar mtshon pa rnam pa de lta bu'i las kyi bye brag gi rkyen can nye bar skye'o zhes bya ba mi srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa ltar rma dang bcas pa'i lus gzhan gyi rgyu can gyi lus sngon byas pa'i rmas nye bar mtshon pa rnam pa de lta bu'i las kyi bye brag gi rkyen can nye bar skye'o zhes bya ba mi srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not impossible to say that a body that is the effect of another body that has a wound is produced in a way that is similar to the wound, which is a specific condition of karma, just as one remembers one‚Äôs birth.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa yod pa 'di las bdag rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dran pa yod pa 'di las bdag rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the self is permanent on the basis of this memory of birth,

original: lus kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyang rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the body is also permanent.

original: yang ji ltar bdag 'dis skye ba dran no zhes bya bar rtog pa gal te rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin na ni de mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bdag 'dis skye ba dran no zhes bya bar rtog pa gal te rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin na ni de mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, if one thinks, ‚ÄúI remember this birth,‚Äù if it is by its own nature, that is not tenable.

original: de ni mi rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the intrinsic reality of non-conceptuality.

original: ci ste sems pa can dang ldan pa las yin no snyam du rtog pa na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste sems pa can dang ldan pa las yin no snyam du rtog pa na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But if you think that it is due to possessing a mind, that also is illogical.

original: rang gi ngo bo btang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo btang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that its intrinsic reality would be relinquished.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩsems pa can dang ldan pa dag / gal te shes pa nyid yin na //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / sems pa can dang ldan pa dag / gal te shes pa nyid yin na //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:üîΩIf possessing a mindüîΩis just consciousness,

original: de yis sems pa can sems pa //
analyzed: de yis sems pa can sems pa //
translated: then it would not be the mind possessing a mind,

original: min zhing skyes bu rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: min zhing skyes bu rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: and the person would be permanent and unchanging.

original: gal te blo la sogs pa rnams ni bdag gi yon tan yin zhing de rnams dang ldan pas bdag yon tan gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug cing dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin mi 'dor ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te blo la sogs pa rnams ni bdag gi yon tan yin zhing de rnams dang ldan pas bdag yon tan gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug cing dngos po rnams kyang rang bzhin mi 'dor ba yin la /
translated: If the mind and so on are qualities of the self and due to possessing them the self engages in accordance with the qualities, and things do not relinquish their intrinsic reality,

original: de rnams don gzhan dang 'brel pa las bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan par gyur na ni 'on te de rnams la khyad par sngar yod pa ma yin par rnam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams don gzhan dang 'brel pa las bya ba'i khyad par dang ldan par gyur na ni 'on te de rnams la khyad par sngar yod pa ma yin par rnam par 'gyur ro //
translated: then if they are related to another object and come to possess a particular action, then they would be transformed, but if they do not possess a particular action, then they would not be transformed.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa yang ma yin pas khyod kyi bdag rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa yang ma yin pas khyod kyi bdag rang bzhin med de /
translated: But since those that are subject to change do not have an intrinsic reality, your self does not exist essentially,

original: ri me la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ji ltar sems pa can nyid dang ldan pas bdag sems pa can du 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i bdag dang ldan pas sems can yang sems pa @163a * //
analyzed: ri me la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ji ltar sems pa can nyid dang ldan pas bdag sems pa can du 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems pa can ma yin pa'i bdag dang ldan pas sems can yang sems pa @163a * //
translated: because it is subject to change, like a fire and so on.

original: can ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur //
analyzed: can ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, just as the self is a sentient being because it possesses sentience, why wouldn‚Äôt a sentient being be a non-sentient being because it possesses a non-sentient self?

original: de'i phyir 'di la skye ba dran pa nyid mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems pa can nyid kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin pas bdag la rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la skye ba dran pa nyid mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems pa can nyid kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin pas bdag la rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not only is it illogical to remember birth in this case, but because it is illogical to be sentient, the self is also not permanent.

original: gzhan yang bdag 'di ji ltar sems pa can nyid dang ldan pas sems pa de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang ldan pas sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i phyir khyad par de dang de 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag 'di ji ltar sems pa can nyid dang ldan pas sems pa de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang ldan pas sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo nyams pa'i phyir khyad par de dang de 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, since this self is endowed with the quality of being conscious, it is conscious. In the same way, since it is endowed with pleasure, pain, and so on, it obtains this or that distinction due to the degeneration of its prior intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate this, the treatise states:

original: bde ba la sogs dang ldan srog /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs dang ldan srog /
translated: The life force endowed with pleasure and so on

original: bde sogs bzhin du sna tshogs mthong //
analyzed: bde sogs bzhin du sna tshogs mthong //
translated: Is seen to be diverse, like pleasure and so on.

original: de phyir bde la sogs bzhin te //
analyzed: de phyir bde la sogs bzhin te //
translated: Therefore, like pleasure and so on,

original: rtag pa nyid du'ang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du'ang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable as permanent.

original: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dag tu 'di la khyad par 'ga' yang med na ni de dag phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dag tu 'di la khyad par 'ga' yang med na ni de dag phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this self were not different in any way during the states of pleasure and pain, then they would not be mutually distinct.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi yon tan 'di rnams tha dad par bgrang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi yon tan 'di rnams tha dad par bgrang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, these qualities of the self would not be counted as distinct.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar bdag 'dis bde ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rjes su byed par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar bdag 'dis bde ba la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rjes su byed par bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that this self must follow after the various things such as pleasure.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyang bde ba la sogs pa kho na ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyang bde ba la sogs pa kho na ltar 'di rtag pa nyid du yang mi rigs so //
translated: And it is not tenable that it follows after them just like pleasure, etc.

original: 'ang gi sgras ni byed pa po nyid dang bya ba po nyid dang gcig nyid la sogs pa thams cad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni byed pa po nyid dang bya ba po nyid dang gcig nyid la sogs pa thams cad sel bar byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù excludes the self being the agent, the experiencer, being one, and so on.

original: yang gzhan dag ni gang gi ltar na skyes bu sems pa can ma yin pa de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni gang gi ltar na skyes bu sems pa can ma yin pa de la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: Others say: This fault would apply to those who assert a nonmental person.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa ci yang med do zhes smra'o ;
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi 'dod pa ci yang med do zhes smra'o ;
translated: But according to us, since the person is the nature of consciousness, there is no fault at all.

original: / de'i lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: / de'i lugs kyang mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To show that their system is also untenable, it is said:

original: gal te shes pa yod rtag na //
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod rtag na //
translated: If consciousness exists,

original: byed pa log par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: byed pa log par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: its activity would be reversed.

original: gal te me ni rtag 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te me ni rtag 'gyur na //
translated: If fire were permanent,

original: bud shing gis don yod mi 'gyur //üîΩ'di gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa byed par gyur ba rnams kyi 'jug pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la 'bab pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i blo gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pas rjes su bsgyur ba rnams nye bar skye zhing blos zhen par
analyzed: bud shing gis don yod mi 'gyur // 'di gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa byed par gyur ba rnams kyi 'jug pa dag gzugs la sogs pa'i don rnams la 'bab pa de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i blo gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pas rjes su bsgyur ba rnams nye bar skye zhing blos zhen par
translated: The fuel does not cause the non-existent to exist.

original: byas pa'i don de yang skyes bus sems par byed do //üîΩshes pa yod pa nyid kyang yul rtogs @163b pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin la skyes bu de yang de las tha mi dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / rtag pa yang yin te rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i don de yang skyes bus sems par byed do // shes pa yod pa nyid kyang yul rtogs @163b pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin la skyes bu de yang de las tha mi dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / rtag pa yang yin te rtag tu nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the eye, etc. are functioning, and their activity is directed toward the objects, form, etc., then the cognitions of form, etc., which are modified by the aspects of form, etc., arise, and the object, which is grasped by the cognition, is cognized by the person.üîΩThe existence of cognition is the nature of the realization of the object, and the person is not different from that in nature, and is also permanent, because it is always present.

original: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad par gnas pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid kyang rtag tu nye ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad par gnas pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa nyid kyang rtag tu nye ba yin no //
translated: Since it is present, not different from the nature of the person, the existence of cognition is also always present.

original: de'i phyir 'di la mig la sogs pa'i byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la mig la sogs pa'i byed pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the activity of the eye, etc. is useless in this case, it is pointless.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams med na de rnams kyi 'jug pa dag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa rnams med na de rnams kyi 'jug pa dag med par 'gyur la /
translated: If eyes and so on do not exist, their engagement would not exist.

original: de med pas kyang blo med cing blo med pas kyang shes pa nyid med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa byed par rigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de med pas kyang blo med cing blo med pas kyang shes pa nyid med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas mig la sogs pa byed par rigs par 'gyur na /
translated: And if that does not exist, then mind would not exist and if mind does not exist, consciousness itself would not exist. At that time, it would be logical that eyes and so on function in order to serve a purpose.

original: gang gi tshe ji skad smras pa'i tshul la ltos pa med pa kho nas shes pa yod pa nyid rtag pa yod pa de'i tshe ni byed pa log par 'gyur ba ste /üîΩgang gi ltar na bud shing med par me mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad smras pa'i tshul la ltos pa med pa kho nas shes pa yod pa nyid rtag pa yod pa de'i tshe ni byed pa log par 'gyur ba ste / gang gi ltar na bud shing med par me mi 'byung zhing /
translated: But when consciousness exists in the way it is described, without depending on anything else, it is permanent and at that time, its function would be reversed.

original: yod na ni 'byung ba de'i ltar na ni bud shing tshol bar rigs na gang gi ltar na me rtag par yod do zhes bya ba khas len pa de ltan bud shing nye bar sog dgos pa med pa kho na ste 'di ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yod na ni 'byung ba de'i ltar na ni bud shing tshol bar rigs na gang gi ltar na me rtag par yod do zhes bya ba khas len pa de ltan bud shing nye bar sog dgos pa med pa kho na ste 'di ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, if fire does not arise without fuel and if it arises when it exists, it is logical to seek fuel. But if one asserts that fire exists permanently, then it is not logical to seek fuel. This is similar to that.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni chen po la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyis 'jug pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid kyis 'di'i bstan bcos su lo rgyus byed pa'i ngal ba don med pa kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni chen po la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyis 'jug pa'i 'bras bu med pa nyid kyis 'di'i bstan bcos su lo rgyus byed pa'i ngal ba don med pa kho nar rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, since this has no result that is engaged by the group of transformations such as the great one, etc., it is understood that the effort to make it the subject of this treatise is pointless.

original: ci ste skyes bu ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: ci ste skyes bu ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: If one says that the person is the nature of the existence of consciousness,

original: de mig la sogs pa byed pa'i bya ba'i rgyu can blo mngon par gsal ba las shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pas mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mig la sogs pa byed pa'i bya ba'i rgyu can blo mngon par gsal ba las shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pas mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: since the existence of consciousness is engaged through the clarity of the mind that is the cause of the action of the eye, etc., it becomes clear.

original: skyes bu ni nye bar longs spyod pa po yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu ni nye bar longs spyod pa po yin la /
translated: The person is the experiencer,

original: de yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bya ba mngon par grub pas yul la sems par byed do //
analyzed: de yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bya ba mngon par grub pas yul la sems par byed do //
translated: and since the action of the experience of objects is accomplished, it thinks about objects.

original: de'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bya ba de ni shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bya ba yin la de yang mig la sogs pa byed pa'i tshogs med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs 'di don med pa nyid
analyzed: de'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bya ba de ni shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bya ba yin la de yang mig la sogs pa byed pa'i tshogs med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs 'di don med pa nyid
translated: The action of the object‚Äôs enjoyment is the action that has the nature of the engagement of consciousness‚Äôs existence. Moreover, since that does not occur without the assembly of the eye and so on, how could this assembly of transformations be meaningless?

original: du ga la 'gyur snyam na bshad par bya ste /üîΩgal te shes pa yod pa shes pa yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin la de yang bya ba'i rang bzhin can yin na ni de'i tshe 'di'i @164a * //
analyzed: du ga la 'gyur snyam na bshad par bya ste / gal te shes pa yod pa shes pa yod pa nyid kyi 'jug pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin la de yang bya ba'i rang bzhin can yin na ni de'i tshe 'di'i @164a * //
translated: We will explain this.

original: bya ba'i chos las mi 'da' bar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: bya ba'i chos las mi 'da' bar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If the existence of consciousness is the nature of the engagement of consciousness‚Äôs existence and that is also the nature of action, then at that time it is necessary that it not transcend the quality of action.

original: bya ba rnams kyi chos kyang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: bya ba rnams kyi chos kyang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the quality of action?

original: rdzas la brten pa nyid dang g-yo ba nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar / rdzas ni bya ba ji bzhin du //
analyzed: rdzas la brten pa nyid dang g-yo ba nyid do // 'di ltar / rdzas ni bya ba ji bzhin du //
translated: It is the dependence on substance and movement.üîΩThus:üîΩSubstance does not move

original: 'jig pa'i bar du g-yo ba med //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bar du g-yo ba med //
translated: Until it is destroyed, just like action.

original: bya ba ni rdzas kyi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ni rdzas kyi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Action is the nature of the substance‚Äôs activity.

original: de ni skyes pa nas bzung ste 'jig pa'i bar du g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes pa nas bzung ste 'jig pa'i bar du g-yo ba yin no //
translated: It moves from the time it is produced until it is destroyed.

original: 'di ltar shing la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa nye bar lhags pa med par bya ba mi rtsom pa rnams skyes nas 'jig pa'i bar ni rnam par mi g-yo bar spod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing la sogs pa rlung la sogs pa nye bar lhags pa med par bya ba mi rtsom pa rnams skyes nas 'jig pa'i bar ni rnam par mi g-yo bar spod la /
translated: Thus, a tree, etc., which does not begin activity in the absence of the presence of wind, etc., is not observed to move from the time it is produced until it is destroyed.

original: 'di rnams kyi 'gul ba'i bya ba rlung la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni ma zhig bar du g-yo ba nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi 'gul ba'i bya ba rlung la sogs pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni ma zhig bar du g-yo ba nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: The activity of its trembling, which occurs due to the condition of wind, etc., does not pass beyond trembling until it is destroyed.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa /
translated: Since this is so,

original: des na skyes bu yod ces pa //
analyzed: des na skyes bu yod ces pa //
translated: it is not correct to say that a person exists

original: yod pa med ces byar mi rigs //
analyzed: yod pa med ces byar mi rigs //
translated: or that existence does not exist.

original: ji ltar shing la sogs pa rnams g-yo ba'i bya ba rtsom pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na rdzas kyi rang bzhin shing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa de bzhin du skyes bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la sogs pa rnams g-yo ba'i bya ba rtsom pa'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na rdzas kyi rang bzhin shing la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du dmigs pa de bzhin du skyes bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as a tree, etc., is observed to have the nature of a substance, characterized as a tree, etc., in the state prior to the activity of trembling, so it is not for a person.

original: de ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyang rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid du yang yod pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni shes pa yod pa nyid kyang rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir shes pa yod pa dang bral ba'i bdag nyid du yang yod pa yin no zhes bya bar brtag par mi nus so //
translated: Because the existence of consciousness is its intrinsic reality, and because there is no intrinsic reality of substance that is different from that, it is not possible to conceive that it exists as a self that is devoid of the existence of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu yod kyi shes pa yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu yod kyi shes pa yod pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to say that the person exists but the existence of consciousness does not.

original: gang yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa'i phyir de'i tshe skyes bu yod pa nyid du rtog pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa yod pa'i phyir de'i tshe skyes bu yod pa nyid du rtog pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Also, it is not logical to conceive that the person exists at that time because of the existence of the potential of the existence of consciousness.

original: rten med pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a potential that lacks a basis does not exist.

original: ji ltar shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa yod pa nyid las tha dad pa'i skyes bu ni mi srid pa de bzhin du nus pa'i gnas skabs na yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa tsam las tha dad pa'i skyes bu
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa yod pa nyid 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na shes pa yod pa nyid las tha dad pa'i skyes bu ni mi srid pa de bzhin du nus pa'i gnas skabs na yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa tsam las tha dad pa'i skyes bu
translated: Just as it is impossible for a person who is different from the existence of consciousness to exist when the existence of consciousness is in the state of engagement, so too, when the potential exists, a person who is different from the mere potential of the existence of consciousness does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: de'i phyir rten med pa'i nus pa med la ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rten med pa'i nus pa med la ;
translated: Therefore, without a basis, there is no potential,

original: nus pa med pa las kyang nus pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por 'gyur ba la nye bar mkho ba nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams nye bar mkho ba dang bcas pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de mi rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: nus pa med pa las kyang nus pa gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por 'gyur ba la nye bar mkho ba nyid kyis mig la sogs pa rnams nye bar mkho ba dang bcas pa nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de mi rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: and without potential, the eye and so on would be posited as having a purpose because of the need for the manifestation of the potential that has the nature of an entity. But this is illogical.

original: de'i phyir / gal te shes pa yod rtag na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te shes pa yod rtag na //
translated: Therefore, if consciousness exists,

analyzed: byed @164b pa log par 'gyur ba ste /

original: zhes bya ba 'di mi 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di mi 'jug go //

original: gzhan yang gal te skyes bu 'di shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa gsal ba las /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te skyes bu 'di shes pa yod pa nyid kyi nus pa gsal ba las /
translated: Moreover, if the potential of this person‚Äôs consciousness were to manifest,üîΩprior to this consciousness, it would be the entity of the potential of the existent consciousness.

original: sngar shes pa 'di'i snga rol na shes pa yod pa'i nus pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /üîΩgzhan du shes pa yod pa'i khams //
analyzed: sngar shes pa 'di'i snga rol na shes pa yod pa'i nus pa'i ngo bor 'gyur na ni de'i tshe / gzhan du shes pa yod pa'i khams //
translated: In that case,

original: mthong zhing gzhan du shes yod de //
analyzed: mthong zhing gzhan du shes yod de //
translated: The element of consciousness is seen elsewhere, and the existence of consciousness is known elsewhere.

original: shes pa yod pa la tshul gnyis rtog na khyod kyis shes pa yod pa las gzhan du ste tha dad pa nyid du shes pa yod pa'i khams te /üîΩshes pa yod pa'i sa bon shes pa yod pa'i nus pa dang shes pa yod pa'i nus pa las kyang gzhan du ste tha dad par shes pa yod pa mthong ste de'i phyir shes pa yod pa'i khams las shes pa yod pa 'byung na khams dang yul mtshungs
analyzed: shes pa yod pa la tshul gnyis rtog na khyod kyis shes pa yod pa las gzhan du ste tha dad pa nyid du shes pa yod pa'i khams te / shes pa yod pa'i sa bon shes pa yod pa'i nus pa dang shes pa yod pa'i nus pa las kyang gzhan du ste tha dad par shes pa yod pa mthong ste de'i phyir shes pa yod pa'i khams las shes pa yod pa 'byung na khams dang yul mtshungs
translated: If you imagine that the existence of consciousness is twofold, you see the existence of consciousness as different from the existence of consciousness, as different from the seed of the existence of consciousness, as different from the potential of the existence of consciousness, and as different from the cause of the existence of consciousness.

original: par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: Therefore, if the existence of consciousness arises from the element of the existence of consciousness, the object and the element would be the same.

original: dpe bshad pa /
analyzed: dpe bshad pa /
translated: The example is stated:

original: lcags kyi zhu nyid bzhin de'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lcags kyi zhu nyid bzhin de'i phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the molten iron,

original: 'dir dper na lcags zhu ba nyid du 'gyur ba na lcags kyi yul las tha mi dad pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dir dper na lcags zhu ba nyid du 'gyur ba na lcags kyi yul las tha mi dad pa'i yul can du 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dag ni mngon par mi 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir yul mtshungs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The seed and the sprout are not seen to be non-arisen, so they are not the same object.

original: skyes bu las ni mngon par 'byung ba dang mi mngon par gyur pa gnyis med pas yul mtshungs pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: skyes bu las ni mngon par 'byung ba dang mi mngon par gyur pa gnyis med pas yul mtshungs pa nyid yod do //
translated: Since the person does not have the two, namely, manifestation and non-manifestation, it is not tenable that it is the same as the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lcags kyi zhu nyid bzhin zhes lcags kyi zhu ba nyid dpe gzhan smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lcags kyi zhu nyid bzhin zhes lcags kyi zhu ba nyid dpe gzhan smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is like the fluidity of iron. Another example is mentioned:

analyzed: shes pa yod pa'i nus pa'i ngo bo las tha dad par skyes bu'i nus pa gsal bar yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The capacity of the person does not exist as a manifest entity separate from the entity of the capacity of consciousness,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir nus pa'i ngo bor gyur pa 'di gsal ba'i ngo bor gyur pa na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa'i ngo bor gyur pa 'di gsal ba'i ngo bor gyur pa na ;
translated: Therefore, when the entity of the capacity becomes the entity of the manifest,

analyzed: lcags kyi zhu nyid bzhin de'i phyir //

original: skyes bu rnam par 'gyur ba 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes bu rnam par 'gyur ba 'gyur //

analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba nyid las kyang lcags kho na bzhin du bdag la rtag pa nyid med do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: And because of transformation, like iron, the self does not exist as permanent.

original: yang gzhan dag ni kho bo cag ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni kho bo cag ni skyes bu shes pa yod pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, others say, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that the person is the entity of consciousness.

original: 'o na ci zhe na shes yod yid tsam zhig la ste //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na shes yod yid tsam zhig la ste //
translated: But what is there? There is the mere existence of consciousness.

original: skyes bu nam mkha' bzhin du che //
analyzed: skyes bu nam mkha' bzhin du che //
translated: The person is as great as space.

original: srog chags thams cad la lus re re zhing yod pa'i bdag nyid ni nam mkha' ltar khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad la lus re re zhing yod pa'i bdag nyid ni nam mkha' ltar khyab pa yin la /

analyzed: de'i yid tsam dang ldan pa shes pa yod pa ni thams cad la khyab pa ma yin no // yod kyang bdag gi @165a * //
translated: The mere existence of its consciousness does not pervade all of them.

original: phyogs rdul phra rab tsam nyid la ldan pa zhig ste /
analyzed: phyogs rdul phra rab tsam nyid la ldan pa zhig ste /
translated: Even though it exists, it is associated with a part of the person, which is the size of an atom.üîΩTherefore, when it is associated with the mind, the person produces a consciousness that is not different from its object.

original: des na yid dang sbyar nas skyes bus de dang yul tha mi dad pa can gyi shes pa yod pa skyed par byed de de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i skyon gyi skabs med do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: des na yid dang sbyar nas skyes bus de dang yul tha mi dad pa can gyi shes pa yod pa skyed par byed de de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ji skad smras pa'i skyon gyi skabs med do zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we say that our position is not open to the fault that you have stated.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyis skyes bu nam mkha' ltar shin tu che ba 'di'i shes pa yod pa yid tsam khas len la /
translated: You accept that the mere existence of the consciousness of this person, who is as great as space, is the size of the mind.

original: de'i phyir de yi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yi ngo bo ni //
translated: Therefore, its nature

original: shes pa yod nyid min ltar mthong //
analyzed: shes pa yod nyid min ltar mthong //

original: de ltar yin dang skyes bu shes pa yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang skyes bu shes pa yod pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the person would be only nonexistence of consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab tsam gyi phyogs dang shes pa yod pa dang 'brel pas skyes bu shes pa yod pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab tsam gyi phyogs dang shes pa yod pa dang 'brel pas skyes bu shes pa yod pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus so //

analyzed: rdul phra rab tsam gyi lan tshva dang 'brel pas gang g'a'i klung gi chu lan tshva dang bcas so snyam du bsam par nus pa ni ma yin te /

original: 'di ni de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: bdag ni rdzas yin zhing shes pa yod pa ni yon tan gyi ngo bo yin te /

original: de gnyis phan tshun tha dad pas skyes bu ni shes pa yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig go //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun tha dad pas skyes bu ni shes pa yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo kho na zhig go //
translated: Since these two are mutually different, the person is only the nature of the nonexistence of consciousness.

original: shes pa yod pa ma yin pa de la ni bum pa ltar bdag nyid du rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin pas bdag rtag par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa ma yin pa de la ni bum pa ltar bdag nyid du rtag par rigs pa yang ma yin pas bdag rtag par mi 'thad do //
translated: Since the nonexistence of consciousness is not reasonable as an identity, like a pot, it is not tenable that the self is permanent.

original: yang gal te bdag 'di sems can re re zhing thams cad du yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang gal te bdag 'di sems can re re zhing thams cad du yod par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe /

analyzed: gal te bdag kun la yod na //

analyzed: gzhan gyis de der cis mi rtogs //

original: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis na bdag nam mkha' ltar thams cad du 'gro zhing thams cad du khyab par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can gzhan la yang bdag gi bdag yod pas bdag nyid kyi bzhin du der de la ngar 'dzin pa ci ste mi 'byung
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi lugs kyis na bdag nam mkha' ltar thams cad du 'gro zhing thams cad du khyab par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can gzhan la yang bdag gi bdag yod pas bdag nyid kyi bzhin du der de la ngar 'dzin pa ci ste mi 'byung
translated: If, according to your system, the self is omnipresent like space and pervades everything, then the self of one sentient being would exist in the bodies of all other sentient beings. Therefore, just as it is apprehended in one‚Äôs own body, why would it not be apprehended in the bodies of others?

analyzed: / gal te bdag ltar gzhan yang bdag gi bdag la ngar 'dzin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the self of one person were apprehended as the self of another,

original: de ltar na de thams cad na yod pa nyid du rigs pa zhig go //üîΩgzhan gyi lus la gzhan gyi bdag gis bdag gi bdag bsgribs par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de thams cad na yod pa nyid du rigs pa zhig go // gzhan gyi lus la gzhan gyi bdag gis bdag gi bdag bsgribs par rigs pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag gi yul ni bdag gi bdag med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The object of the self of one person is not the self of another.

analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi khyab pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that it pervades all of the self.üîΩWhen the object is the same, it cannot be said that it obscures itself.

original: gang gi tshe yul mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de'i @165b tsho des de la sgrib par brjod par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩde nyid kyis ni de nyid la //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yul mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de'i @165b tsho des de la sgrib par brjod par mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / de nyid kyis ni de nyid la //
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

analyzed: sgrib ces bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to sayüîΩthat it obscures itself.

original: yul mtshungs pa'i phyir rang gi bdag gi ngo bo ltar rang gi bdag gis gzhan gyi bdag la sgrib pa yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi bdag kyang ngar 'dzin pa'i yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: yul mtshungs pa'i phyir rang gi bdag gi ngo bo ltar rang gi bdag gis gzhan gyi bdag la sgrib pa yod pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi bdag kyang ngar 'dzin pa'i yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: Because the object is the same, it does not obscure itself, just as it does not obscure itself in its own nature. Therefore it follows that the other‚Äôs self would be the object of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de ltar yang ma yin pas bdag thams cad na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pas bdag thams cad na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since that is not the case, the self does not exist in all.

original: de ltar re zhig lugs gnyi ga ltar yang bdag yod pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan nas yon tan rnams kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi byed pa po nyid du mi srid pas mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lugs gnyi ga ltar yang bdag yod pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan nas yon tan rnams kyang 'gro ba mtha' dag gi byed pa po nyid du mi srid pas mi rigs pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to show that the qualities are also untenable as the creator of all transmigrators, it is said:üîΩBecause the qualities, the creator,

analyzed: gang phyir yon tan byed po dang // rnam kun shes yod ma yin pa // de dag dang ni smyon pa la //

translated: The three qualities are rajas, tamas, and sattva.

original: de dag cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs ni gtso bo yin la skye ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de dag cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs ni gtso bo yin la skye ba'i gnas skabs ni rang bzhin yin no //

analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin skyes bu yul nye bar longs spyod par 'dod pa rigs pa de ni de'i tshe sems pa can ma yin par gyur kyang skyes bu dang tha mi dad par rtogs par byas nas rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs mtha'
translated: The person who is the nature of the three qualities and who desires to enjoy objects is the creator. At that time, even though he is not conscious, he is understood to be not different from the person.üîΩ

analyzed: dag skyed par byed do // de la tshul ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
