analyzed: snying stobs can dang / rdul can dang / mun pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: called the sattvika, rƒÅjasika, and tƒÅmasika.

original: de la snying stobs can gyi nga rgyal las ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / pags pa zhes bya ba'i blo'i dbang po lnga dang / ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: de la snying stobs can gyi nga rgyal las ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / pags pa zhes bya ba'i blo'i dbang po lnga dang / ngag dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rkub dang / mdoms zhes bya ba las kyi dbang po lnga dang /
translated: From the pride of sattva, the five intellectual faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body, the five action faculties of speech, hand, foot, anus, and penis,

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi yid de de ltar na bcug cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi yid de de ltar na bcug cig 'byung ngo //
translated: and the mind which is of the nature of both are produced. Thus, ten are produced.

original: rdul can gyi nga rgyal las ni de tsam lnga ste /
analyzed: rdul can gyi nga rgyal las ni de tsam lnga ste /
translated: From the pride of rajas, the five tanmatras are produced.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa dag go //
translated: They are form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de tsam las ni 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de tsam las ni 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: From the tanmatras, the elements are produced.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / @166a * //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / @166a * //
translated: They are earth, water, fire,

original: rlung dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang / nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and air, and space.

original: mun pa can gyi nga rgyal ni //
analyzed: mun pa can gyi nga rgyal ni //
translated: The pride of tamas

original: gnyi ga'i 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: is the instigator of both.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba mtha' dag gi 'jug par byed pa ni yon tan gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba mtha' dag gi 'jug par byed pa ni yon tan gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, because they are the entities that are the transformations of the nature, the three qualities are the agents that impel all transformations.

original: de ltar yon tan rnams byed pa po nyid dang / shes pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba rgol ba mtha' dag gi bsam pa yin pa de dag dang smyon pa rnams la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po'i de nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan rnams byed pa po nyid dang / shes pa yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba rgol ba mtha' dag gi bsam pa yin pa de dag dang smyon pa rnams la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes dngos po'i de nyid la mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, the entire position of the Samkhya‚Äîthat the qualities are the agents and that consciousness does not exist‚Äîis no different from the position of lunatics.

original: smyon pa ni rgyud las shes pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smyon pa ni rgyud las shes pa phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The lunatics are those whose mindstreams are afflicted by a disorder of the elements.

original: de ni phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa de don ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs shing phyin ci log tu'ang nges par 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log gi rnam par shes pa de don ji lta ba bzhin mi rtogs shing phyin ci log tu'ang nges par 'dzin par byed la /
translated: They do not understand the meaning of consciousness that is distorted and they grasp it as distorted.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i don yang rdol bar byed de grangs can 'di yang de bzhin du yon tan shes pa yod pa ma yin pa rnams bstan bcos kyi sgo nas byed pa po nyid du ston pa na don ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de ltar mi
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i don yang rdol bar byed de grangs can 'di yang de bzhin du yon tan shes pa yod pa ma yin pa rnams bstan bcos kyi sgo nas byed pa po nyid du ston pa na don ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de ltar mi
translated: Also, the meaning of what does not exist is distorted because the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, in the same way, teaches that the nonexistent qualities are the creator through the treatise.

original: rtogs shing phyin ci log tu yang nges par 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: rtogs shing phyin ci log tu yang nges par 'dzin par byed la /
translated: When he does not understand the meaning as it is, he also grasps it in a distorted way.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i don gtam par yang byed pas smyon pa rnams dang mtshungs pa kho na zhig go snyam mo //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i don gtam par yang byed pas smyon pa rnams dang mtshungs pa kho na zhig go snyam mo //
translated: Also, he distorts the meaning of what does not exist. Therefore he is just like a madman.

original: gzhan yang 'di'i skyes bu 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyi byed pa po ma yin zhing za ba po yin la yon tan rnams ni byed pa po yin gyi za ba po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i skyes bu 'di ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs kyi byed pa po ma yin zhing za ba po yin la yon tan rnams ni byed pa po yin gyi za ba po ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, this person is not the creator of the collection of transformations, but he is the experiencer. The qualities are the creator but not the experiencer.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i yon tan rnams rigs pa med pa'i byed pa po nyid dang za ba po ma yin pa nyid du ston pa na bdag nyid shin tu mi rigs pa smra ba nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i yon tan rnams rigs pa med pa'i byed pa po nyid dang za ba po ma yin pa nyid du ston pa na bdag nyid shin tu mi rigs pa smra ba nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, when it is shown that the qualities are not the agent and not the experiencer, it is clear that the self is a very unreasonable speaker.üîΩThe qualities are not the agent

original: yon tan rnams kyis rnam kun tu //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyis rnam kun tu //
translated: in any way,

original: khyim la sogs dag byed shes kyi //
analyzed: khyim la sogs dag byed shes kyi //
translated: but they are known as the purifiers of the house, etc.

original: za bar rnam par mi shes pa //
analyzed: za bar rnam par mi shes pa //
translated: They are not known as the experiencer.

original: 'di las mi rigs gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: 'di las mi rigs gzhan ci yod //
translated: What is more unreasonable than this?

original: smra ba 'di ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang ; 'jig rten gyis mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'di las mi rigs pa gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba 'di ni rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang ; 'jig rten gyis mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'di las mi rigs pa gzhan yod pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This statement is unreasonable because it contradicts reason and because it is not accepted in the world. It is thought that there is nothing more unreasonable than this.

original: de ltar na re zhig yon tan rnams byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig yon tan rnams byed pa po nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, first of all, it is unreasonable for the qualities to be the agent.

original: gang gi ltar bdag kho na chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi byed pa po dang / de dag @166b 'bras bu'i za ba po yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de'i bdag kyang rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi ltar bdag kho na chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi byed pa po dang / de dag @166b 'bras bu'i za ba po yin no zhes bya bar 'dod pa de'i bdag kyang rtag pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: The self that is asserted to be the creator of both virtue and nonvirtue and the experiencer of their effects is also unreasonable as permanent.

original: 'di ltar / bya ba dang ldan rtag pa med //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bya ba dang ldan rtag pa med //
translated: There is no permanent creator.

original: 'di na byed pas na byed pa po yin la de'i byed pa po nyid ni bya ba'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: 'di na byed pas na byed pa po yin la de'i byed pa po nyid ni bya ba'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: Here, one is a creator because of activity. That status of creator is due to the cause of activity.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed cing rgyu med pa na 'ga' yang byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed cing rgyu med pa na 'ga' yang byed pa po yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: If it does not perform any activity at all and is without cause, it is unreasonable to call it a creator.

original: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du yod na yang nges par bya ba rtsom pa'i dus na 'di la bya ba de'i sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du yod na yang nges par bya ba rtsom pa'i dus na 'di la bya ba de'i sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Even if it exists as endowed with activity, when one definitely begins activity, one must accept that it is different from its prior state.

original: snga phyi'i gnas skabs dag tu khyad par med pa'i bdag ni sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga phyi'i gnas skabs dag tu khyad par med pa'i bdag ni sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin du bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self is not different in its prior and subsequent states, it will not be endowed with activity, just as it was in its prior state.

original: rags pa me dang rlung la sogs pa bya ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rags pa me dang rlung la sogs pa bya ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But gross things such as fire and wind, which are endowed with activity, are not permanent.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And so it is with this self, which would not be permanent.

original: gzhan yang bdag 'di'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag 'di'i bya ba dang ldan pa nyid mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is not logical that this self is endowed with activity,

original: thams cad na yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad na yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted as existing everywhere.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po brten pa'am lam la brten par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po brten pa'am lam la brten par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: That which is called activity is either based on the agent or based on the path.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is of two kinds:

original: byed pa'i ngo bo dang / dngos po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i ngo bo dang / dngos po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of activity and the nature of the thing.

original: de la byed pa po la brten pa byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'di lta ste 'gro ba'i bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de la byed pa po la brten pa byed pa'i ngo bo ni 'di lta ste 'gro ba'i bya ba'o ;
translated: Among them, the nature of activity based on the agent is like the activity of going.

original: / de ni 'gro ba po lha sbyin la gnas te /
analyzed: / de ni 'gro ba po lha sbyin la gnas te /
translated: That is based on the goer Devadatta,

original: de dang 'brel pa las lha sbyin 'gro zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa las lha sbyin 'gro zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: and because of its connection with him, it is said that Devadatta goes.

original: de ni thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i phyir rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya bas yul snga phyi gnyis gtong ba dang len pa'i phyir bya ba dang bcas par rigs so //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i phyir rkang pa 'degs pa dang 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya bas yul snga phyi gnyis gtong ba dang len pa'i phyir bya ba dang bcas par rigs so //
translated: Because it does not pervade all, it is reasonable that it has action, because it takes up and gives up the two temporal periods of prior and later places through the action characterized by lifting and lowering the foot.

original: gal te 'di thams cad du song ba nyid du rtog na de'i tshe gang du 'gro bar gyur pa 'di nye bar mi gnas pa gang zhig na yod /üîΩgang gi phyir 'di /
analyzed: gal te 'di thams cad du song ba nyid du rtog na de'i tshe gang du 'gro bar gyur pa 'di nye bar mi gnas pa gang zhig na yod / gang gi phyir 'di /
translated: If you imagine that it pervades all, then at that time, since it is not present, where does it exist?üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it exists in that way,

original: de ltar yin pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: de ltar yin pa de yi phyir //
translated: therefore,

original: kun tu song la bya ba med //
analyzed: kun tu song la bya ba med //
translated: it does not have action.

original: lha sbyin 'dug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa po la gnas pa mi 'gul ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de yang sngar gyi bya ba bcom nas rtsom pa na sngar bdag nyid des lus bkod pa
analyzed: lha sbyin 'dug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa byed pa po la gnas pa mi 'gul ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bya ba dngos po'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de yang sngar gyi bya ba bcom nas rtsom pa na sngar bdag nyid des lus bkod pa
translated: In such statements as ‚ÄúDevadatta is sitting,‚Äù the action that is the characteristic of the agent‚Äôs remaining in one place without moving is an entity. When it begins after it has destroyed the previous action, it is not tenable that it is the agent that previously arranged its body in that way.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not tenable that it exists in that way.

original: sa phyogs dang ldan pa'i lha sbyin la khyab bdag ma yin pa nyid yod dang rigs @167a * //
analyzed: sa phyogs dang ldan pa'i lha sbyin la khyab bdag ma yin pa nyid yod dang rigs @167a * //
translated: It is not the case that the pervader of Devadatta who possesses a place does not exist.

original: par 'gyur gyi thams cad du song ba la ni ma mnan pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid nas bya ba dang ldan pa nyid mi rigs so //
analyzed: par 'gyur gyi thams cad du song ba la ni ma mnan pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid nas bya ba dang ldan pa nyid mi rigs so //
translated: It is not the case that the pervader, God, exists in relation to a place, because it is not tenable that God has activity, since there is no place whatsoever that is not pervaded by him.

original: de bzhin du las la gnas pa'i bya ba 'gul ba'i bdag nyid can sbyong la sogs pa nas phye ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa mi 'gul ba'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la gnas pa'i byed pa dang dngos po gnyis dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las la gnas pa'i bya ba 'gul ba'i bdag nyid can sbyong la sogs pa nas phye ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa mi 'gul ba'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de yang byed pa po la gnas pa'i byed pa dang dngos po gnyis dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the activity of cooking, which is the nature of movement, and the activity of baking, which is the nature of nonmovement, are like the two things, the activity that abides in the agent and the entity that abides in the object.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: bya ba dang ldan rtag pa med //
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan rtag pa med //
translated: There is no permanent thing that has activity.

original: kun tu song la bya ba med //
analyzed: kun tu song la bya ba med //
translated: There is no activity in that which is all-pervasive.

original: ces bya ba gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: 'o na ni bdag bya ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni bdag bya ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then the self would be devoid of activity.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: But even so, it is said:

original: bya ba med pa med dang mtshungs //
analyzed: bya ba med pa med dang mtshungs //
translated: It is not so, because it is like that which is nonexistent.

original: ma yin nam dngos po bya ba med pas ni yod pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //üîΩbdag nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta ba la rag las te 'byung ba'i skye ba'i bya ba bskyed pa'i dngos po rnams ni re zhig ches thog mar bdag nyid yod par sgrub par byed la de nas bdag gi dngos po thob par 'gyur zhing rgyu dang 'bras
analyzed: ma yin nam dngos po bya ba med pas ni yod pa ma yin pa nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro // bdag nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta ba la rag las te 'byung ba'i skye ba'i bya ba bskyed pa'i dngos po rnams ni re zhig ches thog mar bdag nyid yod par sgrub par byed la de nas bdag gi dngos po thob par 'gyur zhing rgyu dang 'bras
translated: It is not so, because things that are devoid of activity are like the sky flower, etc., which are nonexistent.üîΩThings that are produced, in dependence on their causes and conditions, just as they are, first establish their own existence through the activity of arising, and then, having obtained their own existence, they are able to perform a function.

original: bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun rnam par ma chad par 'byung ba na bya ba'i khyad par de dang de'i skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur bar bya ba dang bcas pa'i don kho na yod pa nyid du gzhag par nus so //
analyzed: bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun rnam par ma chad par 'byung ba na bya ba'i khyad par de dang de'i skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur bar bya ba dang bcas pa'i don kho na yod pa nyid du gzhag par nus so //
translated: When the continuum of the transmission from one to another occurs without interruption, it is possible to posit the existence of just that which has the meaning of activity, which is the cause of the arising of this or that particular activity.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag bya ba med pa'i chos tsam zhig rtogs pa de dag gi ltar na de lta yin dang chos tsam gyis yang yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag bya ba med pa'i chos tsam zhig rtogs pa de dag gi ltar na de lta yin dang chos tsam gyis yang yod pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: According to those of our own Buddhist schools who understand that phenomena are mere things devoid of activity, that is so, and the mere thing also loses its existence,

original: bong bu'i rva bzhin bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva bzhin bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of activity, like the horn of an ass.

original: ci ste yang chos bya ba med pa tsam zhig yod pa nyid du 'don pa las na 'di nyes pa med do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang chos bya ba med pa tsam zhig yod pa nyid du 'don pa las na 'di nyes pa med do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that there is no fault in maintaining that a mere thing devoid of activity exists,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: gsung rab kyi don rnam pa gzhan du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi don rnam pa gzhan du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the scriptures is ascertained in another way.

original: de las ni byed pa por rang dbang ba rnam pa thams cad du med pas de'i byed pa'i ngo bo'i bya ba bkag pas chos rnams bya ba med pa nyid du ston gyi /
analyzed: de las ni byed pa por rang dbang ba rnam pa thams cad du med pas de'i byed pa'i ngo bo'i bya ba bkag pas chos rnams bya ba med pa nyid du ston gyi /
translated: That scripture teaches that phenomena are devoid of activity because they are completely devoid of an independent agent, and because it refutes the activity that is the nature of that agent.

original: dngos po byas pa'i rgyu can gyi bya ba bkag pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po byas pa'i rgyu can gyi bya ba bkag pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It does not refute the activity that is the cause of a produced thing.

original: de med na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de med na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If it did, it would contradict dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal ba las @167b kyang de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten par byed pa po dang las byed pa dang yang dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshogs de med pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'gal ba las @167b kyang de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rten par byed pa po dang las byed pa dang yang dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i tshogs de med pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la
translated: And because of the contradiction with dependent origination,

original: sogs pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu med pa yin dang / 'gro ba thams cad bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de sangs rgyas pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu med pa yin dang / 'gro ba thams cad bong bu'i rva dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de sangs rgyas pa ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: since the collection of the agent, action, and instrument of giving and so on do not exist in that, then Dharma, nondharma, and so on and their effects would not exist, and all reincarnating beings would be like the horns of a donkey.

original: de'i phyir de ltar bya ba dang ldan pa la yod pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir zlog pa'i sgo nas bya ba med pa nyid dang mtshungs shing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar bya ba dang ldan pa la yod pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir zlog pa'i sgo nas bya ba med pa nyid dang mtshungs shing /
translated: Therefore, because the existence of that which possesses action is seen, the nonexistence of action is refuted.

original: bdag kyang bya ba med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: bdag kyang bya ba med pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: And because the self is not an existent in any way, since it has no action,

original: bdag med la khyod kyis mi dga' //
analyzed: bdag med la khyod kyis mi dga' //
translated: you should not be unhappy about selflessness.

original: gal te bdag rtag pa yod pa ma yin na rgyu gang gis khyod bdag med pa la mi dga' ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag rtag pa yod pa ma yin na rgyu gang gis khyod bdag med pa la mi dga' ste /
translated: If the self does not exist as permanent, then what is the cause of your dislike of selflessness?

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba mtha' dag ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dga' ba kho nar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i lta ba mtha' dag ldog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dga' ba kho nar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: You should be pleased with it, because it is the cause for the cessation of all non-virtuous views.

original: yang gal te bdag ces bya ba 'di 'ga' zhig me'i tsha ba nyid ltar rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bo des yod pa'i phyir nges par dmigs pa zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gal te bdag ces bya ba 'di 'ga' zhig me'i tsha ba nyid ltar rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe de rang gi ngo bo des yod pa'i phyir nges par dmigs pa zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if this so-called self existed by its intrinsic reality, like the heat of fire, then at that time, because it would exist by its intrinsic reality, it would definitely be perceived. But it is not like that.

original: 'di ltar de'i rgol ba dag gis /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rgol ba dag gis /
translated: Thus, the disputants

original: la lar kun tu song bar mthong //
analyzed: la lar kun tu song bar mthong //
translated: see it as omnipresent in some places.üîΩSome see the person as just the body,

original: la las skyes bu lus tsam zhig / la lar rdul tsam zhig mthong ste //
analyzed: la las skyes bu lus tsam zhig / la lar rdul tsam zhig mthong ste //
translated: and some see it as just a particle.

original: shes rab can gyis med ces mthong //
analyzed: shes rab can gyis med ces mthong //
translated: The wise see it as nonexistent.

original: de la kha cig dag gis ni lus re re zhing tha mi dad pa'i bdag thams cad du song bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de la kha cig dag gis ni lus re re zhing tha mi dad pa'i bdag thams cad du song bar rtogs so //
translated: Some of them understand the self to be omnipresent in each body, without distinction.

original: gzhan dag gis ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gi bdag zla ba ltar gcig kho nar rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni 'gro ba mtha' dag gi bdag zla ba ltar gcig kho nar rtogs so //
translated: Others, on the contrary, think that the self is unique like the moon, for the whole world.

original: de'i 'thad pa ni lus tha dad pa las btags pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa ni lus tha dad pa las btags pa ste /
translated: The proof of this is that the self is designated in dependence on the body.

original: 'bru mar dang chu la sogs pa'i snod tha dad pas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bru mar dang chu la sogs pa'i snod tha dad pas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the reflection of the moon is multiple in dependence on the multiplicity of the vessels filled with water, but is unique when the vessels are joined together.

original: de yang thams cad du song ba zhig ste de ltar na la lar kun tu song bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de yang thams cad du song ba zhig ste de ltar na la lar kun tu song bar mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, the self is all-pervading, and so it is seen in part in each body.

original: la las skyes bu lus tsam zhig ste /
analyzed: la las skyes bu lus tsam zhig ste /
translated: Others, on the contrary, think that the self is the size of the body.

original: 'di ltar la la dag gis ni sbrang bu mchu rings dang grog ma dang glang po che la sogs pa rnams la bdag lus tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir zhum pa dang rgyas pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar la la dag gis ni sbrang bu mchu rings dang grog ma dang glang po che la sogs pa rnams la bdag lus tsam zhig yin pa'i phyir zhum pa dang rgyas pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: In fact, some people think that the self is reduced or extended according to the size of the gadflies, ants, elephants, etc., in which they believe they have reincarnated.

original: gzhan dag gis ni 'di zhum pa dang rgyas pa'i chos nyid du mi bzod pa na bdag rdul phra rab tsam zhig tu rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni 'di zhum pa dang rgyas pa'i chos nyid du mi bzod pa na bdag rdul phra rab tsam zhig tu rtogs so //
translated: Others, on the contrary, when they are unable to accept the fact that the self is subject to reduction and extension, think that the self is the size of an atom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la brten te yang dag pa'i shes @168a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la brten te yang dag pa'i shes @168a * //
translated: In the same way, the self is thought to be the size of the body in the realm of desire, the size of the body in the realm of fine-materiality, and infinite in the formless realm.

original: pa skye zhing /
analyzed: pa skye zhing /
translated: The five afflictions arise from that.üîΩ

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid mngon par shes pa shes rab can dag gis ni yod pa ma yin pa kho nar dmigs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid mngon par shes pa shes rab can dag gis ni yod pa ma yin pa kho nar dmigs so //
translated: and the wise who directly perceive the reality of dependent origination see it as absolutely nonexistent.

original: gal te de rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe nges par dngos po'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i sangs rgyas pa dag gis bdag nyid des dmigs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te de rang gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe nges par dngos po'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i sangs rgyas pa dag gis bdag nyid des dmigs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it existed by virtue of its own nature, then at that time the Buddhists who see the reality of things without error would perceive it by virtue of that,

original: mu stegs can rnams la yang de ltar lta ba tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di thams cad yod pa yang ma yin pas bdag rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams la yang de ltar lta ba tha dad par mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di thams cad yod pa yang ma yin pas bdag rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and the tƒ´rthikas would not have different views. But since none of this is the case, the self does not exist by virtue of its own nature.

original: yang gal te bdag rang gi ngo bos yod na ni /
analyzed: yang gal te bdag rang gi ngo bos yod na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the self existed by virtue of its own nature,

original: de'i tshe de rnam par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnam par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time it would not change, and therefore it would not be liberated.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas shing de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i skyes bu la ni de ldog pa bde bar 'gyur srid kyi /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba dang bcas shing de la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i skyes bu la ni de ldog pa bde bar 'gyur srid kyi /
translated: It is possible that a person who is afflicted and who turns his back on that would be happy if he turned away from it.

original: bdag rtag pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag rtag pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no harm to a permanent self.

original: rtag la gnod pa ga la zhig / gnod med thar pa ga la yod ;
analyzed: rtag la gnod pa ga la zhig / gnod med thar pa ga la yod ;
translated: How can there be harm to a permanent self? How can there be liberation for one who is not harmed?

original: / des na gang gi bdag rtag pa //
analyzed: / des na gang gi bdag rtag pa //
translated: Therefore, for one who asserts a permanent self,

original: de la thar pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la thar pa mi rigs so //
translated: liberation is not tenable.

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag las khyad par med pa'i phyir na gang zhig thar pa'i gnas skabs su yod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag las khyad par med pa'i phyir na gang zhig thar pa'i gnas skabs su yod par 'gyur ba /
translated: Because there would be no difference between benefit and harm, what would exist in the state of liberation that does not exist now?

original: 'di la da ltar med pa ni ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la da ltar med pa ni ci zhig yod /
translated: What is there that does not exist now?

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag rtag par smra la thar pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag rtag par smra la thar pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because there is no difference in any way, it is not tenable to assert a permanent self and liberation.

original: thar par 'dod pas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na khas blang bar bya ba'i bdag rtag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thar par 'dod pas ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kho na khas blang bar bya ba'i bdag rtag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One who desires liberation should accept only dependent origination, not a permanent self.

original: dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: Things that are dependently arisen are momentary.

original: de rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen dag rnam par chad pa med pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba na rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba las mi 'byung bas thar par rigs so //
analyzed: de rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen dag rnam par chad pa med pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba na rgyu dang rkyen ma tshang ba las mi 'byung bas thar par rigs so //
translated: Since those are not interrupted in terms of cause and effect, when they occur in a continuous series, they do not occur due to incomplete causes and conditions, so liberation is reasonable.

original: gzhan yang ya mtshan can thams cad kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du zad par bya ba'i phyir grol ba khas blangs te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang ya mtshan can thams cad kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa rnam pa thams cad du zad par bya ba'i phyir grol ba khas blangs te ;
translated: Moreover, all extremists accept liberation in order to completely eliminate the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de dag la grol ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la grol ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Therefore, in the context of liberation,

original: gal te bdag ces bya yod na //
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya yod na //
translated: if the so-called self exists,

original: bdag med snyam ste mi rigs shing //üîΩde nyid rig pa nges sdom las //
analyzed: bdag med snyam ste mi rigs shing // de nyid rig pa nges sdom las //
translated: it would not be reasonable to think ‚ÄúI am selfless.‚ÄùüîΩAnd it would be false to say

original: mya ngan 'das 'gyur zhes bya'ang brdzun //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das 'gyur zhes bya'ang brdzun //
translated: ‚ÄúOne will attain nirvana through knowing that.‚Äù

original: gal te bdag gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo la ldog pa @168b med pa'i phyir thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi ngo bos yod na ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo la ldog pa @168b med pa'i phyir thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self existed by its own nature, then at the time of liberation it would have to exist because its own nature would not be reversed.

original: de'i phyir thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu bogs dbyung du med pa'i bdag yod pa'i phyir bdag med do zhes de ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thar pa'i gnas skabs na yang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu bogs dbyung du med pa'i bdag yod pa'i phyir bdag med do zhes de ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, even in the state of liberation, since the self that is the cause of the conception of self is not eliminated, it is not correct to say that there is no self.

original: de'i phyir bdang gi de kho na nyid rig pa nges pas bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang brdzun te de yang ngar 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdang gi de kho na nyid rig pa nges pas bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang brdzun te de yang ngar 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is also false to say that one attains nirvana by abandoning the conception of self through the realization of the selflessness of persons. This is because the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù exists.

original: yang na grol bar 'dod pas bdag med pa kho na khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na grol bar 'dod pas bdag med pa kho na khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Or, one who desires liberation should accept only selflessness.

original: bdag med pa yod pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa spong la bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa las thar pa grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa yod pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa spong la bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa las thar pa grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The existence of selflessness, the abandonment of the conception of self, and the attainment of liberation through the abandonment of the conception of self are established.

original: ci ste bdag yod na thar pa'i gnas skabs na bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par thal bar 'jigs nas grol ba'i gnas skabs na bdag yod pa nyid khas mi len na /
analyzed: ci ste bdag yod na thar pa'i gnas skabs na bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par thal bar 'jigs nas grol ba'i gnas skabs na bdag yod pa nyid khas mi len na /
translated: But if you fear that if the self exists, it follows that the conception of self would operate in the state of liberation, and you do not accept that the self exists in the state of liberation,

original: de ltar yin dang / gal te grol ba nyid yod na //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang / gal te grol ba nyid yod na //
translated: If liberation exists,

original: de ni sngar yang med pa med //
analyzed: de ni sngar yang med pa med //
translated: it would not be nonexistent previously.

original: mi ldan pa la gang mthong ba //
analyzed: mi ldan pa la gang mthong ba //
translated: That which is seen in the absence

original: de ni rang bzhin zhes byar bshad //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin zhes byar bshad //
translated: of a related quality is said to be its nature.

original: ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt that so?

original: 'brel pa can gyi chos dang mi ldan zhing rkyang par rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i dngos po tsam la cha ji tsam zhig dmigs pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi chos dang mi ldan zhing rkyang par rang gi ngo bo tsam la gnas pa'i dngos po tsam la cha ji tsam zhig dmigs pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The mere thing that exists as the mere nature of its own entity, not possessing a related quality, is posited as the nature of that to the extent that it is observed.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not mixed with a quality that is different from that.üîΩFor example, the state of purification that is the complete exhaustion of iron, which is related to that, from inexhaustible gold is posited as its nature.

original: dper na zad mi shes pa'i gser gyi de las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa can lcags yongs su zad pa las rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du grol ba'i bdag gi shes pa rnam par byang
analyzed: dper na zad mi shes pa'i gser gyi de las gzhan pa'i 'brel pa can lcags yongs su zad pa las rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de de'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du grol ba'i bdag gi shes pa rnam par byang
translated: In the same way, the purified consciousness of a liberated self is posited as the nature of the self.

original: ba'i gnas skabs su shes pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo ci 'dra ba zhig snang ba de yang de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar rigs na cung zad cig snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ba'i gnas skabs su shes pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo ci 'dra ba zhig snang ba de yang de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar rigs na cung zad cig snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were reasonable to say that the nature of consciousness is whatever appears to it at the time when it is being affected by cataracts, then it would not appear in the least.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the conception of an ‚ÄúI‚Äù would be engaged.

original: de'i phyir thal ba'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na yang de'i rang bzhin de kho na yin par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba'i snga rol gyi gnas skabs na yang de'i rang bzhin de kho na yin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that even at the time prior to the appearance of the cataract, its nature is just that.

original: sngar gyi gnas skabs su phyin ci log gis dri ma can du gyur cing don ji lta ba bzhin dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i blo tshad ma nyid du khas blang bar nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi gnas skabs su phyin ci log gis dri ma can du gyur cing don ji lta ba bzhin dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa'i blo tshad ma nyid du khas blang bar nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to accept that the mind, which is affected by the error of the previous state and has not understood the nature of things as they are, is a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir @169a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @169a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: don 'di mthong ba phyin ci log gi dmigs su zin kyang de ltar khas blang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: don 'di mthong ba phyin ci log gi dmigs su zin kyang de ltar khas blang bar mi nus so //
translated: even though this object is seen by an erroneous mind, it is not possible to accept it as it is.

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa yang de ltar khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i don sgro 'dogs pa yang de ltar khas blangs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that you accept that the one with eye disease sees the nonexistent hairs, flies, and so on, because you accept that the one with eye disease superimposes the existence of objects that do not exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore it is established that the self does not exist inherently.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te bdag med na de'i tshe skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi 'du byed rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te bdag med na de'i tshe skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i ngang can gyi 'du byed rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no self, then since compounded phenomena, which are in a state of disintegration moment by moment, disintegrate immediately after they are produced, you fall into the view of nihilism.

original: dngos po skad cig ma'i rten bdag skad cig ma ma yin pa yod pas rnam pa thams cad du med par khas ma blangs pa las chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig ma'i rten bdag skad cig ma ma yin pa yod pas rnam pa thams cad du med par khas ma blangs pa las chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since the self, which is the basis of momentary things, is not momentary, you do not fall into the view of nihilism because you do not assert that things are completely nonexistent.‚Äù

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te mi rtag chad yin na //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag chad yin na //
translated: If impermanence is nihilism,

original: da dung rtsva sogs rnams cis yod //
analyzed: da dung rtsva sogs rnams cis yod //
translated: How could grass and so on still exist?

original: 'di ni gal te bden gyur na //
analyzed: 'di ni gal te bden gyur na //
translated: If this were true,

original: su la'ang gti mug kyang mi 'byung //
analyzed: su la'ang gti mug kyang mi 'byung //
translated: And no one would be confused about anything.

original: 'jig rten na ni mi rtag pa'i don chad pas rtog pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni mi rtag pa'i don chad pas rtog pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the world, the meaning of impermanence is not understood as annihilation,

original: 'di ltar bskal pa dang po nas zhugs pa rtsva dang lcug ma dang / ljon shing la sogs pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jug pa'i rim pa rnam par chad pa med par da rung du yang 'byung bar rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa dang po nas zhugs pa rtsva dang lcug ma dang / ljon shing la sogs pa rnams rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa 'jug pa'i rim pa rnam par chad pa med par da rung du yang 'byung bar rigs so //
translated: because it is reasonable that grass, twigs, trees, and so on, which have existed since the beginning of the eon, arise in a continuous series of cause and effect without interruption even today.

original: yang gal te mi rtag pa chad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rgyun ni mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gal te mi rtag pa chad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe rgyun ni mi 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if impermanence were annihilation, then the characteristic of the non-continuation of a continuum would occur.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rtsva la sogs pa 'di rnams da rung du yang dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rtsva la sogs pa 'di rnams da rung du yang dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, in that case, it would be reasonable that even today these grass and so on would still be observed.

original: dmigs pa las ni mi rtag pa la chad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa las ni mi rtag pa la chad pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: But they are not observed. Therefore it is understood that impermanence does not exist as annihilation.

original: 'di ni gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gdon mi za bar de ltar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: This must be accepted without doubt.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: mi rtag pa chad do zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di gal te ji lta ba'i don can du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe nges par sems can gang la yang gti mug kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa chad do zhes bya ba'i lta ba 'di gal te ji lta ba'i don can du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe nges par sems can gang la yang gti mug kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If this view that ‚Äúimpermanence is annihilated‚Äù were to have the meaning of reality, then at that time, definitely, delusion would not arise for any sentient being.

original: kyang gi sgras ni bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang mi 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang mi 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that pleasure and so on and attachment and so on would not arise.

original: 'di'i gti mug kyang mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i gti mug kyang mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: Also, its delusion is impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang chad pa yin pas nges par chad pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pas 'jug par mi bya ba zhig go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang chad pa yin pas nges par chad pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pas 'jug par mi bya ba zhig go //
translated: Since impermanence is annihilated, definitely, because of annihilation, ignorance would not engage.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba ldog pa'i sgrim pa med par bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba ldog pa'i sgrim pa med par bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it would be established that there is no effort to stop cyclic existence.

original: 'jig @169b rten thams cad kyi ma rig pa spangs pas 'gar yang de kho na nyid ma mthong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'jig @169b rten thams cad kyi ma rig pa spangs pas 'gar yang de kho na nyid ma mthong ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Since the ignorance of all worldly beings would be eliminated, it would not be the case that no one would see reality.

original: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas mi rtag pa la chad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas mi rtag pa la chad pa med do //
translated: But since this is not the case, impermanence is not annihilated.

original: ci ste dngos po mtha' dag 'byung ba'i rgyu bdag rtag pa nyid yod pas rgyu nges pa rtsva la sogs pa rnams la chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po mtha' dag 'byung ba'i rgyu bdag rtag pa nyid yod pas rgyu nges pa rtsva la sogs pa rnams la chad par lta ba yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that since a permanent self exists as the cause of the arising of all things, there is no nihilism with respect to grass and so on,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: dngos pos rtag pa rgyu dang rkyen la rag ma las par 'gyur ba 'ga' la yang yod pa nyid med do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: dngos pos rtag pa rgyu dang rkyen la rag ma las par 'gyur ba 'ga' la yang yod pa nyid med do zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that nothing permanent exists as a cause that is not dependent on conditions.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i bong bu'i rva ltar 'gro ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du mi rigs pas de yod pa'i rgyu can 'gro ba'i 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i bong bu'i rva ltar 'gro ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du mi rigs pas de yod pa'i rgyu can 'gro ba'i 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is illogical that a cause of the engagement of beings exists like the horn of a donkey, the engagement of beings that has that as a cause does not exist.

original: yang na bdag yod du chug mod 'di'i 'gro ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: yang na bdag yod du chug mod 'di'i 'gro ba 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid ni mi rigs so //
translated: Or, even if the self exists, it is illogical that it is the cause of the engagement of beings.

original: 'di ltar / bdag ni yod par 'gyur na'ang gzugs //üîΩgzhan las 'byung bar snang 'gyur la //üîΩgzhan las gnas par snang 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag ni yod par 'gyur na'ang gzugs // gzhan las 'byung bar snang 'gyur la // gzhan las gnas par snang 'gyur zhing //
translated: Thus, if the self existed,üîΩit would appear to arise from another.üîΩIt would appear to endure in another.

original: gzhan las rnam par 'jig par snang //
analyzed: gzhan las rnam par 'jig par snang //
translated: It would appear to be destroyed in another.

original: gal te dngos po rnams bdag gi rgyu can du 'gyur na ni de rnams bdag las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po gzhan las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩnor bu dang bud shing dang nyi ma phrad pa las me 'byung ba dang / zla ba dang phrad na nor bu chu shel las chu 'dzag pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa dag las myu gu la sogs pa rnams 'jug pa dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag las ji ltar gong du mer mer po dang /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams bdag gi rgyu can du 'gyur na ni de rnams bdag las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po gzhan las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na / nor bu dang bud shing dang nyi ma phrad pa las me 'byung ba dang / zla ba dang phrad na nor bu chu shel las chu 'dzag pa dang / sa bon la sogs pa dag las myu gu la sogs pa rnams 'jug pa dang nur nur po la sogs pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag las ji ltar gong du mer mer po dang /
translated: If things were to arise from self, then they would not arise from a thing that is other than self.üîΩBut fire arises from the contact of a gem and fuel, water flows from a water crystal and the moon when they come into contact, and sprouts and so on arise from seeds and so on.üîΩThe great elements of the kalala and so on arise from the great elements of the father and mother.

original: gor gor po dang / mkhrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa dang / nyid lag 'gyus pa rnams dang / de las mig la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gor gor po dang / mkhrang gyur dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa dang / nyid lag 'gyus pa rnams dang / de las mig la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa yang yin no //
translated: The eye and so on are observed to arise from the eye faculty and so on.

original: de ltar gzugs ni gzhan las 'byung bar dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar gzugs ni gzhan las 'byung bar dmigs so //
translated: Thus form is observed to arise from another.

original: yang gal te 'di dag thams cad bdag gi byed pa po can nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: yang gal te 'di dag thams cad bdag gi byed pa po can nyid yin na ni /
translated: If all these things were to arise from self,

original: gzugs 'di la 'jug pa de kho na las yin par rag mod /
analyzed: gzugs 'di la 'jug pa de kho na las yin par rag mod /
translated: This form is engaged by the self alone.

original: rgyu gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of postulating another cause?

original: ci ste rgyu gzhan po de yang bdag kho na las 'byung ngo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu gzhan po de yang bdag kho na las 'byung ngo snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the other cause arises from the self alone,

original: ci ste de ltar ma mthong /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar ma mthong /
translated: why do you not see it that way?

original: gal te nye bar bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause it is not revealed,‚Äù

original: ci mig la sogs pa rnams rang gi yul la 'jug pa la nye @170a * //
analyzed: ci mig la sogs pa rnams rang gi yul la 'jug pa la nye @170a * //
translated: is the engagement of the eye, etc. with their objects dependent on revelation?

original: bar bstan pa la ltos pa zhig gam de ma yin no //
analyzed: bar bstan pa la ltos pa zhig gam de ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'o na ni don de dmigs pa la nye bar bstan pa dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni don de dmigs pa la nye bar bstan pa dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Then the revelation of the object that is perceived is not necessary.

original: gal te dang po 'jug pa bdag las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dang po 'jug pa bdag las yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the initial engagement is from the self,

original: ci bdag de la dang po yod dam med de /
analyzed: ci bdag de la dang po yod dam med de /
translated: is there or is there not an initial state of the self?

original: gal te de ltar na de'i 'bras bu yang thog ma med par 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de'i 'bras bu yang thog ma med par 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If there is, then the effect must be without a beginning.

original: ci ste yod kyang de sngar rgyu nyid ma yin na phyis de'i rgyu nyid sus byas /
analyzed: ci ste yod kyang de sngar rgyu nyid ma yin na phyis de'i rgyu nyid sus byas /
translated: But if it exists and was not a cause previously, who makes it a cause later?

original: gal te don gzhan la ltos so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don gzhan la ltos so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it depends on another object,

original: 'o na ni don de de'i rgyu nyid la rgyu yin pas de nyid rgyu brgyud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni don de de'i rgyu nyid la rgyu yin pas de nyid rgyu brgyud par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the object is the cause of that cause, then that object itself would be the indirect cause.

original: rgyu de'i rgyu nyid la gzhan rgyu yin la de'i yang gzhan yin pas rgyu thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i rgyu nyid la gzhan rgyu yin la de'i yang gzhan yin pas rgyu thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the cause of that cause is another cause, and the cause of that cause is yet another cause, then there would be an infinite regress of causes.

original: de'i phyir rgyu kho na las 'gro ba 'jug par 'gyur bas bdag rgyu nyid du brtags pa don med pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu kho na las 'gro ba 'jug par 'gyur bas bdag rgyu nyid du brtags pa don med pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: Therefore, since the world is set in motion by causes alone, what is the point of this useless postulation that the self is the cause?

original: ci ste rgyu de yang bdag la rag las te 'byung bar yongs su rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu de yang bdag la rag las te 'byung bar yongs su rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that the cause itself occurs in dependence on the self,

original: de lta yin dang bdag dang dus mnyam pa'i rgyu 'jug pa la rag mod /
analyzed: de lta yin dang bdag dang dus mnyam pa'i rgyu 'jug pa la rag mod /
translated: then it is possible that the cause occurs in dependence on the self that is simultaneous with it.

original: de'i phyir bdag bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag bzhin du de'i 'bras bu yang thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, like the self, its effect would also be beginningless.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid yin na ni bdag dang de'i 'bras bu la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid yin na ni bdag dang de'i 'bras bu la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad do //
translated: If they are simultaneous, it is untenable that the self and its effect are cause and effect.

original: yod pa ni mi skye ste gnyi ga yang de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gis skyed par byed /
analyzed: yod pa ni mi skye ste gnyi ga yang de'i tshe yod pa'i phyir gang zhig gang gis skyed par byed /
translated: An existent does not arise, because both are existent at that time. What would generate what?

original: de'i phyir gzugs 'jug pa bdag gi rgyu can du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs 'jug pa bdag gi rgyu can du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that form is the cause of the self‚Äôs engagement.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzugs gzhan las 'byung ba mthong nas phyin ci ma log pa su zhig de bskyed par bya ba'i don du bdag yongs su rtog par byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzugs gzhan las 'byung ba mthong nas phyin ci ma log pa su zhig de bskyed par bya ba'i don du bdag yongs su rtog par byed /
translated: Thus, having seen that form arises from another, what unmistaken person would imagine a self in order to generate it?

original: yang na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyang 'gro ba 'jug pa la byed pa po nyid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyang 'gro ba 'jug pa la byed pa po nyid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Or, you should imagine that the son of a barren woman and so on are agents that engage in going.

original: ji ltar gzugs gzhan las 'byung ba mthong na de bzhin du gnas pa yang gzhan las yin par snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs gzhan las 'byung ba mthong na de bzhin du gnas pa yang gzhan las yin par snang ste /
translated: Just as you see that form arises from another, so too you see that it endures from another.

original: rgyu bud shing sbor ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa'i don gnas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu bud shing sbor ba la sogs pa las me la sogs pa'i don gnas par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because you see that the object, such as fire, endures from a cause, such as the kindling that ignites it.

original: gzhan las rnam par 'jig par snang ste /
analyzed: gzhan las rnam par 'jig par snang ste /
translated: You see that it is destroyed by another.

original: bud shing ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: bud shing ma tshang ba med pa la sogs pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: This is because it is destroyed by a cause, such as the lack of kindling.

original: mthong ba por nas ma mthong ba'i bdag 'thad pas yod par 'gal zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba por nas ma mthong ba'i bdag 'thad pas yod par 'gal zhing /
translated: It is contradictory that the self exists because it is tenable that the self is not seen by the seer.

analyzed: rgyu'i chos dang ma 'brel pa brtag par rigs pa @170b yang ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not exist essentially.üîΩWhen there is no arising from the permanent, then how could

original: gang gi tshe rtag pa las skye ba med pa de'i tshe 'jig rten na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtag pa las skye ba med pa de'i tshe 'jig rten na /
translated: the world arise from the permanent?

analyzed: ji ltar sa bon byas pa las // myu gu byas pa skye 'gyur ba //
translated: Just as a sprout arises from a conditioned seed,

analyzed: de bzhin mi rtag thams cad ni //
translated: so all impermanent things

original: mi rtag dag las 'byung bar 'gyur//
analyzed: mi rtag dag las 'byung bar 'gyur//
translated: arise from impermanent things.

original: rang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ma yin pa rang bzhin med cing rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de bzhin du mkhas pas dpe 'di dngos po gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ma snang ba chod pa dang phra ba rnams dang / tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ma yin pa rang bzhin med cing rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste de bzhin du mkhas pas dpe 'di dngos po gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs ma snang ba chod pa dang phra ba rnams dang / tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnams dang /
translated: The wise should understand that in the same way, things that are not present in a certain way, that are essenceless and empty of essence, arise from causes that are essenceless.

original: rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa las 'das pa 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu las rang bzhin med pa 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa las 'das pa 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa'i rgyu las rang bzhin med pa 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the wise should understand that things that are not present in a certain way, that are essenceless and empty of essence, arise from causes that are essenceless and empty of essence.
