analyzed: de ltar yin dang gang du 'du byed rnams la rtag pa dang chad pa'i rdo rje'i thog 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa rab tu 'joms pa 'bab pa de yang mkhas pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rig sngags
translated: In this way, the vajra of the views of eternalism and nihilism falls upon compounded phenomena, destroying the connection between mundane and transcendent causes and effects.üîΩThe wise should understand that this is the spell of dependent origination.

original: kyis ches rgyang ring por bzlog pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: kyis ches rgyang ring por bzlog pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the seed is very far removed from the sprout, he says:

original: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: Because a thing arises,

original: de nas chad par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de nas chad par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: it does not become annihilated.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Because a thing ceases,

original: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not become permanent.

original: dngos po ni 'byung ba'i chos can te 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'o gang gi phyir rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba las 'bras bu myu gu 'byung ba de'i phyir rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba chad par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun ma bskyed par me dang phrad pa las yin pa ltar sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe chad par lta bar 'gyur na myu gu la sogs pa 'jug pa yod par mthong ba las ni sa bon zhes bya
analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung ba'i chos can te 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa'o gang gi phyir rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba las 'bras bu myu gu 'byung ba de'i phyir rgyu sa bon zhes bya ba chad par mi 'gyur ro // gal te myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun ma bskyed par me dang phrad pa las yin pa ltar sa bon 'gag par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe chad par lta bar 'gyur na myu gu la sogs pa 'jug pa yod par mthong ba las ni sa bon zhes bya
translated: A thing is a phenomenon that arises, such as the sprout that is the effect. Because the effect, the sprout, arises from the cause called the seed, therefore the cause called the seed does not become annihilated.

original: ba chad par mi srid do //
analyzed: ba chad par mi srid do //
translated: If the seed were to cease when it encounters fire, without generating the continuum of the sprout, then at that time it would become the view of annihilation. But because the arising of the sprout, etc. is seen to exist, it is not possible that the seed becomes annihilated.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i dngos po'i sgra gnyis pa ni rgyu rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i dngos po'i sgra gnyis pa ni rgyu rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The second instance of the term ‚Äúthing‚Äù in the second line of the root verse indicates the cause.

original: 'di las 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes byas nas so //üîΩyang gal te myu gu zhes bya @171a * //
analyzed: 'di las 'bras bu 'byung ba zhes byas nas so // yang gal te myu gu zhes bya @171a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom this, an effect arises‚Äù is the second instance of the term ‚Äúthing.‚ÄùüîΩIf the effect called ‚Äúsprout‚Äù were to exist by virtue of its own nature even while the seed has not yet ceased, then the seed would not cease.

original: ba'i 'bras bu zhugs kyang rang gi ngo bos gnas pas sa bon mi ldog na de'i tshe sa bon rnam par mi 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir rtag par lta bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu zhugs kyang rang gi ngo bos gnas pas sa bon mi ldog na de'i tshe sa bon rnam par mi 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir rtag par lta bar 'gyur na /
translated: In that case, since the seed would be seen to be unchanging, one would be forced to conclude that it is permanent.

original: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case,

original: sa bon ldog par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon ldog par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed is seen to cease.

original: gal te ldog par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de las myu gu gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te ldog par mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de las myu gu gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas /
translated: If the seed did not cease, then another sprout would arise from it. But this is not the case.

original: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po ldog 'gyur ba //
translated: Therefore, since things cease,

original: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they are not permanent.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bos ma grub pas sa bon dang myu gu gnyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa dag mi srid pa las 'grub pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par ches gsal bar grub bo //
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bos ma grub pas sa bon dang myu gu gnyis de nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa dag mi srid pa las 'grub pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par ches gsal bar grub bo //
translated: Since they do not exist by virtue of their own nature, it is impossible to conceive of seeds and sprouts as being the same or different. Since this is established, it is very clear that things lack intrinsic existence.

original: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhal snga nas kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bzhi brgya pa las /
translated: ƒÄcƒÅrya ƒÄryadeva states in his BodhimƒÅrgapradƒ´papa√±jikƒÅ:

original: bdag dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu ba'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: bdag dgag pa bsgom pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu ba'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the tenth chapter, the analysis of the refutation of the self, from Essence of Good Explanations, Explanation of the Supplement to the Middle Way.

original: // /'dir dus smra ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzhan las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu 'ga' yang ma mthong bas rjes su dpags pas go bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni legs par smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: // /'dir dus smra ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzhan las 'byung ba mthong ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu 'ga' yang ma mthong bas rjes su dpags pas go bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir na bdag yod pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de ni legs par smras pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the proponents of time argue, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the self exists, as you have claimed, because form and so on are seen to arise from other, because they are not perceptible to the world, and because they are not to be understood through inference, since no effect is seen.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po rtag pa rnams med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po rtag pa rnams med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that things that are permanent in every way do not exist.

original: dus yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Time exists.

original: 'di nas dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams yod kyang res 'ga' myu gus dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'di nas dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang sa bon la sogs pa rnams yod kyang res 'ga' myu gus dang me tog la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Even though earth, water, fire, wind, space, seeds, etc. exist, sometimes the arising and destruction of sprouts, flowers, etc. do not occur.

original: ci ste res 'ga' 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'bras bu de mthong ba las dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste res 'ga' 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir dus zhes bya ba 'bras bu de mthong ba las dpag pa yin no //
translated: But since sometimes they do occur, time is inferred from the effect.

original: de ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam la sogs pas gsal bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam la sogs pas gsal bar bya zhing /
translated: It is clarified by such terms as ‚Äúmoment,‚Äù ‚Äúsecond,‚Äù ‚Äúminute,‚Äù etc.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ste dus gsum na rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa rtag pa zhig go zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba ste dus gsum na rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa rtag pa zhig go zhes smra'o //
translated: It is permanent, distinct from the things that exist in the three times‚Äîpast, present, and future.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must now respond to this.

original: gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad cing bdag nyid kyis grub pa yod par 'gyur na ni de skye ba dang 'jig @171b pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dus zhes bya ba dngos po las tha dad cing bdag nyid kyis grub pa yod par 'gyur na ni de skye ba dang 'jig @171b pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If time were different from things and existed by its own intrinsic reality, it would be the cause of their arising and ceasing.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te dngos po las tha dad par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig yod na dngos po la //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te dngos po las tha dad par 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gang zhig yod na dngos po la //
translated: But that is not so, because it would follow that it would be apprehended as different from things.üîΩIf it exists, then the engagement and disengagement

original: 'jug dang ldog pa'ang dmigs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'jug dang ldog pa'ang dmigs 'gyur ba //
translated: of things would be apprehended.

original: de ni gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur te //
translated: It would be dependent on another,

original: des ni 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro//
analyzed: des ni 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro//
translated: and it would also be a result.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag zin pa'i phyir yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i dus la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag zin pa'i phyir yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i dus la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this has already been refuted, time that exists by way of its own intrinsic character is not the cause of engagement and disengagement.

original: gzhan yang dus gsum po gang dag dus kyi khyad par gyi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa de dag kyang lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin las nges par mi nus pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rnam par gzhag par mi nus kyi de dag gis
analyzed: gzhan yang dus gsum po gang dag dus kyi khyad par gyi ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa de dag kyang lus can ma yin pa nyid kyis rang bzhin las nges par mi nus pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos rnam par gzhag par mi nus kyi de dag gis
translated: Moreover, the three times that are posited as the nature of the distinction of time cannot be posited by way of their own nature because they are not able to be ascertained from their own nature, since they are not embodied.

original: bsnyad par bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par bum pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni rnam par gzhag par nus so //
analyzed: bsnyad par bya ba'i dngos po'i khyad par bum pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni rnam par gzhag par nus so //
translated: They can be posited by way of the distinctions of the things that are described by them, such as pots.

original: de dag ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing tshor ba la sogs pa ltar nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin zhing tshor ba la sogs pa ltar nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa ma yin la /
translated: They are natures that are different from things, and they are not experienced in the aspect of feeling and so on.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bzhin dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa bzhin dbang po'i sgo nas yongs su gcad par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not also to be discerned by way of the sense faculties, like form, sound, and so on.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgo kho na nas de dag gi khyad par yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas dus gsum bkag pas dus dgag par mdzad par bzhed pas bshad pa /üîΩma 'ongs bum pa da ltar ba'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i sgo kho na nas de dag gi khyad par yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas dus gsum bkag pas dus dgag par mdzad par bzhed pas bshad pa / ma 'ongs bum pa da ltar ba'i //
translated: Therefore, because the distinctions of those are completely determined only through the door of the pot, etc., he explains that time is refuted by refuting the three times through the door of the pot, etc.üîΩThe future pot does not exist in the present

original: bum yod ma yin 'das pa med //
analyzed: bum yod ma yin 'das pa med //
translated: pot, nor does the past pot.

original: gang phyir de gnyis ma 'ongs pas //
analyzed: gang phyir de gnyis ma 'ongs pas //
translated: Because those two do not exist in the future,

original: de phyir ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
translated: therefore the future does not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i don du ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa nye bar bkod la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar mtshon par bya ba'i don du ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa nye bar bkod la /
translated: In order to illustrate the future time, the future pot is posited.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus nye bar mtshon pa'i don du 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bum pa nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus nye bar mtshon pa'i don du 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bum pa nye bar bkod do //
translated: In the same way, in order to illustrate the past and present times, the past and present pots are posited.

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus sum phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa ni da ltar byung ba'i dus sum phyin pa'o //
translated: Thus the future has not yet come to the present time.

original: 'das pa ni de nyid las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni de nyid las 'das pa'o //
translated: The past is that which has passed from just that.

original: da ltar byung ba ni skyes la ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni skyes la ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: The present is that which has arisen but not yet ceased.

original: da ltar ba ni da ltar dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar ba ni da ltar dmigs pa'i phyir gtso bo yin gyi /
translated: The present is the principal time because it is perceived in the present.

original: der ma 'ongs pa dang rgal bdag gis ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i dus nyis rnam par 'jog pa ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: der ma 'ongs pa dang rgal bdag gis ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i dus nyis rnam par 'jog pa ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: The future and the past are posited as future and past in dependence on the present.

original: dus gsum po de dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa nyid du @172a * //
analyzed: dus gsum po de dag kyang phan tshun ltos pa nyid du @172a * //
translated: These three times are established in mutual dependence,

original: gnas te / gnyis gnyis la ma ltos par re re med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas te / gnyis gnyis la ma ltos par re re med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each is not possible without the other two.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gnyis la ma ltos pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gnyis la ma ltos pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: The future time cannot be established without depending on the other two, the past and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rang gi ngo bos de gang du ma 'ongs pa 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus gnyis po der gdon mi za bar 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rang gi ngo bos de gang du ma 'ongs pa 'das pa dang da ltar gyi dus gnyis po der gdon mi za bar 'gyur dgos so //
translated: If the future did not exist by its own nature, then it would certainly be in the other two times, the past and present.

original: de med na ni gang du ma 'ongs ba las 'di ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de med na ni gang du ma 'ongs ba las 'di ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: If it did not exist, then in what would the future be the future?

original: dus gzhan gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan gnyis kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The establishment of the other two times should be understood in the same way.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de la da ltar ba'i bum pa yod pa ma yin la 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de la da ltar ba'i bum pa yod pa ma yin la 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The future vase does not have the present vase or the past vase.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / gcig la gcig mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / gcig la gcig mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have different characteristics and because it is impossible for one to exist in another.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis kyang ma 'ongs par ma 'ongs pas de gnyis kyang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis kyang ma 'ongs par ma 'ongs pas de gnyis kyang ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the future vase does not have the present and past vases, then the present and past vases also do not have the future vase.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa da ltar du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa yin pa de bzhin du da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis kyang ma 'ongs pas ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/ gal te da ltar du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa da ltar du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa yin pa de bzhin du da ltar ba dang 'das pa gnyis kyang ma 'ongs pas ma 'ongs par 'gyur ro ; / gal te da ltar du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as the future vase does not have the present and past vases, so too the present and past vases do not have the future vase.

original: ma 'ongs par ma 'ongs pa las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par ma 'ongs pa las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the future vase does not have the present and past vases because it is future,üîΩbut that the present and past vases do not have the future vase because they are not future,

original: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ma 'ongs par grub pa yod na ni da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis 'grub na gang gi tshe ma 'ongs pa nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'das pa'am da ltar byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs par grub pa yod na ni da ltar dang 'das pa gnyis 'grub na gang gi tshe ma 'ongs pa nyid med pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'das pa'am da ltar byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If the future exists, then the present and the past would be established. But when the future itself does not exist, how could the past and present exist?

original: 'di la dgongs nas slob dpon ma 'ongs pa med par bstan pa bzhed de /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas slob dpon ma 'ongs pa med par bstan pa bzhed de / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: With this in mind, the Master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna asserts that the future does not exist:

original: gang phyir de gnyis ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de gnyis ma 'ongs pa //
translated: Therefore, since those two are future,

original: de phyir ma 'ongs yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //üîΩgang gi phyir de gnyi ga yang ma 'ongs pa yin pa de'i tshe gsum char yang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de phyir ma 'ongs yod ma yin // zhes bshad do // gang gi phyir de gnyi ga yang ma 'ongs pa yin pa de'i tshe gsum char yang ma 'ongs pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: the future does not exist.üîΩSince those two are future, all three times would be future.

original: gsum char yang ma 'ongs pa nyid yin na yang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir gang du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs par rnam par gzhag / de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum char yang ma 'ongs pa nyid yin na yang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa gnyis mi srid pa'i phyir gang du ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs par rnam par gzhag / de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if all three times were future, then the present and the past would be impossible. Therefore the future time does not exist.

original: ci @172b ste ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la 'das pa'i bum pa rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bor ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci @172b ste ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la 'das pa'i bum pa rnam pa thams cad du med pa nyid ma yin gyi ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bor ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la yod pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the past pot does not in no way exist in the future pot, but rather the future pot exists in the future entity of the past pot,

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa la yod pas 'das pa tha dad par grub pa yod na yang ma 'ongs pa yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa la yod pas 'das pa tha dad par grub pa yod na yang ma 'ongs pa yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: and therefore the future exists because it exists in the past, even though the past is established as distinct from the future,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gal te zhig pa ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo ma 'ongs la yod na /üîΩma 'ongs bdag nyid du yod gang //
analyzed: gal te zhig pa ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo ma 'ongs la yod na / ma 'ongs bdag nyid du yod gang //
translated: If the future exists in the entity of the future,

original: de ni ji ltar 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar 'das par 'gyur //
translated: how could it be past?

original: gal te 'das pa ma 'ongs pa nyid du ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la yod do snyam du sems na ni de'i tshe 'di 'das pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa ma 'ongs pa nyid du ma 'ongs pa'i bum pa la yod do snyam du sems na ni de'i tshe 'di 'das pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: If you think that the past exists in the future pot, then at that time it is illogical that it is past.

original: khyod kyi lugs kyis ma 'ongs pa la yod pa'i phyir te ma 'ongs pa rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs kyis ma 'ongs pa la yod pa'i phyir te ma 'ongs pa rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because in your system it exists in the future, like the future itself.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore that fault would ensue.

original: yang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ci khyod la yod dam 'on te med /
analyzed: yang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ci khyod la yod dam 'on te med /
translated: Moreover, is that future thing which you assert to exist, existent for you or not?

original: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bor yod pas ma 'ongs pa yod ces bya bar rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: smras pa / ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bor yod pas ma 'ongs pa yod ces bya bar rnam par 'jog go //
translated: You say: ‚ÄúIt is said to exist because it exists as the entity of the future.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin na ni 'di ma 'ongs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni 'di ma 'ongs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be the future.

original: gang las zhe na /
analyzed: gang las zhe na /
translated: From what?

original: gang gi phyir na ma 'ongs dngos //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na ma 'ongs dngos //
translated: Because the future thing

original: ma 'ongs bdag tu gnas 'gyur ba //üîΩde yi phyir na da lta bar //
analyzed: ma 'ongs bdag tu gnas 'gyur ba // de yi phyir na da lta bar //
translated: would be present,üîΩsince it would exist as the entity of the present.

original: 'gyur te ma 'ongs nyid mi srid //
analyzed: 'gyur te ma 'ongs nyid mi srid //
translated: Therefore, it would not be possible for it to be the future.

original: gang zhig la da ltar yod pa nyid yod pa de ni da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig la da ltar yod pa nyid yod pa de ni da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists as the present is the present,

original: da ltar yod pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar yod pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it exists in the present, like the present intrinsic reality of the present.

original: ci ste de ni da ltar ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste de ni da ltar ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But if you say: ‚ÄúIt does not exist as the intrinsic reality of the present.

original: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du ste /
translated: However, it exists as the intrinsic reality of the future.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir da lta bar yod pa med pa'i phyir 'di la ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir da lta bar yod pa med pa'i phyir 'di la ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if you think that since the present does not exist, the future alone exists, then we would respond as follows:

original: gang zhig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid der yod par gyur dang da lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid der yod par gyur dang da lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which has a certain intrinsic nature exists in the present or existed in the past.

original: 'di ltar sngon po sngon po'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa da lta bar 'gyur gyi de ser po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa na ltar ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'di la ma 'ongs
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po sngon po'i bdag nyid kyi yod pa da lta bar 'gyur gyi de ser po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs ba'i bdag nyid du yod pa na ltar ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'di la ma 'ongs
translated: For example, blue exists in the present as blue, not as yellow. Similarly, the future exists as the future, not as the present.

original: pa nyid srid par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: pa nyid srid par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible to make the future exist.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar ma 'ongs pa mi srid pa de'i tshe gang zhig 'das pa'am da ltar bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar ma 'ongs pa mi srid pa de'i tshe gang zhig 'das pa'am da ltar bar 'gyur bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: When the future does not exist in this way, then what would you imagine to be the past or present?

original: @173a * // de'i phyir dus gsum yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @173a * // de'i phyir dus gsum yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the three times do not exist.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag dngos po rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs nas de dus gsum kar yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi 'dor ba'i dngos po kho na rgyu dang rgyen gyi tshogs pas gnas skabs de dang der 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de dag
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag dngos po rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs nas de dus gsum kar yod pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi 'dor ba'i dngos po kho na rgyu dang rgyen gyi tshogs pas gnas skabs de dang der 'gyur ro zhes smra ba de dag
translated: They say that only things that do not discard their intrinsic nature become the collection of causes and conditions at different times.

original: la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond to them as follows:

original: ma 'ongs pa yod 'das pa yod //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yod 'das pa yod //
translated: The future exists, the past exists,üîΩand the present exists.

original: da ltar ba yod ci zhig ste //üîΩgang gis dus kun yod pa nyid //
analyzed: da ltar ba yod ci zhig ste // gang gis dus kun yod pa nyid //
translated: What is it?

original: de yi mi rtag nyid ga las //
analyzed: de yi mi rtag nyid ga las //
translated: How could it be impermanent?üîΩThe opponent asserts that the intrinsic nature of this thing that becomes present is the intrinsic nature that appears to the mind and that it exists in the future and in the past.

original: gang gis dngos po da ltar bar 'gyur ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo gang zhig blo la snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs su yang khas blangs pa'i rgol ba de la mi rtag pa lta ga la
analyzed: gang gis dngos po da ltar bar 'gyur ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo gang zhig blo la snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo de nyid ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dang 'das pa'i gnas skabs su yang khas blangs pa'i rgol ba de la mi rtag pa lta ga la
translated: How could it be impermanent?

original: yod / de'i phyir na dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod / de'i phyir na dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis rtag pa nyid kyis rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore things would be only permanent because they are permanent by their intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar yin dang de la lung 'gal bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de la lung 'gal bar yang 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang zhig mi rtag pa nyid kyis byed pa tha ma yang yod de de'i phyir thog ma dang tha ma yang yod pas rtag par smra ba med pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yod par @177a * //
translated: A thing has a first action due to arising, and it has a final action due to impermanence. Therefore, since it has a beginning and an end, it is illogical to advocate that it is permanent and that its effect exists.

original: smra ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: smra ba mi rigs so //

original: gang zhig 'bras bu yod par smra ba la skyon mthong bas ma 'ongs pa med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa de'i ltar na yang /

original: sgrim pa med par thar 'gyur te //
analyzed: sgrim pa med par thar 'gyur te //

original: grol la ma 'ongs yod ma yin //
analyzed: grol la ma 'ongs yod ma yin //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang skye pa med par sgrim par 'gyur te 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa med par yang 'di grol bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas 'bras bu med par smra bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin pas 'bras bu med par smra bar mi rigs so //
translated: But since this is not the case, it is illogical to propound the nonexistence of the effect.

original: thar par thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: thar par thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does it follow that one would be liberated,

original: 'di'i phyir na rgyu med pa can du smra bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir na rgyu med pa can du smra bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /

analyzed: chags med par yang 'dod chags ni //
translated: And desire would exist without one who desires.

original: de ltar yin dang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'byung bar 'gyur //

original: ma 'ongs pa med na rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa med na rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ltar yin dang rten med pa'i skye ba'i bya ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: And so it is, and so it will be. The action of arising does not occur without a basis.

analyzed: de bzhin du chags pa'i rten can 'dod chags kyang skye ba'i bya ba bzhin rten gzhan gyi dbang yin te /

analyzed: de chags pa med par 'dod na rgyu med pa can nyid du 'gyur na /

analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba rgyu med pa can mi srid pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa med pa nyid du mi rigs so //

analyzed: yang na ma 'ongs pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
translated: Or else, the meaning of ‚Äúalso‚Äù is that the future does not not exist.

original: da ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra ba gnyi ga'i ltar na yang rgyus 'bras bu @177b sgrub par mi nus pa mngon bar gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra ba gnyi ga'i ltar na yang rgyus 'bras bu @177b sgrub par mi nus pa mngon bar gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to make it clear that, according to both the proponents of existent effects and the proponents of nonexistent effects, a cause cannot establish an effect, he says:üîΩFor the one who asserts the existence of an effect

original: 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod dang // 'bras bu med nyid gang 'dod pa //üîΩkhyim gyi don du ka ba las //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod nyid gang 'dod dang // 'bras bu med nyid gang 'dod pa // khyim gyi don du ka ba las //
translated: and for the one who asserts the nonexistence of an effect,üîΩthe ornament of a pillar for the sake of a house

translated: would be pointless.

original: grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gi ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: grangs can dang bye brag tu smra ba dag gi ni 'bras bu yod par smra ba nyid do //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya and VaibhƒÅ·π£ika are proponents of the existence of effects.

original: grangs can pa'i ltar na ni gang zhig yod pa de yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i ltar na ni gang zhig yod pa de yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: According to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, whatever exists is only existent.

analyzed: gang zhig yod pa ma yin pa de med pa kho na ste /

analyzed: med pa la skye ba med cing yod pa la 'jig pa med do zhes khas len to //
translated: They accept that what is nonexistent does not arise and what is existent does not perish.

analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba yin na ni thams cad thams cad las 'byung bar 'gyur na /

translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas, SautrƒÅntikas, and Vij√±ƒÅnakƒÅyins assert that results do not exist.

analyzed: de dag gis ni 'bras bu yod pa skye ba don med par sems shing 'bras bu med pa kho na skye'o zhes bya bar rtogs so //

translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas understand that a whole substance that is different from particles of earth and so on is generated from the aggregation of two particles and so forth. They understand that only a nonexistent result is generated and so on.

analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde pa rnams kyang dge slong dag de ltar na mig ni ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas kyang rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes @178a * //
translated: So too, the Sutra school believes that the former reason is that the result arises from a nonexistent, since a sutra declares:

analyzed: bya ba'i lung las ni gtan tshigs snga ma 'bras bu med pa skye'o snyam du sems so //

original: rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyang dngos po'i rnam pa mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi khyad par gzhag pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye ba las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang dang
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba rnams kyang dngos po'i rnam pa mtha' dag skye ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi khyad par gzhag pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i rkyen nye ba las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang dang
translated: The Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins believe that all aspects of things arise from the maturation of the latent traces of the foundation consciousness, since the consciousnesses that engage their objects such as the eye consciousness arise from the maturation of the latent potentialities of the foundation consciousness.

original: gang skye ba de dang de ni med pa kho na skye'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba de dang de ni med pa kho na skye'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus they believe that only nonexistent things arise.

analyzed: de ltar na rgol ba de dag ni 'bras bu yod pa dang med par smra ba nyid las mi 'da' ste /

analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir la /

analyzed: de yang yod pa dang med par rtog pa gnyis las tha dad par rnam pa gzhan du brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

translated: If you accept that it is to be established in some other way, then it follows that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is a nihilist.

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //

original: mo gsham gyi bu yod pa ma yin pa ni sus kyang sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /

translated: Similarly, for you who maintain that the result does not exist, the result, the house, is not established.

analyzed: ci ste skyon 'di spang bar 'dod pas 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad du med par khas mi len na ni 'o na de'i 'bras bu med par smra ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you do not accept that the result does not exist in any way, wishing to avoid this error, then you abandon the position that the result does not exist.

original: ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i khyim bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan mi rigs pa de bzhin du yod pa dang med par brtags nas phyi dang nang gi dngos po myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgyu
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i khyim bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ka ba la sogs pa'i rgyan mi rigs pa de bzhin du yod pa dang med par brtags nas phyi dang nang gi dngos po myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgyu
translated: Just as it is illogical to establish a house that exists and does not exist by means of pillars and so on, in the same way, if you imagine that causes exist and do not exist, it is illogical to establish all internal and external things, such as sprouts and karmic acts, by means of causes and conditions that exist and do not exist.

analyzed: sa bon dang ma rig pa la sogs pa don med par sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: gang gi ltar na dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa yin pa de'i ltar na ni @178b rnam pa thams cad du dngos po yod pa nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang dngos po'i chos kyi rten can rnams mi srid
translated: But according to those who maintain that things are essenceless, since things do not exist in any way, it is impossible to think of their existence or nonexistence, and so on, and the properties of things are impossible.

analyzed: pas bshad zin pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med pa yin dang / thams cad 'grub bo //

analyzed: gang skye ba de ni skye ba'i snga rol nas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which arises does not exist prior to the arising,

analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dang skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is essenceless and because arising would be pointless.

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na mkhas pas mtha' gnyis spangs nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khas blang bar bya'o ;

original: / de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par 'grub bo //
analyzed: / de'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, things are established as essenceless.

analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis rang gi ngo bos grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, neither the past nor the future exist inherently.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

analyzed: khyod kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag bkag mod kyi /
translated: Although you have refuted the past and the future,

original: de ltar na yang re zhig da lta ba ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang re zhig da lta ba ni yod pa yin te /
translated: nonetheless, the present exists.

analyzed: de yod pas ma 'ongs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it exists, the future also exists.

analyzed: gal te mi 'gyur na ni gang zhig yongs su 'gyur bas da ltar bar 'gyur /

analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar yod pas ma 'ongs pa yod do //

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: gal te yongs su 'gyur ba nyid yod na ni de ltar 'gyur ba zhig na /

analyzed: de ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
