original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di na yongs su 'gyur ba 'di ma 'ongs pa'i don la rtog pa na rang gi ngo bo nyams pas rtog gam gnas pas rtog grang na /üîΩgal te re zhig rang gi ngo bo nyams pas yin na ni de'i tshe gcig 'jig cing gzhan skye ba yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag kho na la yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di na yongs su 'gyur ba 'di ma 'ongs pa'i don la rtog pa na rang gi ngo bo nyams pas rtog gam gnas pas rtog grang na / gal te re zhig rang gi ngo bo nyams pas yin na ni de'i tshe gcig 'jig cing gzhan skye ba yongs su 'gyur ba yin pas skye ba dang 'jig pa dag kho na la yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is the case that the transformation of this is the conception of a future object, then does it conceive through the degeneration of its own nature or through its endurance?üîΩIf it is the case that it conceives through the degeneration of its own nature, then at that time one thing would be destroyed and another would arise, and that would be a transformation.

original: gnas pa'i rdzas kyi chos gzhan log nas chos gzhan 'byung ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rdzas kyi chos gzhan log nas chos gzhan 'byung ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the case that it conceives through the endurance of its own nature, then the substance of endurance would be a different phenomenon, and the arising of another phenomenon would be a transformation.

original: ci ste kho bo cag gi yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'di 'dra ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste kho bo cag gi yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'di 'dra ba kho na yin te /
translated: But if it is the case that the transformation of this is just like that,

original: 'di ltar dper na ba lang gi khu bcud kyi rdzas gnas pa'i chos gzhan 'o ma'i dngos po log dang chos gzhan zho'i dngos po 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur pa yin pa @179a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na ba lang gi khu bcud kyi rdzas gnas pa'i chos gzhan 'o ma'i dngos po log dang chos gzhan zho'i dngos po 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur pa yin pa @179a * //
translated: then, for example, the substance of the essence of cow‚Äôs milk, which is a different phenomenon from the substance of endurance, would be the cessation of the state of milk and the arising of the state of curd, and that would be a transformation.

original: de bzhin du yon tan gsum po //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan gsum po //
translated: In the same way, the three qualities

original: rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs log dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur ba'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs log dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur ba'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the future state of the three gunas, rajas, tamas, and sattva, is the transformation of the present state,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba 'di yod pa nyid du gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba 'di yod pa nyid du gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: then this transformation cannot be established as real.

original: 'jig rten gyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan gsum po 'di dag yod pa nyid du dmigs nas de dag gi yongs su 'gyur bar dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis ni ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan gsum po 'di dag yod pa nyid du dmigs nas de dag gi yongs su 'gyur bar dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The world does not perceive the future three gunas as real, and it does not perceive their transformation.

original: zho 'o ma'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin par rnam par gzhag par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zho 'o ma'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin par rnam par gzhag par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor can it be established that milk transforms into the nature of curd,

original: 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du ni 'o ma la 'o ma zhes bya ba la 'o ma'i gnas skabs kho nar gnas pa'i 'o ma la zho'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma'i gnas skabs nyid du ni 'o ma la 'o ma zhes bya ba la 'o ma'i gnas skabs kho nar gnas pa'i 'o ma la zho'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because milk does not exist in the state of milk itself, and milk that exists only in the state of milk does not have the nature of curd.

original: gal te yod par 'gyur na ni 'o ma kho na la zho zhes bya bar 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur na ni 'o ma kho na la zho zhes bya bar 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If it did, then milk itself would be curd, but this is illogical.

original: de'i phyir 'o ma la ni zho'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'o ma la ni zho'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the entity of curd does not exist in milk.

original: / gang gi tshe 'o ma la zho'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gzhan gang zhig la srid par 'gyur de'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: / gang gi tshe 'o ma la zho'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gzhan gang zhig la srid par 'gyur de'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba med do //
translated: When the entity of curd does not exist in milk, then how could it exist in something else? Therefore, there is no transformation.

original: 'o ma dang zho'i gnas skabs las tha dad par ba lang gi khu ba'i rdzas zhes cung zad cig dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho'i gnas skabs las tha dad par ba lang gi khu ba'i rdzas zhes cung zad cig dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there observed to be a substance called ‚Äúcow‚Äôs milk‚Äù that is different from the states of milk, curd, and butter.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: dngos rnams yongs su 'gyur ba yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams yongs su 'gyur ba yang //
translated: the transformation of entities

original: yid kyis kyang ni 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yid kyis kyang ni 'dzin mi 'gyur //
translated: is not apprehended by the mind.

original: dngos po rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rags pa mthong ba lngas mi 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yongs su 'gyur ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rags pa mthong ba lngas mi 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The transformation of entities is not apprehended not only by the five faculties such as the eye that see gross objects such as the faculties themselves.

original: chod pa dang phra ba dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i don yongs su gcod par nus pa'i yin gyis kyang mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: chod pa dang phra ba dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i don yongs su gcod par nus pa'i yin gyis kyang mi 'dzin to //
translated: It is also not apprehended by the mind, which is able to discern objects that are hidden, subtle, and immaterial.

original: de ltar na yang da ltar ba //
analyzed: de ltar na yang da ltar ba //
translated: Even so,

original: yod par mi mkhas rnams kyis rtogs //
analyzed: yod par mi mkhas rnams kyis rtogs //
translated: the unwise conceive it to exist in the present.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis da ltar ba nyid kyi rgyu yongs su gyur pa ma dmigs mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i tshul gyis da ltar ba nyid kyi rgyu yongs su gyur pa ma dmigs mod kyi /
translated: Although the transformation of the present cause is not observed in the way that it has been explained,

original: de ltar na yang mi mkhas shing blun pa rang nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nges par mi zin pa rnams kyis da ltar ba de yod par rtog go //
analyzed: de ltar na yang mi mkhas shing blun pa rang nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nges par mi zin pa rnams kyis da ltar ba de yod par rtog go //
translated: still, the ignorant and foolish, who do not ascertain their own nature, conceive of the present as existent.

original: de ltar skye bo blun po la ltos nas da ltar ba zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bos yongs su brtag par nus pa yang ma yin pas dus gsum med do //
analyzed: de ltar skye bo blun po la ltos nas da ltar ba zhes bya bar rang gi ngo bos yongs su brtag par nus pa yang ma yin pas dus gsum med do //
translated: Thus, in reliance on the foolish, the present is not able to be conceived as having its own essential nature. Therefore the three times do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dus rnams ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dus rnams ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: The three times definitely exist,

original: @179b de'i rgyu dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @179b de'i rgyu dngos po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their cause, things, exist.

original: dus de ni rang nyid kyis lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po kho na nye bar bzung nas yongs su gcad par nus kyi /
analyzed: dus de ni rang nyid kyis lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po kho na nye bar bzung nas yongs su gcad par nus kyi /
translated: Since time does not have a body of its own, it can be ascertained only by taking hold of things.

original: rang nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It cannot be ascertained by itself.

original: de'i phyir dus mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pas dus yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus mngon par gsal ba'i rgyu mtshan yod pas dus yod do //
translated: Therefore, because the cause of the manifestation of time exists, time exists.

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: gal te de'i rgyu dngos po nyid yod na ni dus 'di yod par 'gyur ba zhig na srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i rgyu dngos po nyid yod na ni dus 'di yod par 'gyur ba zhig na srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If the cause of that, i.e., existence, existed, then time would exist. But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it does not exist, he says:

original: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: gnas med dngos po ga la yod //
translated: How can there be an existent without a basis?

original: 'di na dngos po skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams la gnas pa rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di na dngos po skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa rnams la gnas pa rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, for things that arise and disintegrate in every moment, endurance does not exist in any way.

original: gnas pa med pas kyang dus kyi rgyu dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa med pas kyang dus kyi rgyu dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And because endurance does not exist, the cause of time, i.e., existence, does not exist.

original: gnas pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nonexistence of endurance, he says:

original: mi rtag pas gnas ga la yod //
analyzed: mi rtag pas gnas ga la yod //
translated: How can there be endurance in the impermanent?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zos pa'i dngos po la gnas pa mi srid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zos pa'i dngos po la gnas pa mi srid do //
translated: Endurance of a thing that is consumed by impermanence is not possible.

original: gal te gnas pa yod na ni gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po slar rga ba dang 'brel par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa yod na ni gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po slar rga ba dang 'brel par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If endurance existed, then a thing endowed with endurance would not be connected again with aging,

original: rga ba ni gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga ba ni gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because aging is incompatible with endurance.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te dang por gnas gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te dang por gnas gyur na //
translated: If it endured first,

original: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mar rnyings par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not become old in the end.

original: phyis rnyings pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sngar nyid nas gnas pa med par rtogs par gyis shig /'di las kyang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: phyis rnyings pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sngar nyid nas gnas pa med par rtogs par gyis shig /'di las kyang gnas pa med do //
translated: Since it would absurdly follow that it would not become old later, understand that it does not endure from the start.üîΩAlso, this is stated:

original: 'di ltar / rnam shes gcig gis ji lta bur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rnam shes gcig gis ji lta bur //
translated: How could a single consciousness

original: don gnyis rnam par mi shes pa //
analyzed: don gnyis rnam par mi shes pa //
translated: perceive two objects?

original: de bzhin rnam par shes gnyis kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam par shes gnyis kyis //
translated: In the same way, two consciousnesses

original: don gcig rnam par mi shes so //
analyzed: don gcig rnam par mi shes so //
translated: do not perceive a single object.

original: gal te dngos po la gnas pa zhes bya ba zhig yod na ni de'i tshe rim gyis rnam par shes pa du ma'i shes byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po la gnas pa zhes bya ba zhig yod na ni de'i tshe rim gyis rnam par shes pa du ma'i shes byar 'gyur ro //
translated: If something called endurance existed in things, then it would be the object of many consciousnesses in sequence.

original: don gang zhig rnam par shes pa gcig gis dmigs pa de gal te rnam par shes pa gzhan phyis 'byung ba zhig gis dmigs na ni de'i tshe sngar mthong ba'i don la rnam par shes pa gzhan phyi mas gcod pa'i bar du gnas pas gnas pa yod par
analyzed: don gang zhig rnam par shes pa gcig gis dmigs pa de gal te rnam par shes pa gzhan phyis 'byung ba zhig gis dmigs na ni de'i tshe sngar mthong ba'i don la rnam par shes pa gzhan phyi mas gcod pa'i bar du gnas pas gnas pa yod par
translated: If the object that is observed by one consciousness is observed by another consciousness that arises later, then endurance would exist because the object that was seen earlier would endure until it was cut off by another consciousness that sees it later.

original: rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not possible,

original: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gcig gis bzung ba de @180a * //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya gnyi ga skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gcig gis bzung ba de @180a * //
translated: because both the consciousness and the object are momentary.

original: gzhan gyis bzung bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bzung bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And that which is grasped by one is not capable of being grasped by another.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no abiding.

original: 'di na mig la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po drug yin la gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin de rnams kyang yul drug yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di na mig la sogs pa rnams ni dbang po drug yin la gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin de rnams kyang yul drug yin zhing /
translated: Here, the six sense faculties are the eye, etc. The six objects are form, etc.

original: dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis kyang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang don gyi dbang gis kyang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And the six collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the sense faculties and objects.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang skad cig mar 'jig go zhes bya bar rang gi sde pa rnams la grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de thams cad ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang skad cig mar 'jig go zhes bya bar rang gi sde pa rnams la grags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all that is called consciousness here is dependently arisen and momentary, this is well known to our schools.

original: de'i phyir rang gi sde pa rnams kyis skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i yul 'dzin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa med par shes pa gcig gis don gnyis yongs su gcod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi sde pa rnams kyis skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i yul 'dzin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa med par shes pa gcig gis don gnyis yongs su gcod par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, our schools understand that a single consciousness cannot comprehend two objects, because it does not endure until the time of comprehending the object that arises in the second moment.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni yul lhan cig skyes pa yongs su bcad nas 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni yul lhan cig skyes pa yongs su bcad nas 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: The eye consciousness comprehends the object that arises with it and then ceases.üîΩSince it ceases, it cannot apprehend another object.

original: 'gags pas na yul gzhan dmigs par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gags pas na yul gzhan dmigs par mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: This is what they accept.

original: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin zhing de ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa de bzhin du de'i yul yang de'i shes pa don gnyis pa yongs su gcod pa'i dus na ni gnas pa ltar skad
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin zhing de ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa de bzhin du de'i yul yang de'i shes pa don gnyis pa yongs su gcod pa'i dus na ni gnas pa ltar skad
translated: Just as eye consciousness is momentary because it is dependently arisen and disintegrates immediately, so too its object is momentary because it is like the object of that consciousness at the time of comprehending a second object.

original: cig ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan gnyis kyis gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan gnyis kyis gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is not apprehended by a second consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags kyang rgyun 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pas na gang dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams kyi shes pa gzhan la de nyid do snyam du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'gags kyang rgyun 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pas na gang dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi mkhas pa rnams kyi shes pa gzhan la de nyid do snyam du snang ba yin no //
translated: Although it ceases together with consciousness, it is the cause of the arising of a subsequent moment of the same kind. Therefore, the consciousness of those who are not skilled in the nature of things thinks that it is the same.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no abiding.

original: tshul 'di ni gzhan dang ldan pa'i don can gyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi don dag la yang 'du byed 'dra ba'i rgyu rnams la 'du byed kyi skad cig snga phyir byung ba rnams gcig nyid du rtogs pa'i gnod pa byed par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni gzhan dang ldan pa'i don can gyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi don dag la yang 'du byed 'dra ba'i rgyu rnams la 'du byed kyi skad cig snga phyir byung ba rnams gcig nyid du rtogs pa'i gnod pa byed par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This method should be applied to the objects of consciousness that have a different meaning, such as the aggregates, which are the cause of the similarity of the aggregates.

original: gal te chos mngon pa las gzugs la sogs pa'i don lnga po rnams ni re re zhing rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes par bya ba 'don pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos mngon pa las gzugs la sogs pa'i don lnga po rnams ni re re zhing rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes par bya ba 'don pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the five objects such as form are not stated in the Abhidharma to be known by two consciousnesses each,

original: de ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: how is this not a contradiction?

original: ci chos mngon pa skad cig mar 'dzin par @180b khas mi len nam /
analyzed: ci chos mngon pa skad cig mar 'dzin par @180b khas mi len nam /
translated: Do you not accept that the Abhidharma holds that consciousness is momentary?

original: gal te khas mi len na ni de'i tshe bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khas mi len na ni de'i tshe bde bar gshegs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that, then it would not be the Sugata.

original: ci ste khas len na ni de'i tshe gzugs de mig gi rnam par shes pa ltar zhig pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste khas len na ni de'i tshe gzugs de mig gi rnam par shes pa ltar zhig pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par shes par 'gyur /
translated: If you do accept that, then how could consciousness arise from form that has already ceased, like eye consciousness?

original: 'o na chos mngon pa las 'dod pa 'di ji ltar drang zhen /
analyzed: 'o na chos mngon pa las 'dod pa 'di ji ltar drang zhen /
translated: Well then, how do you interpret the Abhidharma statement?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We will explain.üîΩThe consciousness that arises from a physical sense faculty only apprehends a present object. Both the object and consciousness cease in the next moment.

original: gang dbang po gzugs can las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni yul da ltar ba'i rnam pa yongs su gcod bar byed pa skye la yul dang rnam par shes pa de gnyis skad cig mar 'jig pas 'gags pa yin dang / phyi das gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang dbang po gzugs can las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni yul da ltar ba'i rnam pa yongs su gcod bar byed pa skye la yul dang rnam par shes pa de gnyis skad cig mar 'jig pas 'gags pa yin dang / phyi das gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Later, when mental consciousness arises, it is said to perceive the object.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis skye ba de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog cing 'byung ba na de'i rnam pa can nyid du skye ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i stobs kyis skye ba de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog cing 'byung ba na de'i rnam pa can nyid du skye ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de
translated: When it arises as the conception of consciousness arisen from the sense faculties, it arises in the aspect of that.üîΩBecause cause and effect are free from the conception of being the same or different and because the effect mostly conforms to the aspect of the cause,

original: nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang 'bras bu phal cher rgyu'i khyad par gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar yongs su brtags nas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes par bya bar
analyzed: nyid dang gzhan nyid du rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang 'bras bu phal cher rgyu'i khyad par gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar yongs su brtags nas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis shes par bya bar
translated: having analyzed in that way, it is explained that the object is known by two consciousnesses in terms of mundane convention.

original: bshad do // de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis don gcig rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad do // de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnyis kyis don gcig rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore one consciousness does not cognize one object.

original: gcig ni yul gyi rnam pa dngos su gcod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni yul gyi rnam pa dngos su gcod par byed pa ste /
translated: One directly cognizes the aspect of the object.

original: gang dang por skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang por skyes pa'o //
translated: That is the first to arise.

original: gnyis pas ni dngos su byed pa nyid du rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni dngos su byed pa nyid du rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The second line shows that consciousness does not directly perceive endurance.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i stobs kyis de ltar rtog cing skye ba na des kyang don de rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i stobs kyis de ltar rtog cing skye ba na des kyang don de rnam par shes so zhes nye bar 'dogs so //
translated: When it arises in the form of the thought ‚ÄúIt endures,‚Äù through the power of the sense consciousness, it is designated as the perception of that object.

original: tshul 'di gnas pa la yang rtag par nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul 'di gnas pa la yang rtag par nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This mode of endurance is not permanent.

original: gnas pa ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis gnas pa yin te /
translated: Endurance is the intrinsic identity of an entity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni dngos su 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni dngos su 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa yongs su gcad par mi nus so //
translated: That intrinsic identity cannot be ascertained by a consciousness that does not directly perceive it.

original: de'i phyir yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin pas gnas pa med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su gcad par bya ba ma yin pas gnas pa med la /
translated: Therefore, since it cannot be ascertained, endurance does not exist.

original: gnas pa med pa las kyang dngos po med pa yin dang dus kyang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa las kyang dngos po med pa yin dang dus kyang med do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: And since endurance does not exist, entities and time do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de da ltar ba'i dus kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas pas @181a * //
analyzed: gnas pa ni yod pa nyid de da ltar ba'i dus kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas pas @181a * //
translated: Endurance exists because it is the characteristic of the present.

original: ni da ltar ba'i dus mtshon par byed de gnas pa dang bral ba'i da ltar ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni da ltar ba'i dus mtshon par byed de gnas pa dang bral ba'i da ltar ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The present is indicated by the present participle, because the present is impossible without duration.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te dus la gnas yod na //
analyzed: gal te dus la gnas yod na //
translated: If duration exists in time,

original: gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then time would not be duration.

original: ci ste gnas med na gnas pa //
analyzed: ci ste gnas med na gnas pa //
translated: But if duration does not exist,

original: med par mtha' yang yod ma yin //üîΩde la gal te dus la gnas pa yod do snyam du sems na ni 'o na ni gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par mtha' yang yod ma yin // de la gal te dus la gnas pa yod do snyam du sems na ni 'o na ni gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even without duration, there would be no end of time.

original: dper na rten dang brten pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir khyim na yod pa'i lha sbyin khyim nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur te dus la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dper na rten dang brten pa dag tha dad pa'i phyir khyim na yod pa'i lha sbyin khyim nyid du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnas pa dus su mi 'gyur te dus la yod pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If you think that duration exists in time, then time would not be duration, just as a house does not become Devadatta because he is supported by it, since the supported and the supporter are different.

original: / de'i phyir dus kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas de dus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir dus kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas de dus kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not the nature of time, it is not the characteristic of time.

original: ci ste gnas pa med na ni gnas pa dang bral ba'i dus la mtha' yas te 'jig pa yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa med na ni gnas pa dang bral ba'i dus la mtha' yas te 'jig pa yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if duration does not exist, then there would be no end of time without duration, and destruction would not exist.

original: de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dus yun du gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dus yun du gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it would endure for the duration of the present.

original: dus de rtag pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang rtag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dus de rtag pa'i phyir da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang rtag par 'gyur na /
translated: And because that time is permanent, the present thing would also be permanent.

original: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yang ma yin te de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
translated: But this is not so, therefore endurance does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgnas pa de ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gnas pa de ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Objection:

original: de dang ldan pa'i dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Endurance exists because impermanence exists for things that possess it.

original: gnas pa dang bral ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rten med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid mi srid pa zhig na /
analyzed: gnas pa dang bral ba'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rten med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid mi srid pa zhig na /
translated: Since things that lack endurance do not exist, it is impossible for impermanence to lack a basis.

original: dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'ang yin te de'i phyir de yod pas gnas pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa'ang yin te de'i phyir de yod pas gnas pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But impermanence exists for things, therefore endurance also exists because it exists.

original: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni de dngos po las gzhan nyid dam gcig nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur na ni de dngos po las gzhan nyid dam gcig nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If so-called impermanence exists, then it would be different from things or it would be the same.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate that both are untenable, the text says:

original: gal te mi rtag dngos gzhan ni //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag dngos gzhan ni //
translated: If impermanence were a different thing,

original: dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur //
translated: then things would not be impermanent.

original: gcig na mi rtag nyid gang yin //
analyzed: gcig na mi rtag nyid gang yin //
translated: If they are the same, then how could

original: de nyid dngos de ga la gnas //
analyzed: de nyid dngos de ga la gnas //
translated: impermanence itself abide in that thing?

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po rtag par 'gyur na dngos po ni rtag pa yang ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid las gzhan nyid yod paüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po las gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dngos po rtag par 'gyur na dngos po ni rtag pa yang ma yin pas mi rtag pa nyid las gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If impermanence were a different thing from things, then because impermanence would be a different characteristic, things would be permanent. But since things are not permanent, impermanence is not a different thing.

original: ci ste gcig nyid 'dod na @181b yang de ltar na yang de las tha dad pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid dngos po yin par dngos po mi rtag pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gnas pa
analyzed: ci ste gcig nyid 'dod na @181b yang de ltar na yang de las tha dad pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid dngos po yin par dngos po mi rtag pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gnas pa
translated: If you assert that they are the same, then since it is impossible for them to be different, that which is impermanence is itself a thing. Since a thing has the nature of impermanence,

original: gtan mi srid pa kho na ste de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
analyzed: gtan mi srid pa kho na ste de'i phyir gnas pa med do //
translated: it is absolutely impossible for it to abide. Therefore abiding does not exist.

original: gnas pa med pas ni mi rtag pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin zhing gnas pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis med pas kyang dngos po med la /
analyzed: gnas pa med pas ni mi rtag pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin zhing gnas pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis med pas kyang dngos po med la /
translated: Since there is no enduring, impermanence also does not exist. Since neither enduring nor impermanence exist, entities do not exist.üîΩSince they do not exist, time also does not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir na dus kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na dus kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: This is established.üîΩPreviously, it was said:üîΩIf there is no enduring, how could there be entities?

original: gang sngar / gnas med dngos po ga la zhig / mi rtag pas gnas ga la yod //
analyzed: gang sngar / gnas med dngos po ga la zhig / mi rtag pas gnas ga la yod //
translated: If they are impermanent, how could they endure?

original: ces brjod pa de la smras pa /
analyzed: ces brjod pa de la smras pa /
translated: In response to that, it was said:

original: mi rtag pa nyid yod kyang gnas pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yod kyang gnas pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Even though impermanence exists, enduring definitely exists.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnas pa'i dus na ni gnas ches stobs dang ldan gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dus na ni gnas ches stobs dang ldan gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin la /
translated: At the time of enduring, enduring is very powerful and impermanence is not.

original: stobs chung bas stobs dang ldan pa 'joms par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: stobs chung bas stobs dang ldan pa 'joms par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is weak, it is not able to overcome the powerful.

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩmi rtag gnyi gar stobs chung der //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / mi rtag gnyi gar stobs chung der //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is also unreasonable, it is said:üîΩIf both are weak,

original: gnas pa stobs chung ma yin na //
analyzed: gnas pa stobs chung ma yin na //
translated: enduring is not weak.

original: phyi nas de dag nges par go //
analyzed: phyi nas de dag nges par go //
translated: Later, they will definitely be understood.

original: bzlog par ci yis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bzlog par ci yis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be seen to be reversed?

original: gal te gnas pa'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid stobs chung na gang gis na phyis chos mthun par gnas pa de 'joms par 'gyur ba phyi nas de stobs dang ldan pa nyid cis yin /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid stobs chung na gang gis na phyis chos mthun par gnas pa de 'joms par 'gyur ba phyi nas de stobs dang ldan pa nyid cis yin /
translated: If impermanence is weak at the time of endurance, then why would it later destroy endurance, which is similar to it? Why would it later possess power?

original: de'i phyir snga rol nyid du de ches stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga rol nyid du de ches stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it would not be powerful at the outset.

original: yang na ye nas ches stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ye nas ches stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, it would never be powerful.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rtag pa'am gnas pa med par 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rtag pa'am gnas pa med par 'gyur na 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, things would be permanent or enduring. But this is illogical.

original: de'i phyir de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.

original: gzhan yang / gal te mi rtag stobs chung min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mi rtag stobs chung min //
translated: Moreover, if impermanence is not weak,

original: dngos po kun la yod na ni //üîΩkun la'ang gnas pa med pa'am //
analyzed: dngos po kun la yod na ni // kun la'ang gnas pa med pa'am //
translated: and it exists for all things,üîΩthen all things would be nonenduring,

original: yang na thams cad mi rtag min //
analyzed: yang na thams cad mi rtag min //
translated: or else nothing would be impermanent.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid stobs chung ba ma yin pas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid stobs chung ba ma yin pas stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If impermanence is not weak, it would be powerful.

original: dngos po kun la gnas shing gal te dngos po mtha' dag la khyab nas gnas na ni de'i tshe thams cad la yang gnas pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po kun la gnas shing gal te dngos po mtha' dag la khyab nas gnas na ni de'i tshe thams cad la yang gnas pa med do //
translated: If it abides in all things and pervades all things, then at that time it does not abide in all things.

original: ci ste kun la mi gnas na ni de'i tshe chos thams cad mi rtag pa ma yin @182a * //
analyzed: ci ste kun la mi gnas na ni de'i tshe chos thams cad mi rtag pa ma yin @182a * //
translated: But if it does not abide in all things, then at that time all things would not be impermanent.

original: gyi / de'i cha 'ga' zhig ni rtag par 'gyur te gang na gnas pa ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gyi / de'i cha 'ga' zhig ni rtag par 'gyur te gang na gnas pa ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: But some part of it would be permanent, and that part in which it abides would be stronger.

original: cha 'ga' zhig ni mi rtag par 'gyur te gang na mi rtag pa nyid ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: cha 'ga' zhig ni mi rtag par 'gyur te gang na mi rtag pa nyid ches stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Some part of it would be impermanent, and that part in which it is impermanent would be stronger.

original: de ltar na thams cad mi rtag pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad mi rtag pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Thus, all things would not be impermanent.

original: yang na gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it would not abide.

original: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid 'di mtshan gzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba'am dus phyis 'byung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la / gal te rtag tu mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid 'di mtshan gzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba'am dus phyis 'byung ba zhig tu 'gyur grang na / de la / gal te rtag tu mi rtag nyid //
translated: Moreover, this impermanence would occur simultaneously with the characterized thing or it would occur later.üîΩIn that regard, if impermanence

original: yod na rtag tu gnas yod min te /
analyzed: yod na rtag tu gnas yod min te /
translated: always existed, then it would always exist without abiding.

original: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristic is not confused with the characterized thing.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid rtag tu rjes su 'brel na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid rtag tu rjes su 'brel na ni /
translated: If impermanence always follows,

original: de'i tshe gnas pa rtag tu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas pa rtag tu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then at that time endurance does not exist,

original: mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is followed by impermanence.

original: yang na rtag par 'gyur zin nas /
analyzed: yang na rtag par 'gyur zin nas /
translated: Or, having already become permanent,

original: phyi nas mi rtag par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon spang bar 'dod nas phyi nas dngos po mi rtag par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po de sngar gnas pa dang ldan pas rtag par gyur nas phyis mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pas mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes
analyzed: phyi nas mi rtag par 'gyur ro // gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon spang bar 'dod nas phyi nas dngos po mi rtag par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dngos po de sngar gnas pa dang ldan pas rtag par gyur nas phyis mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pas mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes
translated: later it would become impermanent.

original: bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If, wishing to avoid the error as explained, one asserts that later the thing becomes impermanent, then at that time, that thing having become permanent through previously possessing endurance, later it would become impermanent through possessing impermanence.

original: gang dngos po gcig rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dngos po gcig rtag pa yang yin la mi rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable to say that one thing is both permanent and impermanent.

original: yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because the characteristics of conditioned phenomena are mutually exclusive,üîΩIf endurance and impermanence

original: gal te gnas pa mi rtag dang // lhan cig dngos po la yod na //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa mi rtag dang // lhan cig dngos po la yod na //
translated: exist simultaneously in a thing,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: But,

original: mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: mi rtag log par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: If it is impermanent, it would be false,

original: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur //
translated: Or else, endurance would be false.

original: gal te dngos po de gnas pa de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa nyid log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po de gnas pa de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa nyid log par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that thing endures, then its impermanence would be false.

original: ci ste 'jig na ni de'i tshe gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur bas gnas pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste 'jig na ni de'i tshe gnas pa brdzun par 'gyur bas gnas pa mi rigs so //
translated: But if it is destroyed, then its endurance would be false. Therefore, endurance is not tenable.

original: gnas pa de med pas byang dngos po med la dngos po yod pa ma yin na yang de'i rten can gyi dus med pas dus rang bzhin med par grub bo //
analyzed: gnas pa de med pas byang dngos po med la dngos po yod pa ma yin na yang de'i rten can gyi dus med pas dus rang bzhin med par grub bo //
translated: Since endurance does not exist, time does not exist as a basis for it. Since time does not exist, time does not exist without a basis. Since time does not exist, the three times are not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po'i rgyu can gyi dus ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu can gyi dus ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Time that has things as its cause exists.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed 'das pa'i rten can 'das pa'i dus ni yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed 'das pa'i rten can 'das pa'i dus ni yod do //
translated: In this way, the past time that has the past formations as its basis exists.

original: gal te dngos po 'das pa med na ni bdag 'das pa'i dus na @182b 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to snyam du 'das pa la dmigs pa dran pa ci'i yul can zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'das pa med na ni bdag 'das pa'i dus na @182b 'di lta bu dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to snyam du 'das pa la dmigs pa dran pa ci'i yul can zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: If the past thing does not exist, then what is the object of the memory that focuses on the past and thinks, ‚ÄúI was like this or like that in the past‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi dran pa yod pas dngos po'i rgyu can gyi dus yod pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi dran pa yod pas dngos po'i rgyu can gyi dus yod pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since there is memory that has that as its object, time that is the cause of things does exist.

original: 'dir dran pa 'di nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul kho na la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir dran pa 'di nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i yul kho na la 'jug ste /
translated: Here, this memory engages only the object that was experienced.

original: da ltar ba'i yul rnam par shes pas dngos su dmigs bzhin pa la ni dran pas dgongs pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i yul rnam par shes pas dngos su dmigs bzhin pa la ni dran pas dgongs pa ci yang med do //
translated: Since the present object is directly perceived by consciousness, memory has no function with regard to it.

original: ci ste lhan cig tu 'byung bar nges par da ltar ba'i yul can yang yod mod kyi de ltar na yang de gnas skabs der gtso bo la rten par mi byed de /
analyzed: ci ste lhan cig tu 'byung bar nges par da ltar ba'i yul can yang yod mod kyi de ltar na yang de gnas skabs der gtso bo la rten par mi byed de /
translated: If it is certain that memory arises simultaneously with consciousness, then there is an object of the present. However, even so, it does not rely on the primary mind at that time.

original: de 'jug pa shas che ba'i gnas skabs la ltos nas dngos po gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gi mtshan nyid byed pas dngos po 'das pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na la dran pa'i mtshan nyid ches gsal gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no
